loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is involved in a hog-raising business. She is 66 years old, married and has eight children. Her older children don’t live with them anymore. She said that she works hard to provide for the needs of her household. She has been raising hogs for more than a few years now and she is happy that it gives her income. She also opened a small store where she sells vinegar, sugar and other merchandise. She said that the store helps provide for some of their daily needs. She hopes to improve her family’s living condition and she does her best to achieve that. She applied for a loan of PHP15,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., where she is a member. If granted, she will use the loan to buy feed for her hogs and she will also purchase additional merchandise for her store.

loans.use: To purchase hogfeed and merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Sonia Margarita

texts.es: Sonia Margarita A. D. G. D. 56 años D. edad, es una madre soltera, quien vive junto a su hijo D. 9 años D. edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar, así mismo vive junto a su madre D. 77 años D. edad. Sonia posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, el cual es el único modo D. ganarse la vida, y con cuyas  ganancias deben salir adelante. La tienda esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, en Ilopango,  en el departamento D. San Salvador. Sonia es una mujer muy trabajadora quien desea poder salir adelante con su familia, así brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida sobre todo para su pequeño hijo. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio comprando productos alimenticios como sopas instantáneas, sodas, pan, café, y así mismo productos D. primera necesidad como detergentes, jabones y otros más. Este negocio es muy importante para el sostenimiento del hogar D. Sonia por lo que es D. mucha importancia poder mejorarlo con todo lo necesario para percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sonia Margarita A. D. G. is 56 years old and is a single mother. She lives together with her 9 year old son, who studies, and also with her 77 year old mother. Sonia has a store where she sells grocery items, which her is only way of earning a living and improving her situation. Her shop is located in her house, in Ilopango, in the San Salvador department. Sonia is a very hard-working woman who wants to improve her family's situation, and give them a better quality of life, especially to her little son. She is seeking a loan to stock her business with items such as instant soups, sodas, bread, coffee, and other necessary household goods such as detergents, soaps, etc. This business is very important in maintaining Sonia's home and for this reason she puts great importance on improving it in every way necessary to obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery items

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariana de 55 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, tiene tres hijos y su esposa vende pollos. El tiene una papelería (llamada en Ecuador “bazar”) con cuadernos, laminas, plumas, y todo tipo de papelería. Esta papelería ya la tiene hace mucho tiempo con la ayuda de su esposa ha podido incrementarla y salir de la crisis que estaba su familia.

Su esposa le ayuda en la papelería y también le ayuda en los gastos del hogar vendiendo pollos, trabajan desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm. Los cuadernos los venden a $ 1.20, plumas a $ 0.40, laminas a $ 0.15. Para poder incrementar la mercadería de su negocio el quiere comprar cuadernos, libros y plumas para la papelería.  

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y sabe que sus hijos han terminados sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mariana is 55 years old, lives in the suburban zone of Fortín de Guayaquil, and has 3 children. His wife sells chickens and he has a stationary store (in Ecuador called a "bazar") with notebooks, prints, pens, and every type of stationary. He's had the store for a long time and with the help of his wife has been able to expand the business and get out of the crisis that his family was in. His wife helps him in the stationary store and also helps with the household expenses by selling chickens. They work from 7:00 A.M. until 10:00 P.M. The notebooks sell for $1.20, pens for $.40, and the prints for $.15. To increase the merchandise the business has, he wants to buy notebooks, books, and pens for the store. In the future he wants to finish constructing his house and know that his children have completed their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy notebooks, books, and pens

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, tiene 54 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos  y esposo Juan es profesor. Su actividad económica principal es vender comida, Su restaurante está ubicado en la calle Tarapaca del distrito de San Jerónimo del departamento del Cusco.  Gladys pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio” y ella es la presidenta del banco comunal. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplos papa, carne, fideos y muchas cosas más.   
        
Gladys se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gladis is 54 years old. She is married, has two children, and her husband, Juan, is a teacher. Her main business is selling food. Her restaurant is located on Tarapaca street, in the district of San Jerónimo, in the department of Cusco. Gladys belongs to the “Vírgen del Carmen de Huambutio” communal bank and she is the president. She needs the loan to buy more ingredients, such as potatoes, meat, noodles, and many other things. Gladys is grateful for the opportunity granted her through this program and she promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more ingredients, such as potatoes, meat, noodles, and many other things

loans.name: Paterna's Group

texts.en: Paterna B. is from the village of Lawis. She is 55 years old and married. Paterna is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. To make a living, Paterna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store business running a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Paterna has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2007, Paterna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paterna has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Paterna is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Paterna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy goods and other products

loans.name: Ebenezer #5 Group

texts.en:
Samuel P., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Ebenezer #5.

He is 32 years old, single and has one child who is 14 years old. He was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to financial difficulty.   

For 8 years, he has been selling phone cards on Broad Street in Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 17,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 77,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more phone cards. 

He describes himself as an easy-going man. His goal is to grow his business and continue his education.

loans.use: To buy more phone cards.

loans.name: Bunneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunneang K. (pictured here), is 46 years old and her husband, Mr. Ngoun Men, also 48 years old, live in a village along National Road Number two approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1985 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. Two of them have full time employment and other two children are in school. 

Bunneang sells roast beef, and sandwiches on baguettes from her home. Her husband is a taxi driver. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Susan Gabriela

texts.es:
Susan pertenece al Banco Comunal Obreras hace 1 año y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro y la responsabilidad.
Susan es casada y tiene 2 hijas pequeñas, vive en la casa de sus suegros, Susan y su esposo tienen un taller de Metal Mecánica en un local alquilado, tiene además personal que trabaja con ellos, Susan se encarga de la administración del negocio, como cobranzas, compra de materiales.
Susan solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de fierros.
Los sueños de Susan son tener una casa propia y un local propio para el taller.
texts.en:
Susan joined the Communal Bank “Obreras” (Workers) a year ago and what she likes most about being a member is having the incentive to save and be responsible. She is married, has two young daughters, and lives at the house of her in-laws. Susan and her husband operate a metal workshop from a rented location. They also have a staff that works for them. Susan is in charge of managing the business. Her duties include collecting payments and buying materials.

Susan is requesting a loan for 2000 PEN to buy iron. She dreams of having her own home and acquiring her own space for her workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase iron

loans.name: Loun

texts.en:
Loun S. is a local farmer who raises pigs and rice to earn a living. She is 34 years of age and is a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where she lives with other family members. Loun S. has a life partner in her husband who is a professional teacher in the public secondary school. The couple has given birth to two kids, both of whom are enrolled in school.

In view of the coming farming season, Loun S. wants to buy a cultivating machine to provide a plowing service for other farmers. As she lacks money to buy one, Loun S. has decided to request a loan from Kiva. She will use these funds to buy a machine to begin providing her service.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine to provide a plowing service.

loans.name: Muhammed

texts.en: Muhammed  is a 42-year-old man married to a businesswoman with six children aged 22, 18, 16, 14, 11, and 9 years. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda with his family in his own house. He is a taxi driver meaning he is into the transport business. He has been in it for the last 18 years, having started as a conductor. He says it is a challenging business but says he sees himself progressing in the near future for better transport business deals. This is Muhammed‘s first loan from HOFOKAM and he intends to buy material like cement and iron sheets for construction of his commercial house intended for rentals.

loans.use: To buy cement and iron sheets for construction of his commercial house for rentals.

loans.name: Ria

texts.en:
Ria L. is from the village of Brgy. Villaros, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 30 years old. Ria is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Ria owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Ria is just starting this business.

In 2010, Ria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for cooked food for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20 year old single woman who lives with her parents. She is still attending university to get her certificate in accounting. And, at the same time, she runs a home business; she works as an accountant presenting accounting reports to members of her community and local companies. She is thankful for her business income; it allows her to cooperate with her family to satisfy the heavy expenses.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new laptop instead of her used one, to be able to provide faster reports. In the future, she plans to finish her education, get her certificate, and then develop her business by opening an accounting office.

loans.use: To purchase a new laptop.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom lives in Chichawatni which is a small city located in Punjab Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a 3 room brick house with her family in the area named Gulistan Colony. She moved here a few years ago. She is married with M. A. and has 4 children.  

Her son operates a donkey cart for a transportation business. He provides loading services to his customers and earns income. Her 3 daughters stay at home and help her in her domestic chores. Kalsoom couldn’t provide them an education due to poor financial conditions. She is a very supportive lady, always ready to help her family in difficult time. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s loading business. He will invest the loan by purchasing of a new donkey cart because the old cart has become worn and rotted in different areas.  The new cart will carry more load on it and provide better services to his customers. 

Kalsoom is confident that through this investment her son will keep continue his business and improves his earning. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.  

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kalsoom.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for a transport business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca B., from the village of Rizaluna Cordon, is 58 years old, married and has six grown children. To make a living, Francisca owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over four years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Francisca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 8000 PHP to be used for the same purpose. Francisca plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 57-year-old married man and a father of five children. He sells sweets and has 40 years of experience in this field. Since 1986 he has also owned a grocery store. Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary raw materials for making sweets in his factory. Ali’s sweets are famous in his region, and requested by customers. Ali is happy with what he has achieved and hopes to keep on.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for making sweets

loans.name: Rwentobo Tukore Women's Group

texts.en: Rwentobo is the group that B. Constance belongs to. She is 35 years old and married with one child. She has a salon business selling cosmetics, hair treatments, plaiting and so on. Constance is able to make 70,000/= as profit per week. Her salon is situated in Rwentobo Trading Centre and she serves the local people in her area. She has been operating her salon for over 10 years using personal savings from the retail shop that she owned before. She needs a loan to buy more cosmetics and stock more weaves for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and stock more weaves for sale

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El señor Jaime Sánchez Q. tiene 51 años y vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos en la ciudad de Bogotá. Posee un puesto estacionario en el cual vende galletas, confites, chocolates, cigarrillos, gaseosas y jugos; además, presta el servicio de llamadas a teléfonos celulares.  El negocio está ubicado en el barrio Chapinero cerca al teatro nacional Fanny Mickey, famoso por realizar las mejores funciones teatrales y musicales del país. El microempresario tiene 26 años de estar ubicado en el mismo sitio donde es ampliamente conocido por los empleados y transeúntes frecuentes del sector.  Es amigo de casi todos sus clientes con quienes  comenta las noticias del día mientras les vende un refresco o les regala un fósforo para que enciendan un cigarrillo. Cuando observa vehículos o personas sospechosas no duda en informarle a los vigilantes privados de los edificios cercanos para que estos le reporten a la policía. Su jornada laboral comienza a las 8 A.M. y termina a las 7 P.M. Su inclinación por el comercio la heredó de su padre quien fue lotero en un principio y luego tuvo un puesto similar al suyo en el mismo sector de Chapinero. Otros 6 hermanos del señor Jaime también son comerciantes. Este es el tercer crédito que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra al por mayor de cigarrillos, chocolates y galletas. De ésta forma obtiene importantes descuentos por pago en efectivo y volumen de compra. El promedio de ventas diarias es de $ 150.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 35%. En un futuro, el señor Jaime desea alquilar un local para seguir con su negocio y vender, además,  desayunos y almuerzos. Este proyecto le permitiría incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus condiciones de trabajo, porque a veces sufre por la inclemencia del tiempo como en la reciente temporada invernal. En todo caso, el microempresario se declara un hombre feliz y junto a su negocio hace parte del paisaje Bogotano.
texts.en:
Jaime Sánchez Q., age 51, lives with his wife and their four children in the city of Bogotá.  He has a stationary stand where he sells cookies, sweets, cigarettes, soft drinks, and juice.  He also provides cell phone call service.  The business is located in the Chapinero neighborhood close to the Fanny Mickey National Theater.  The theater is famous for putting on the best theatrical shows and musicals in the country.

This small businessman has been located in the same site for 26 years.  He is widely known by the workers and people who frequently pass by the area.  He is friends with almost all of his customers.  He chats with them about the day’s news while he sells them refreshments or gives them a match to light a cigarette.  When he sees a suspicious car or person, he does not hesitate to tell the private watchmen in the buildings that are nearby.  He does this so that the watchmen can report it to the police.

His work day starts at 8:00 a.m., and it ends at 7:00 p.m.  He got his propensity for business from his father.  In the beginning his father sold lottery tickets.  Later, his father had a stand similar to the Jaime’s stand in the same area of Chapinero.  Six siblings of Jaime are also merchants.

This is his third loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He plans to use the loan to buy wholesale cigarettes, chocolates, and cookies.  This way he gets important discounts for paying in cash and buying in volume.  His average daily sales are 150,000 COP; and his profit margin is 35%.

In the future Jaime wants to rent a place to continue his business and to sell breakfast and lunch.  This project will allow him to increase his sales and improve his work conditions.  He sometimes suffers due to inclement weather like the recent winter season.

In any case, this small businessman says that he is a happy man.  Together with his business, he is part of the landscape in Bogota.

loans.use: To buy wholesale cigarettes, chocolates, and cookies

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
Elvis vive en alquiler en la zona de Villa Dolores, de la ciudad de  El Alto, tiene dos hijos, el señor es chofer taxista, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantienen; en anterior crédito realizó el mantenimiento de su movilidad. Ahora necesita otro crédito para  comprar un motor a medio uso y transformar su movilidad de gasolina a gas licuado, para ahorrar el costo de combustible. El señor se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Elvis lives in a rented space in the community of Villa Dolores in the city of El Alto. He has two children and he works as a taxi driver. He is able to support his children with his earnings. The previous loan was use to carry out maintenance repairs to his car. Currently he requires a new loan to purchase a new engine and to convert his car from using gasoline to propane, in order to save on fuel expenses. He is very happy with the loans that he has received. 

His personal history qualifies him to access a new loan and he is considered to be a good client.

loans.use: To purchase an engine for his car.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok N. is a 50-year-old woman from Phnom Penh City.  She works at a factory as a worker.  She has been in her job since 2002 and has a formal salary. She has no life partner because she has been divorced from her husband for many years.   Mrs. Sok N. has one child who works as a security guard in the factory.  

Mrs. Sok N. is seeking a loan to buy a cow to rent out to farmers to earn additional income. The cow can also be used for breeding purposes so she can raise its offsprings.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren A. is 44 years old and lives in Sevkar village, Ijevan area. He is married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. Suren works as a bus driver and is also busy in animal husbandry. He says it is very hard work. His family helps him to raise cows and calves to support their family.
This is Suren’s sixth loan from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for $1800 to buy a lot of fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy a lot of fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Eulalia; La socia tiene 41 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 3 hijos (22,15,9); la socia trabaja realizando manualidades en el barrio de magisterio, el pertenece a  una casa taller en la cual realizan trabajos en base a tejidos en palitos y crochet, la socia también realiza trabajos en macramé, específicamente todo tipo de adornos y carteras. La socia desea comprar materiales y vender sus trabajos, ella desea a futuro independizarse y mostrar sus trabajos en ferias y que sus ingresos sean mayores para seguir apoyando a su familia. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar trabajos en macramé y tejidos.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Patrón San Sebastian", which is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

The member is Eulalia, who is 41 years old and married with 3 children, who are 9, 15, and 22 years old.  She works making handcrafts in the Magisterio neighborhood.  She belongs to a workshop in which she makes items that are knitted on small sticks or crocheted.  She also does macramé work, specifically all kinds of decorations and bags.  She wants to buy materials and sell her items.  She wants to become independent in the future and show her items in fairs, and she wants her income to increase in order to continue supporting the family.  She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of materials to make macramé and knitted items.

She is happy with the loan granted to her and she is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make macramé and knitted items.

loans.name: Lidia Maritza

texts.es: La señora Lidia Maritza García T. se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas en el centro comercial polvos azules tiene su negocio desde mayo del dos mil diez y de esa forma genera ingresos para cubrir sus gastos personales ,tiene un hijo de veintidós años al cual ayuda es sus estudios universitarios su sueño a futuro es hacer crecer mas sus negocio para poder costear los estudios de su hijo y además le gustaría comprarse una casa , la solicitante invertirá el dinero en comprar mercadería por cambio de estación como son chompas pantalones y otros tiene buenas referencias personales es por ello que se propone el crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Lidia Maritza García T. sells women’s clothing in the Polvos Azules (Blue Powders) Shopping Center.  She has had her business since May 2010 and, through it, has generated income to cover her personal expenses.  She has a 22 year old son whom she helps and who studies at university. 

Her dream is to make her business grow in order to be able to pay for her son’s university fees.  In addition, she would like to buy a house. She will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise for the change of season such as sweaters and pants.  She has good personal references, and that’s why she has applied for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for the changing season

loans.name: Alejandra Cristina

texts.es: Alejandra Cristina tiene 31 años, por lo que tiene 3 hijos que están a su cargo. La señora se dedica a una pulpería, principalmente golosinas, pan, detergentes, refrescos naturales, galletas entre otros productos. Este es el primer financiamiento que realiza, pues siempre está pensando en mejorar los ingresos de su familia. Pues los inicio con ahorros propios, para comenzar su actividad. Con este crédito comprara golosinas, refrescos, galletas y detergentes. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda variada que en donde ofrezca muchas cosas.
texts.en: Alejandra Cristina is 31 years old and has three children. She owns a small grocery store, selling candy, bread, laundry detergent, soda, and cookies, among other things. She started her business with her own savings. Alejandra Cristina has been looking for a way to increase her family's income. This is her first loan, and she will use it to buy candy, soda, cookies, and laundry detergent. Her goal is to stock a greater variety of products in her store.

loans.use: To purchase candy, soda, cookies, and laundry detergent.

loans.name: Amado

texts.es: Don Amado I., es una persona casada, tiene 34 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos, 2 de los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de artículos de consumo diario, como también a la elaboración de canastas de plástico, lleva 15 años de tener una tienda, inició vendiendo cosméticos, quiere ver su tienda bien surtido y con muchos clientes. Decide acudir a ASDIR para solicitar un préstamos que servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo para la tienda, le servirá para comprar mas mercadería: azucar, sopas instántaneas, arroz, frijol, incaparina, jabón y entre otros productos mas. Espera mejorar su negocio y su condición de vida.
texts.en: Amado I. is married, 34 and never had the opportunity to study.  He now has 5 children, 2 of which are students.  He works selling basic goods  and has run his own store for 15 years; he and also makes plastic baskets.  Amado started by selling cosmetics, and wants to continue to grow his business to see sales and his client base increase. He seeks a loan with ASDIR to buy inventory of basic foodstuffs such as: sugar, soup mixes, rice, beans, soap and other products. Amado looks forward to improving his business and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Claribel

texts.es:
La señora Claribel Gómez Pérez, vive en el barrio de san fráncico, ella  es casada con el señor Gabriel Ángel Sánchez Jiménez, con quien procreo  tres hijos: Gabriela Lizbeth de quince años, Brianda Itzel  de de siete años y las mas pequeña es kely claribel de once meses de edad.

    Ella se dedica a la venta de cosmético  de la marca  avon, en donde lleva seis meses,  y nos cometa que  se inspiro en esta actividad para apoyar asu esposo con los ingresos de su hogar y así tener como sacar adelante a su pequeña  familia.


    Cometa que para dedicarse a este pequeño negocio la animo a una vecina quien tambien se dedica a  distribuir  los productos de avon,   y la invito  que  se asocien  y trabajen juntas así tener como obener sus propio dinero.

  Lo que mas desea es que con esta actividad lo tener sus propios a  horros para que  con ello tenga su  propio negocio y  así  apoyar a sus hijos que están estudiando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claribel Gómez Pérez lives in the San Francisco neighborhood.  She’s married to Mr. Gabriel Ángel Sánchez Jiménez with whom she had three children: Gabriela Lizbeth, 15, Brianda Itzel, 7 and the youngest, Kely Claribel, 11 months.

She has been selling Avon brand cosmetics for the last six months and she comments to us that she was inspired to go into this business in order to help her husband meet household expenses and be able to raise their small family.

She comments that a neighbor who also sells Avon products encouraged her to go into this small business.  She invited her to be her partner and to work together to have a way to earn their own money.

What she’d like to accomplish the most with this activity is to have her own savings to set up a business of her own and support her children who are studying.

loans.use: to buy Avon brand cosmetics to resell in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
Rosa es una señora de 45 años de edad, es viuda y vive con sus 3 hijos en casa propia que esta ubicada en el caserío El Papayo del Algarrobo en el distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. Rosa asume hoy en día todos los gastos de l hogar y es por eso que es una mujer muy trabajadora.

La actividad que ella desarrolla es la agricultura. Cuenta con terreno agrícola en el que actualmente tiene limón y mango en producción así como maíz.  Además del cultivo mencionado, Rosa se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y de pavos que luego comercializa en el mercado local. Rosa recibe el apoyo de uno de sus hijos que trabaja en labores agrícolas también. Ambos se apoyan en las actividades que realizan y existe una buena relación familiar. 

Rosa solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de limón y en la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus ovinos y pavos para  así poderlos vender a un mejor precio y seguir creciendo en su actividad. 
Rosa tiene muchos deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida y este préstamo le permitirá aumentar sus ventas, para hacerlo.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 45 years old, a widow, and she lives with her 3 children in a house of their own. It is located in the community of El Papayo del Agarrobo in the district of Tambogrande, Piura. Rosa assumes responsibility of all of the household expenses which is why she is a very hardworking woman.

Her business activity is agriculture. She has a plot of farm land where she cultivates lemons, mangoes, and corn. In addition to the mentioned cultivations, Rosa also raises sheep and poultry. She resells them at a local market. Rosa receives support by one of her children who also works in agriculture. They help each other in their activities and they enjoy a good family relationship.

Rosa requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1200 nuevos soles which will be used to purchase fertilizers for her lemon plantation. She will also purchase balanced feed to raise her sheep and poultry to be able to sell them at a better price and to keep developing her business. Rosa has many dreams of improving their life. This loan will help her increase her sales and to reach her goal.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her lemon plantation.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with four school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees. 

For the past 5 years, Lydia has been operating a retail shop business, selling household consumables like sugar, tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour and rice. In addition, she also supplies fresh milk, which contributes as her other source of income. 

With this loan for 20,000 KES, Lydia wants to repair her freezer to store fresh milk for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: repair her freezer

loans.name: Christian Ivan

texts.es:
Christian Ivan tiene 20 años, es soltero vive con los padres no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Christian se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol, las compras las realiza en Comercial "Hnos. Olivos" cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abonos para los cultivos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como la falta de terreno ya que el alquiler es muy alto. Su sueño es comprar terrenos para sembrar.

Le gusta jugar boly.
texts.en: Christian Ivan is 20 years old, single, has no children and lives with his parents. He lives in the village of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos, Ecuador. He is part of the Nuevo Horizonte (New Horizons) community bank in the Cachely Grande precinct of Ventanas. This community bank is focused on short-cycle agriculture such as corn, rice and beans. Christian makes a living in agriculture, in particular farming corn, rice and beans. He makes his purchases every month at "Hermanos Olivos" and sells his products at the markets at the same location. He is requesting the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his crops. With the loan's support, he will be able to meet his economic needs. He confronts challenges like a lack of land since rent is very high. His dream is to buy land to farm. He enjoys playing volleyball.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Jocelyn has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell.

Jocelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sobir

texts.en:
Sobir is a very experienced taxi driver who supports himself and his family by driving his taxi around the city of Gafurov, Tajikistan. He has been providing transportation services for over 25 years and is still going strong. Sobir currently drives a German-made car, an Opel, one of the most popular car brands in Tajikistan. His monthly income is typically around $300. Sobir would like to continue providing reliable transportation and has requested a loan of $2000 USD to have some work done on his car. We are happy for this opportunity to help Sobir as he works hard to make a living.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for a thorough car repair.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “SEÑOR D. LOS MILAGROS D. CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco pertenece al distrito D. Huanchac, Provincia D. Cusco, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel; la socia tiene 62 años; la socia es conviviente;  La socia tiene 1 hijo y ella se dedica a la administración y atención D. sus picantería en casa, la socia cocina y venD. chicha con fresas llamada frutillada, la socia trabaja en su misma casa con su negocio, ella implemento un espacio para ahorrarse los alquileres,  la socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. ingredientes, como arroz, papas, para elaborar los diferentes potajes, también D. sea invertir en la compra D. maíz y D. frutilla para la chicha y cerveza. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. ingredientes, cerveza.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Isabel belongs to the Señor D. los Milagros D. Chimpahuaylla Communal Bank.  The bank is in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Isabel is 62 years old, has a life partner, and has one child.  She manages and tends her restaurant at home.  She cooks and sells “chicha” (a corn based drink) with strawberries.  This is called “frutillada”.  She works with her business from her own house.  She set up a space at home in order to save paying rent.

She wants the loan to buy ingredients like rice and potatoes to make different stews.  She will also buy corn and strawberries for chicha and beer.

She is very satisfied and grateful for the support she’ll get and commits to pay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and beer.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul started his El Paso, Texas-based body shop, A.R.C. Express Auto and Body Paint, because he wanted to provide reliable service to his community while providing secure employment to its hard-working members. Before opening his shop, Raul worked as the manager of the paint department at a large auto shop. However, after being forced to lay off many of the employees under his charge, Raul decided to go out on his own. 

A.R.C. Express Auto opened in September 2010 and offers its customers any auto body service from dent repair to complete paint jobs. Raul used his 10 years of experience, including time working with the U.S. Army, to start the business. He hired and receives ongoing support from three of the employees laid off by his old employer, including an old manager who helps Raul estimate paint and labor costs. 

Raul says his biggest success to date has been keeping the business open and successful while navigating a confusing city-permit process, which nearly led to the close of his shop. Of this, he says, “In order to keep your business legal, you need to get the right city permits. I would call in and get a different answer from each person regarding these permits. Ultimately, I had to pay someone to figure it out for me because I couldn’t start the shop and engage in that process at the same time.”  Since he started the shop with his personal finances, he said that the strain caused by this added necessity nearly forced him to shut down the business.

However, his loan from Kiva partner ACCION Texas-Louisiana helped Raul overcome this difficulty. He used the loan to make payroll, pay for paint and supplies, and pay off a mortgage on some land, which has since been sold and the money brought back to his business. Without the loan, Raul says, “I would have had to shut down the shop. ACCION Texas helped me see the options available to me.”

In the future, Raul hopes to stay true to his community-oriented business policy. He says, “My goal is to hire some disabled veterans and people with disabilities and give back to the community. My goal is not to get rich; I want to give people a workplace where they come in, enjoy what they do, and go home happy.”  He says that one day he hopes to open another establishment, such as a dance hall, that community organizations can use at an affordable price for recreational functions.

After nearly a year in business, Raul offers the following advice to aspiring business owners: “Make sure you do your homework, and, most importantly, make sure you engage with your customers and the people who affect your business face-to-face.”  With this loan, Raul was able to overcome the initial challenges of opening his business. Now, he can continue to give members of his community a secure job that provides reliable, quality services to the residents of El Paso.

loans.use: to make payroll, pay for supplies and pay off the remaining mortgage on his land

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman who lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 38 years old and has 4 school-aged children. For the past 3 years, she has operated a specialized retail store providing daily use merchandise such as sugar, salt, vinegar, shampoo, laundry and bath soap and many other items. The business basically caters to day-to-day consumption. Marilou is able to generate a monthly income of PHP 5,000 from store operations alone, not to mention her other sources of income.

Earlier this year, Marilou joined GDMPC to have access to financial services. This loan application is her first cycle of transaction drawn from the cooperative. She has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase grocery products to sell profitably. As she sells more stock, more cash flows in. Marilou plans to use the anticipated revenue from this investment for business expansion and to buy necessary store facilities to improve business and service quality.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products to sell profitably.

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres is a 53-year-old married man with five children. The oldest child is 22 years old.

Andres is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Andres works hard to support his family, especially his children's education. One of her daughters needs books for school and Andres does not have the capacity right now.

Andres requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and books for his daughter. He hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and books for his daughter.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 47-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children. He has owned a coffee shop since 2008. People from different areas and villages pass by his shop to enjoy their time and relax benefiting from his delicious coffee and snacks. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase provisions and supplies needed. He is positive and plans to further expand his business. He hopes to open a new branch of his shop in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase provisions and supplies needed for his cafe.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a married woman with one child who is too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provisioning of family basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and water. 

She has operated a retail shop for the past one year; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu because of easy access to affordable loans.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Emerson Remberto

texts.es: El sr. Emerson es una persona responsable que se dedica al servicio  de ayudante Mecánico de Motocicletas, tiene experiencia en este rubro hace un año atrás, y según referencias que obtuvimos es una persona responsable que trabaja todos los días, tiene 21 años y como es joven él no cuenta con un capital propio por lo cual vino  y nos solicitó un crédito para mejorar el servicio al que se dedica, porque invertira en herramientas
texts.en: Emerson is a responsible person who works as an assistant motorcycle mechanic.  He has one year's experience in this line of work and, according to references that we obtained, he is a responsible person who works every day.  He is 21 years old and, as he is young, he doesn't have his own capital which is why he came and asked us for a loan, so that he can improve the service that he provides.  He will invest in buying tools.

loans.use: to buy tools for repairing motorcycles

loans.name: Remely

texts.en: Remely is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Remely has a shop that sells hammers, hand gloves and weighing scales. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy stocks of hammers, gloves and weighing scales. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Remely hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of hammers, gloves and weighing scales.

loans.name: Yanjinlham

texts.en: Yanjinlham is 68 years old and lives with her husband in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is a retired old man who stays at home and her kids live independently. She started her grocery retailing business in 2002 by renting a counter in the market. Now she sells grocery and diary products. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to save her winter supply. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I have done everything for my children. Now that they are living independently, it is time to expand my business". She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy vegetables.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Amable

texts.es:
Amable  es una mujer que por 15 años se ha dedicado a la elaboración de ropa de vestir ,y con esta labor ha contribuido a la manutención y progreso de su familia.
Hace algunos años doña Amable fue diagnosticada con diabetes, y esto le afectó en el desarrollo de su actividad productiva, es por esta razón que en este momento no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder invertir. 
En lugar de echarse atrás , ella ha decidido desarrollar nuevas ideas como son la elaboración de ropa de casa como colchas, cortinas , juegos de baño y otros artículos que le piden sus clientes, al no tener el efectivo para la compra de los materiales, necesita un crédito que le facilite salir adelante con este proyecto y así levantar su producción y poder ampliar y remodelar su cocina , uno de las metas que tiene en este momento junto a su esposo e hijo, con los que vive.
texts.en: Amable has worked for 15 years making clothing, and with this work she has been able to contribute to supporting her family. A few years ago, Amable was diagnosed with diabetes, which has affected her productivity and is the reason she now finds herself without sufficient capital to invest. Instead of giving up, she has decided to develop new ideas, like producing bedspreads, curtains, bath mats and other items requested by her customers. As she doesn't have the necessary funds to buy materials, she needs a loan to continue with this project and to increase production, as well as to remodel her kitchen, an aim she shares with her husband and son, with whom she lives.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and other materials to make bedspreads and household linens.

loans.name: Maria Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 59 años y vive en una aldea del municipio de La Lima en el departamento Cortes. La señora es soltera y tiene 6 hijos que son mayores de edad. Ella vive en la casa de un hijo, lo cual está casado. 

Doña Maria aprendió a coser cuando era pequeña. Con la ayuda de su ingenio, compró su primera maquina y empezó a prosperar. Hace 15 años puso su negocio de elaboración y venta de forros de muebles y colchas. La necesidad de mantener a sus hijos le motivó poner el negocio. También tenía un deseo de superarse y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella dedica de 6 a 8 horas diarias a la costura. 

Señora Maria ha solicitado 6 créditos con ODEF.  Ella comenta que se ha ido increíblemente ya que ha comprado otras maquinas y cuenta con clientes fijos. Con este crédito de L12,000, comprará materia prima como hilo, tela y forros de muebles. Espera seguir mejorando su hogar y superarse como persona. También desea que sus hijos se gradúen de universidad.
texts.en:
María, 59, lives in a village in the town of La Lima in Cortes Department.  She’s single and has six children who are all adults.  She lives in one of her married son’s house.

María learned to sew when she was a little girl.  With help from her ingenuity she bought her first sewing machine and started to prosper.  Fifteen years ago she set up her business making furniture slipcovers and bedspreads.  The need to support her children motivated her to open the business.  She also wanted to improve herself and move her children forward.  She dedicates six to eight hours daily to sewing.

María has requested six loans with ODEF.  She comments that she’s done incredibly since she’s bought more machines and she has a regular clientele.  She will use this L12,000 loan to buy raw materials like thread, fabric and furniture slipcovers.  She hopes to continue to make home improvements and to improve too as a person.  She also hopes that her children will graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric and furniture covers.

loans.name: Nderema A Group

texts.en:
Dorcus is the facilitator of the Nderema A group. Dorcus and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dorcus and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Dorcas joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Dorcus had a good maize yield, harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Dorcus was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Dorcus will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Nderema A group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Dorcus with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sovannsam's Group

texts.en:
Sovannsam, aged 41, is a married father of four children who are still in school. He lives in a rural area where crop farming is common. He has been growing maize for more than ten years to support his living. 

Sovannsam started taking loans from VisionFund three years ago. The loans have helped him to have regular income to feed his children and send them to school. Given a better living and good business, he and his group members, who has been with VisionFund for one year, are requesting another loan. He will use this loan to pay for labor in harvesting his maize crops. This loan will enable him to increase his maize crops and he hopes to sell them for a good price and then set aside some money for the future and also to keep his children in school.

loans.use: To pay for labor in harvesting his maize crops.

loans.name: Carlos  Segundo

texts.es:
Carlos Segundo  tiene 42 años es soltero, vive con los padres. Vive en el Recinto América  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla UNIDOS VENCEREMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto América, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Carlos  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace 20 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y  arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es  comprar un terreno tener su propia casa.

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Carlos Segundo is 42 years old and single.  He lives with his parents in the América district, in the Ventanas canton.

The communal bank "UNIDOS VENCEREMOS" ["United We Will Overcome"] is located in the América district, which is part of the Ventanas canton. The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Carlos has been working in agriculture growing corn for the last twenty years. He purchases her supplies in Ventanas, and sells his products in the the market there.

The requested loan is for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice. The loan will help him to increase her income for use by his family and for investment. His dream is to buy a plot of land so he can have his own home.

In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice.

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en: Mourine is a twenty-two-year-old, hardworking lady who lives in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are to buy a car, build a permanent house, and educate herself. She has been running a stationery shop for one year and her major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, customers not paying on time, and inadequate capital to purchase stock.  However, she has business goals of diversifying the business to include a restaurant, moving the business to a more permanent location, and expanding the business into new areas. The purpose of this loan is to buy a photocopier for her stationery shop.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier for her stationery shop.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba  is married with one child. She cooks   rice for sale at Asebu Ekroful, which she has done for three years. Her husband is a farmer. Aba uses her income to help her   husband in the general upkeep of the family. Aba will use the loan to buy bags of rice  to  cook  for sale. With the new profits from her business, Aba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice  to  cook  for sale.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier, de 25 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a su hermano menor y su querida madre, a quien le da mucho apoyo. Javier se dedica a cultivar plantas de cacao  y café; lleva realizando está actividad hace más de 6 años junto  a su hermano. En los tiempos de cosecha contrata a trabajadores del lugar para que lo apoyen con la extracción de sus frutos. Después de la cosecha realiza el secado de los granos de cacao ó café que llega  a cosechar  para que se vean más productivos y estén listos para su procedimiento;  él lo lleva a comercializar a los centros de acopio de su localidad, quienes le remuneran buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo de su producto.
Este es el segundo préstamo que solicita a Kiva y agradece por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que se caracteriza por ser un joven muy emprendedor. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en el mantenimiento de sus terrenos con la compra de abono orgánico, herramientas y reservar parte del dinero para la contrata de trabajadores que le apoyarán en la próxima cosecha.

loans.use: Compra de abono orgánico, herramientas, entre otros.

loans.name: Sulejman

texts.en: Sulejman needs your financial help to buy almond and walnuts seedlings with all the money that he is asking from you. " the soil and the weather is very supportive of such protein based nuts and they are so much in demand in our country and the selling/buying price is not cheap either. I think this would be a good investment to my agricultural activity in the long run," said Sulejman to the loan officer and branch assistant when he stopped by the institution's office in his region.

loans.use: to buy almond and walnut seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ruth would like to buy 3 sacks of fertilizer and a dairy calf

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 38 years old and mother of 3 chidren. Though a married woman, Gladys manages a very popular pub in her commnity. Since the pub is situated in the centre of the community, patronage is very high, especially over the week-ends.

Having benefited from the 'TEACH' learning sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION, Gladys is well-positioned to render quality service to her clients. She thus wants the KIVA loan to add more seating capacity to her current level for her clients' comfort and pleasure.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Azim

texts.en:
Azim is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He  and his family are settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli  village.  
Azim has run a cattle breeding business for 4 years, thereby supporting his family.  However, he wants to provide a better living for his children. 
Azim is therefore asking for a loan of US$725 to expand his cattle business by buying a pregnant cow.

loans.use: Purchase of a pregnant cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fix his store up

loans.name: Vantha

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Vantha has been married since 1997 and has 2 children - a son and a daughter. She learned to weave from her neighbor in 1990, and started her own silk weaving business that same year. In addition, Mrs. S. also plants vegetables on her land in the village. Her husband is a motor taxi driver in Phnom Penh city. 

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time. She is asking for US$1,000 to be able to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and a motorbike for use in the family.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, and a motorbike

loans.name: Zenobia Alberta

texts.en:
Mrs. Zenobia, has always been linked to farming activities. She was born and was raised in a 100% agricultural and livestock farming family. After many years of learning, she has acquired a lot of experiential knowledge that has been quite effective when it comes to taking care of her farming activities, especially raising small farm animals. She is a woman with a good sense of humor and lots of optimism in life. These qualities made her a key figure in her family during times of hardship and lack of money when they lost their crops after a huge cold wave that affected their harvest. They also had to endure other difficult decisions as a family. Currently she has big projects in mind; she is planning to venture into planting peas and she is preparing her land for crops. In the meantime she is firmly dedicated to breed small farm animals such as hens and guinea pigs in order to support her family, while her husband works as a mason. Mrs. Zenobia, gets up everyday embracing the opportunity to prepare her three children still under her care (of which she had nine) with energy and motivation for life. This is why she is asking for a loan that will be invested in improving her small farm by purchasing small farm animals, manure and pea seeds. Give your support to this strong-willed woman so she can move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Zenobia, siempre ha estado ligada a las actividades agrícolas, nació y creció en una familia netamente agricultora y ganadera y tantos años de aprendizaje la han dotado de conocimientos, aunque empíricos muy certeros para el desempeño de sus labores agrícolas, sobre todo el de la crianza de animales menores.Ella es una mujer que tiene un buen sentido del humor y mucho optimismo para seguir adelante, estas cualidades la han llevado a ser un miembro de gran fortaleza para su familia en momentos difíciles y de escasez económica cuando perdieron sus cosechas por la inmensa ola de frío que cayó sobre sus tierras de cultivo y otras de tensas decisiones que tuvieron que afrontar como familia.Hoy tiene grandes proyectos en mente, piensa incursionar en el cultivo de arveja y por ello esta preparando la tierra para su cultivo, mientras tanto ella se está dedicando férreamente a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas para sostener a su familia, mientras que su esposo se dedica a ser un obrero de albañilería, Doña Zenobia, se motiva cada día con el afán de preparar para que enfrenten la vida con mucha fuerza y entereza a tres de sus nueve hijos que todavía están en su poder.Es por ello que solicita un préstamo que los invertirá en la mejora de su pequeña granja de animales menores y en la compra de abono y semillas de arveja.Apoya a esta mujer de gran fortaleza a seguir adelante.

loans.use: Improving a little area for breeding and buying pea seeds for planting.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking and very experienced businesswoman. For more than ten years, she has been preparing and selling delicious dishes to the people of her community. Irene and her husband have eight sons who study and work.

Irene plans on enlarging her business in order to serve more customers and increase her income. She plans on using her loan to buy more raw materials to keep on preparing her food. She wants to keep working hard to earn more and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to continue producing food in a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Roger Ivan

texts.es:
Roger Cross is a gentleman that works selling delicacies, candies and crackers by walking in the Mayoreo market of Managua. His business was born 20 years ago with the purchase of small quantities of products, which he resold all around the outskirts of the market.

Confronted at present by the difficult situation of his nuclear family, composed of his wife and three children, he decided to invest his few savings in the purchase of products, obtaining them through loans from Ceprodel (16 loans) that he has invested directly in the purchase of the crackers, delicacies and caramels.

The need that confronts Mr. Cross is the acquisition of his products. His goal is to obtain a section in the market where he can sell more products to improve the financial condition of his family.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Roger C. es un caballero que se dedica a la venta ambulante de golosinas, caramelos y galletas en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua. Su negocio nace hace 20 años con la compra de pequeñas cantidades de productos que los comercializa por todos los alrededores del mercado.

Por la difícil situación que actualmente atraviesa su núcleo familiar compuesto por su esposa y tres hijos, decide invertir sus pocos ahorros en la compra de sus productos, obteniéndolos por medio de prestamos realizados en Ceprodel (16 créditos) que los ha invertido directamente en la compra de las galletas, golosinas y caramelos.

La necesidad que atraviesa el señor C. es la adquisición de sus productos y su meta es llegar a obtener un tramo en el mercado donde comercialice mas productos para mejorar su condición financiera en su familia.

loans.use: To buy delicacies, candies and crackers

loans.name: Kadiba South E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Nzimina N.. She is currently in the business of selling maize and is requesting a loan to purchase more maize to sell. Nzimina is 35 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children and her children go to school. Each week, Nzimina makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business. Nzimina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Nzimina is joined in her small group by Esther N., Betty Tikubakya, and Rose K.. Esther N. has a restaurant business and wants to buy more raw food and soft drinks. Betty Tikubakya is currently operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to boost business. Rose K. operates a retail shop business and wants to add stock.

loans.use: To expand maize business

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Mrs. Tom R., 39, is a widow and works as a teacher in the village. Moreover, after her teaching job, she always makes Khmer noodle and sells it in the market. On average, she makes around $6 a day including her teaching salary. She has two children, both of whom are students.

She wants a loan from Kiva to renovate her house as, during the rainy season, she has difficulty with a leaking roof. The leaking roof currently affects her business because she makes Khmer noodle in her house.

loans.use: This loan will be used to fix a leaking roof.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 44 years old and is a single woman. Mwajuma owns a small beauty salon and she is a clothes seller as well. She started her businesses in 2001. Everyday, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

In the past, Mwajuma has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her salon and more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more items such as weaves and hair treatments for her salon and to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Aminata D., married with 08 children in her care, has been a member of the village bank of Médina Plateau in Ziguinchor for 5 years. She would like to expand her business, which consists of buying dried fish and then reselling it. Her income will allow her to improve the living conditions and health of her family. Aminata is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Aminata D., mariée, 08 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Médina Plateau à Ziguinchor depuis 5 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter des poissons séchés puis revendre. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Aminata sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy dried fish

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Mrs. Nan N. is a farmer in Ping Pong Village, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. In addition to farming, Mrs. Nan N. sews palm leaves and sells them for a profit. Her husband, Mr. Nhouch Loeurng, is a recycling collector. Mrs. Nan N. is 25 and the mother of one child, who is too young to work or study.

Although Mrs. Nan N. has two businesses, she cannot support her family well. Thus, Mrs. Nan N. needs to start a cow breeding business in order to improve her living conditions. Mrs. Nan N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to raise.

Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.es:
Rosemarie is the mother of a 5 year old boy who motivates her move forward day to day, despite the difficulties of being a single mother and having suffered the abandonment of her partner. She managed to open a small shop where she positioned a small area for arcade games for the entertainment of children and teenagers who meet regularly to play. But now Rosemarie has encountered certain difficulties due to broken game machines and wants to be able to repair them and that is why she requests a loan. If she has broken arcade games then it results in less daily income for her home. We hope that you can be very helpful to Rosemarie; she has shown she can succeed despite adverse circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosemarie es madre de un pequeño niño de 5 años quien la motiva día a día a salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades que tiene por ser madre soltera y haber sufrido el abandono de su pareja. Logró abrir una pequeña tienda donde también acondiciona un pequeño espacio donde tiene unas máquinas de juego para la diversión de los niños y jóvenes quienes concurren habitualmente. Pero ahora Rosemarie tiene ciertas dificultades por las fallas de sus máquinas y desea poder repararlas y para ello solicita un este préstamo. Ya que si tiene sus máquinas malogradas es un menor ingreso diario para su casa. Esperamos que usted pueda ser de gran ayuda para Rosemaria, ella ha demostrado se puede salir adelante a pesar de las circunstancias en contra.

loans.use: Repair arcade games.

loans.name: Uma

texts.en:
Four years ago, Mrs. Uma N., 42 years old, opened her own shoe shop and small shoe factory.  She sells different kinds of women's shoes.  She began her business with a loan from BPW Patan. 

Now she is requesting her third loan of Rs 25000.00 to further expand her business by purchasing raw materials.  Her economic condition is low, so she needs a loan to further expand her business.  With her increased income, she plans to help her husband in the family's financial matters.

Her husband's name is Sobiyat Man N..  He is a college teacher at the Patan Campus.  Mrs. N. has two daughters aged 14 and 9 years old.  The youngest daughter is in grade 7 and the oldest daughter is in grade 9.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
This is the second time Mrs. Un A. is asking for a loan to improve her business. She and her husband, Mr. Loch Phon, are fishermen in Samraong Village in Kampong ChhnA. Province. In their business, they now face a small problem because they do not have enough fishing equipment to catch more fish so Mrs. Un A. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for their purpose.

Mrs. Un A. is 47 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom uses electricity to charge batteries to make income while another one is employed in a garment factory. The third one helps the parents' business while the youngest one is attending school. Previously, Mrs. Un A. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a machine battery charger for her first child's business. She has fully paid that loan back.

loans.use: to buy more fishnets in order to catch more fish

loans.name: Carlos Luciano

texts.es:
Carlos inició el negocio por deseos de salir adelante y de que a su familia no le hiciera falta nada, para lo cual era necesario contar con otro ingreso aparte del que percibe en la empresa para la cual trabaja como mensajero. Comenzó en Junio de 1992, como su papá siempre se ha dedicado al transporte, el le ofreció que trabajara con él por un tiempo, pero como realmente le gustó el trabajo y le empezó a ir muy bien, decidió seguir trabajando en el transporte público y así tener un ingreso extra para cubrir los gastos de su casa y familia. El crédito anterior de KIVA le ayudó a darle mantenimiento a su unidad y a prepararse para los meses que son épocas de mucha lluvia y en las cuales hay que mantener las unidades en excelentes condiciones mecánicas.

El necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para mantener en buen estado su unidad y de esta forma brindarle un servicio seguro y cómodo a sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Carlos began his business with dreams of being successful and of his family not lacking for anything. This required another income in addition to the one he earns working as a messenger for a business. He began in June of 1992, like his father he always has been a taxi driver, he offered him work for some time, but as he really like the work and it was going well for him, he decided to continue working in public transportation and in this way have extra income to cover his household and family expenses. The previous KIVA loan helped him maintain his unit and prepare himself for the rainy season when he has to maintain many units in excellent mechanical condition. He needs a loan for US$250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to maintain in good shape his unit and in this way provide safe and comfortable service to his passengers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain his taxi

loans.name: Saiyora

texts.en: Saiyora U. is married, and her husband works as a laborer. Together they have two children. She started her business to help the family make ends meet. The little income her husband earned was not enough to subsist or lead a better quality of life. She started four years ago with a little stand where she sold kitchen supplies, and ultimately she opened her own store, which she still runs today. Gradually she expanded her business and currently she has $4,500 in capital. Her daily income is about 100 Somoni. Now Saiyora wants to expand her business and purchase additional kitchen inventory for her store. For this purpose, she is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600) for the term of 6 months. With this expansion, she hopes to earn more and thus to be able to meet all the needs of her children.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of kitchen supplies

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Samoeun N. is a villager in Sean Born Village in Takeo Province.  She and her husband, Mr. Ngen Kun, sell Chinese noodles in the local market.  

In their business, they face an obstacle because they usually pay much money for transportation.  In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Samoeun N. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to purchase a motorbike.  She hopes to reduce her expenses and provide a better life for her family. 

She is 33 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school.  Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To add to her savings to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en: Mrs. Nim N. was born in 1973, and she now lives in Trapaing Kok village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. N. Vanny, is a blacksmith who makes all kinds of agricultural equipment. Because this business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Nim N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more steel for her husband's business. She has a child who stays at home because that child is only five years old. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more steel for her husband's agricultural equipment business.

loans.name: Sree

texts.en: Mrs. Sree H. is a villager in Taing Roleang village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband, Mr. Rong Pheak, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Their field is infertile soil so Mrs. Sree H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her field more productive. Mrs. Sree H. is 33 years old and the mother of a 5-year-old child. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Madame A. Rose est une veuve avec quatre (04) enfants. Née en 1950 à Kpémé, cette brave femme s’est lancée dans le commerce de produits vivriers notamment les céreales, activité qu’elle maîtrise bien après trente (30) années d’exercice. En effet, elle va de marché en marché pour acheter de céréales qu’elle stocke et revend à ses nombreux clients. N’ayant plus suffisamment de moyens financiers pour satisfaire la demande de ses clients et augmenter ses revenus en baisse, elle sollicite donc un crédit pour renforcer son commerce et avoir un fonds de roulement solide et surtout maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
Ms. Rose A. is a widow with four children. Born in 1950 in Kpémé, this good and honest woman got started in the commerce of staple foods, notably grains. This is a business she has mastered after working thirty years at it. She actually goes from marketplace to marketplace to buy grain, which she stocks up and then resells to her numerous customers.

No longer having sufficient financial means for satisfying the demands of her customers and for increasing her dropping revenues, she is requesting a loan, so as to boost her commerce and to have solid working capital and especially to maximize her profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: An inventory of grain for resale
