Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Tulwanirewamu Community Group 1-Kampala

texts.en:
S. Hellen, 50, is now seven years into her farming business in Naluvule-Kampala. She makes 252,000 shillings a month in profit. She also runs a retail shop. 

The combined profits from her two businesses helps her provide better for her kids. She credits her husband for giving her some of the start-up capital back then when she was more inclined to small-scale subsistence agriculture. 

With this loan, Hellen, who belongs to Tulwanirewamu group-Kampala and who is also a mother of eight, says she is going to buy more stock for her retail enterprise and she also expects to improve her farming business with manure purchases.

loans.use: The purchase of more stock for her retail shop and manure for her farms

loans.name: Zoila Aurora

texts.es:
Zoila Aurora A. M. tiene 33 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar.   Tiene 5 hijos.

Zoila pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Zoila  se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además tiene animales de cría y ganado para luego vender,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar vehiculo.
Le gusta  jugar el fútbol.
texts.en:
Zoila Aurora A. M. is 33 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province. She has five children.

Zoila is a member of the Guantucoto Communal Bank, which is located a half hour from Guaranda. This group engages in farming and ranching, especially corn and potato production in the mountainous areas as well as in the coastal region where rice is grown. The Communal Bank has 25 members.

Zoila has been farming for several years, growing potatoes and corn. She also raises and sells livestock animals. Zoila buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells at the wholesale market in the same city.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing corn and potatoes. With the help of this loan, she will have the financial resources to acquire necessities for her family. The challenges she faces include pests and diseases that can impact her crops. Her dream is to buy a vehicle.

Zoila enjoys playing soccer.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for growing potatoes & corn

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 39 años de edad, es separada y cuenta con tres hijos a su cargo, reside en el caserío La Clake, una zona rural del distrito de Reque, conformado por pobladores muy humildes que usualmente se dedican  a la agricultura y a la ganadería, cuenta con electricidad, sin embargo se valen de un pozo para agenciarse de agua. La zona se encuentra situada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, especialmente a la ganadería, ella cuenta con dos vacas, de las cuales comercializa la leche que producen diariamente entre sus vecinos y en el mercado del distrito. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso por lo que siempre trata de mantener su negocio de la mejor forma, brindando una buena alimentación y cuidados a sus vacas.

Santos desea ampliar su negocio incursionando en la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, por ello ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

Santos es una mujer bastante responsable y que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Santos is 39 years old, separated, and has three children.  She lives in the village of La Clake, a rural area in the Reque district, which is made up of humble people who usually work in agriculture and livestock.  It has electricity, but still relies on a well for their water supply.  It is located a half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She works in agriculture, especially with livestock.  She has two cows, and she sells the milk they produce to her neighbors and at the market in her district.  This is her primary source of income, so she tries to maintain her business at a high level by giving her cows good food and care.

Santos would like to expand her business into raising and selling small animals, so she decided to ask for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edypme Alternativa to achieve her goal.

Santos is a responsible woman who has a drive to get ahead.  People that know her think highly of her and respect her.

loans.use: Purchase animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 54 años, enviudo hace muchos años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 3 hijos y su nieto Fabricio. Hace más de 12 años viene dedicándose a la venta de ropa y vasijas de plástico, ya que su principal prioridad era sacar adelante a sus hijos y lo logró. Hoy en día, sus hijos  son hombres de bien y la apoyan cubriendo los gastos de la casa. Además ya no derrocha muchas energías como antes, cargando sus bolsos pesados bajo el hombro, ahora solo atiende los pedidos que le hicieran sus clientes, así tiene más horas libres para cuidar de su nieto, quien es su adoración. Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es que le genera ganancias que le ayudan a cubrir los gastos que necesita para su hogar. En adelante, anhela tener su negocio en su propia casa, de ese modo puede tener un vida mucho más tranquila. Es su 17avo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará prendas de vestir para el verano, de esa manera podrá incrementar su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Gladys is 54, widowed for many years, and lives in her own house with her 3 children and her grandson Fabricio.  For more than 12 years she has dedicated herself to selling clothes and plastic glasses, and her principal goal has been to advance her children.  She has succeeded.  Today, her sons are grown men and they help her cover household expenses.  Moreover, she no longer expends as much energy as before lugging heavy bags hanging from her shoulders.  Now, she just has to attend to the orders of her customers.  Thus, she has more free hours to care for her grandchild, who is her pride and joy.

What she likes best about her business is that it generates earnings that help to cover the costs  of necessities for her home.  In the future, she hopes to have her business in her own home so that she can have a much more tranquil life.

This is her 17th loan with MFP, and she knows that if she pays on time, she will have access to others with greater confidence, and without creating complications for her communal group.  With this loan, she will buy summer clothing and, in this manner, increment her stock of products.

loans.use: TO BUY SUMMER CLOTHES TO SELL

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora Delia Epifania A. C. que vive en la cuidad de Villarrica. Encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras nombrando al Comité Las Triunfadoras.
      La  mayoría de las integrantes se dedican a la elaboración de productos  alimenticios, como empanadas, sandwich, milanesas, y una parte se dedica a la reventa de mercaderías como remeras, camisas, pantalones, short, buzos, camisillas, lencerías.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Delia quien tiene una despensa y se dedica a la atención de la misma, se encuentra satisfecha ya que le ayuda con los gastos de la casa y así ella no necesita nada para la alimentación. 
Para esta época que llega desea estar prepara  con todas las mercaderías y para ello solicita el préstamo y comprar entre otras cosa vinos, sidras, gaseosas, golosinas, dulces, enlatados, embutidos, aceites. 
    Las Señoras agradecen a Kiva y a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo ofrecido porque gracias a eso lograron mejorar sus ingresos y  de esta manera sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group was formed with the efforts of Mrs. Delia Epifania Aramendia C.. She lives in the city of Villarrica. The members came together the group joined Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras under the name of Las Triunfadoras.

The majority of the members sell prepared foods, such as meat pies, sandwiches, meat patties. Some of the members have retail businesses from where they sell jackets, shirts, slacks, shorts, tank tops, undergarments, and lingerie.  

Delia is one of the members and she has a convenience store that she manages herself. She is very happy with the business because she is able to contribute towards the household expenses and she doesn’t need any support to buy the groceries. 

Especially for this time of year she wants to be ready with all the merchandise she will need, and to this end she requests a loan. She will purchase, among other things, wines, cidre, soft drinks, snacks, sweets, canned goods, and cooking oil. 

The women in this group convey their thanks to Kiva and Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner) for the support they have offered. It is thanks to this support that they have improved their incomes and consequently, their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, drinks, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 53 años, vive con su hijo en la casa de un familiar. Desde hace 7 años y medio vende comida en su mismo domicilio, por lo que tuvo que acondicionar un pequeño espacio dentro de su casa para ejercer este negocio. Su hijo es su gran apoyo, ya que él se encarga de ayudar en la atención de la clientela, mientras ella se esfuerza de preparar a tiempo el pedido de su comensal. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo, es su sentido de esfuerzo que pone cada día, asó como los nuevas que se propone llegar y una de ellas es vender todo la comida que prepara durante el día, ya que sus ganancias depende de lo que venda. Casi siempre lo logra, es por eso que esta muy contenta y se proyecta para el futuro ampliar su restaurante y que tengas todas la comodidades para sus asiduos clientes. Es su crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes no perecibles para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Gladys is 53 years old.  She lives with her son in a family member's house.  For seven and a half years, she has been selling meals in her own home.  She remodeled a small space in her home so that she could carry out her business there.  Gladys' son is a great support since he takes care of helping to serve her customers while she works hard to prepare her customers' orders on time.  What she likes about her business is the sense of hard work that she puts in every day.  She also likes to sell all the food that she prepares during the day since her profits depend on what she sells.  She almost always manages to sell everything and this makes her very happy.  In the future, she plans to expand her restaurant and to ensure that it has all the comforts her regular customers need.

This is Glady's second loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being part of her community bank because all the members are people that she knows.  They are all responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  Gladys would like to thank all the people who will help to fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying non-perishable ingredients for making her meals.

loans.use: To buy non-perishable products for preparing more meals

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua K. is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been through junior high school. Ekua sells cooking utensils at Abura. Eku assists her husband in providing for the basic needs of the family. The loan will be added to her initial capital to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to build a shop.

loans.use: add to her initial capital to expand her business

loans.name: Edwin Amilcar

texts.es:
El señor Edwin R. labora en el Municipio de Masaya, desde hace 3 años. Es el responsable de llevar el sustento a su familia compuesta por sus cuatro hijos menores.

Con el crédito solicitado, logrará pagar una motocicleta el cual le es de mucha utilidad para su movilización a su trabajo y al igual para realizar los mandados del hogar y llevar a sus niños a la escuela en dicho medio de transporte.

Espera que su crédito le sea otorgado y así aprovecharlo al máximo en conjunto de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. R. P. works in the Masaya municipality in the Masaya department.  He has worked for three years for a company called ENACAL.  He works as a well operator.  He pays for the family expenses with this income.  His family is comprised of his life partner and his four minor children.

He now needs to pay the balance on a motorcycle that he got on credit from United Motors.  That is why he came to the CEPRODEL offices to request a loan.  The loan is to pay the balance he mentioned.

It should be noted that this vehicle is very important to him.  Before going to work he takes his children to the learning center.  He feels that it is safer to take them himself instead of sending them with another person or alone.

loans.use: Pay for Motorcycle

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
Manuela es una pequeña comerciante, de venta de tortillas, siendo su medio de trabajo por cinco años, iniciando con dinero propio que su esposo dio, el cual labora en servicios de seguridad.
Quien vendía tortilla era familia de mi esposo, luego ella no sigue por inconvenientes, en donde comienza a palmear con poco dinero, y lograr mantener la clientela lo que ha venido aumentando de producción con préstamos que Afodenic ha dado en cuatro ciclos, en donde aumentado el nivel de ventas, ha hecho pequeñas mejora  a su vivienda.
Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento hará un bajarete en frente logrando amortiguar la colar y donde podrá estar en mejores condiciones de trabajo, comprara materiales de construcción como: laminas de zinc, cuartones de madera, clavos, entre otros materiales para hacer la obra.
texts.en:
Manuela's business is selling tortillas.  She has been in this line of work for five years.  She started out with her own money that she got from her husband who works as a security guard.

"It was a member of my husband's family who used to sell tortillas but then she had problems and couldn't continue".  Manuela began hand making her tortillas with little money but she managed to keep her customers and increase her production with loans that she received from Afodenic over the course of four loan cycles.  Her sales levels have increased and she has made some small improvements to her home.

Manuela will use this loan to build a porch out the front of her home to take the edge off the heat and so that she can have better working conditions.  She will buy building supplies such as corrugated metal sheets, wooden boards, nails and other materials she needs to carry out the work.

loans.use: To buy building supplies such as corrugated metal sheets, wooden boards, nails and other materials

loans.name: Salud Y Vida Group

texts.es:
El grupo Salud y Vida está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Juana Aracely H. desde hace 16 años inicio su pulpería con una pequeña mesa la cual dice conserva como reliquia. Ella decidió tener su negocio propio para poder dedicarles más tiempo a sus hijos.
La otras integrantes son Mireya O. M. quien vende ropa desde loa edad de 13 años primero le ayudaba a su madre  y desde hace 30 años vende de manera independiente y Marbelly Gómez tiene una pequeña venta.
texts.en:
The 'Salud y Vida' (Health and Life) group is made up of three hard-working women.  One of them is Juana Aracely H..  16 years ago, Juana set up a grocery store with just a small table that she tells us she still keeps as a reminder of that time.  She decided to set up her own business so that she could spend more time looking after her children.

The second member of the group is Mireya O. M. who has been selling clothes since she was 13 years old.  She started out helping her mother and has now been working for herself for the past 30 years.  The third member is Marbelly Gómez who has a small sales business.

loans.use: To buy basic grains

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.en: Zoraida is a 41-year-old single woman who supports her family through direct selling of plastic home products and operating a sari-sari store. She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Zoraida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Zoraida has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000 to purchase more stock to sell both for her home products business and for the sari-sari store so that she can continue to save up for her future security and to support her household expenses. Zoraida is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more home products to sell

loans.name: Tawopaneh Group

texts.en:
Adama I. K., 34, is married to a teacher, and the couple has five children. Adama has been a businesswoman for ten years now, selling fish, rice, vegetable oil, margerine, salt, etc. She is also the leader of the Tawopaneh Group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone.

The Tawopaneh Group is comprised of five local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of 2,500,000 SLL, with 500,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

With the help of this loan, Adama will buy fish, rice, vegetable oil, margerine, salt, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy fish, rice, vegetable oil, margerine, salt, etc.in bulk for her business

loans.name: Nuevas Amigas De Mercedes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVAS AMIGAS DE MERCEDES” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Claudina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Importación de relojes, costura de ropa, ayudante de albañil, artesanía en algodón, venta de CD’s, inicio de negocio, Tejido de máquinas, venta de chamarras.

La señora Claudina,  indica que es la primera ves que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de los promotores. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de chatarra que viene realizando hace un año atrás; este negocio lo aprendió de su amiga.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de chatarra (que servirá para incrementar su capital), posteriormente lo venderá en su casa, todos los días de 8:00 a 18:00. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene seis hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la salud.
texts.en:
The “NUEVAS AMIGAS DE MERCEDES” (Mercedes' New Friends) community bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada regional office.  The group has nine members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Claudina.  The businesses that the group's members carry out are varied and include: importing watches, sewing clothes, working as an assistant builder, making cotton handicrafts, selling CDs, starting up a new business, machine knitting and selling jackets.

Claudina tells us that this is the first time that she has been part of one of Pro Mujer's community banks.  She joined through an invitation from the promoters.  Claudina currently has a business selling scrap metal which she has had for one year.  She learned the business from her friend.

The loan that Claudina is currently taking out will be used to buy scrap metal (which will increase her capital).  She will then sell the scrap from her home every day from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  This work allows Claudina to make money to support her family as best she can.  She lives with her partner and has six children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, es comerciante de ropa y medicinas, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 6 y 4 años, él trabaja en lo propio y sin un horario fijo.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de medicinas, vitaminas, analgésicos, antibióticos, entre otros medicamentos, esta inversión fortalecerá el negocio y ayudara a brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes.
El aspira ampliar la línea de productos, mejorar la clientela y estar en buenas condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
Mario lives in San Rafael Oriente, San Miguel Department.  He is a clothes and medicine merchant.  He lives with his wife and two children who are 6 and 4 years of age.  He works for himself and does not have a fixed work schedule.

He is asking for a loan to buy medicines, vitamins, analgesics and antibiotics, among other medicines.  This investment will strengthen the business and help him provide better customer service.

He hopes to expand the line of products, to improve his clientele and to be in good condition with his family.

loans.use: to buy medicines, vitamines, analgesics and antibiotics.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Carlos René

texts.es: Carlos René, de 50 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposa. Cada día se levanta muy temprano para poder atender su negocio, el cual consiste en la venta de frutas y verduras en un puesto que posee en el mercado regional de la ciudad en que vive. Es un lugar muy concurrido y en especial el puesto de Don Carlos ya que siempre mantiene verduras y frutas frescas, además, los clientes lo prefieren por ser un hombre honesto y amable ya que su prioridad son las personas que demandan sus productos. El sueña con tener un puesto abastecido de las diferentes frutas y verduras pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para realizar su sueño. Debido a esto Don Carlos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito para invertir en su negocio y poder comprar variedad de frutas como: sandias, melones, bananas, cocos, manzanas, etc. Así como variedad de verduras: papas, yuca, güisquiles, zanahorias, chiles, etc. Con la fe puesta en Dios que de esta manera logrará obtener mejores ingresos que le permitirán tener y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos René, 50, lives in his own home along with his wife. Every day he gets up very early to be able to staff his business which consists of selling fruits and vegetables in a stall he has in a regional market in the city where he lives. It is an area that receives a lot of business, and especially Don Carlos's stall, as he always keeps fresh produce and, in addition, his customers prefer him for being an honest and pleasant man since his priority is the people who demand his products. 

He dreams of keeping a stall that is well-stocked with the different fruits and vegetables but he does not have the necessary economic resources to fulfill his dream. Because of this, Don Carlos has made the decision to seek this loan to invest in his business and be able to buy a variety of fruits such as watermelon, other melons, bananas, coconuts, apples, etc., as well as a variety of vegetables: potatoes, yucca, chayotes, carrots, chile peppers, etc. With faith in God he hopes by this means he will bring in better earnings which will allow him to have and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits such as watermelon, other melons, bananas, coconuts, apples etc. as well as a variety of vegetables: potatoes, yucca, chayotes, carrots, chile peppers etc.

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en:
Barbra is 16 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Barbra has a tailoring business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Barbra has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials for making clothes. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Barbra hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Barbra is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her more skills, such as how to account for her money and how to save it.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es:
Artemio es un hombre trabajador de 52 años de edad que vive con su esposa y dos hijos en una comunidad humilde y pequeña en vías de desarrollo cuyos pobladores son comerciantes o se dedican a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 20 minutos del distrito de Mórrpe en Lambayeque.

Artemio tiene 10 años de experiencia en su trabajo, él se dedica al comercio de verduras de manera ambulatoria o en su propio domicilio. Artemio cuenta con sembríos propios y con clientela fija, que son comerciantes chiclayanos, él tiene muchos deseos de superarse y es por ello que desea invertir en su negocio.

Artemio solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar lenteja de palo y maíz que actualmente se encuentran en temporada de cosechas por su zona. Esto le permitirá aumentar su mercadería y por lo tanto su producción

Artemio es una persona muy conocida en la zona debido a la labor que realiza. Este se ha propuesto acopiar maíz para luego venderlo a un mejor precio. Artemio quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y este préstamo le ayudaría a hacerlo.

Artemio ya ha trabajo con nuestra entidad y goza de un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Artemio is a hard-working man, 52 years old, who lives with his wife and two children in a small and humble community which is still developing. Its inhabitants work as merchants, raise animals or work in agriculture. The community is located 20 minutes from the district of Mórrpe in Lambayeque.

Artemio has 10 years of experience with his work. He works selling vegetables as a mobile vendor or from his own home. Artemio has his own crops and has steady customers who are merchants from Chiclayo. He has a great desire to get ahead in life, and for this reason, he wants to invest in his business. 

Artemio is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 Peruvian new soles, in order to buy lentils and corn, which are currently being harvested in his area. This will allow him to expand his stock of merchandise and thus his turnover. 

Artemio is a person who is very well-known in his area because of the work he does. He has decided to store corn so that he can sell it later at a better price. Artemio would like to improve his quality of life, and this loan will help him to do so. 

Artemio has worked with this financial institution in the past and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy lentils and corn which are currently in production.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en: Ophelia is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Ophelia has a retail shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stock of used clothing. Ophelia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future,Ophelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing.

loans.name: Kabayirwe

texts.en: Kabayirwe is a 49-year-old married woman with seven children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Kabayirwe has been selling soda for two years. She got the initial capital to start her current business by farming. She has challenges in terms of limited funds to supply her increasing customer base. Her dream is to own a soda depot. Kabayirwe is requesting this loan facility to buy soda for resale.

loans.use: to buy soda for resale.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidas lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Masaya. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Lidia quien tiene una tortillería y vende chiverías desde hace desde hace 7 años. Este negocio lo inicio con un quintal de maíz medio flete de leña (la mitad de una carreta de leña) y un comal; ahora ella utiliza cuatro quintales.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Juana   quien vende ropa y cosméticos desde hace 2 años y Vilma  de 52 años se dedica al destace de cerdo y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The “Unidas” (Together) group is composed of three hard working, enterprising women from Masaya.  The group coordinator is Lidia who has a tortilla shop and she’s also been selling snacks for the last 7 years.  She started the business with just a quintal of corn, half a wagonload of firewood and one griddle.  Now, she consumes four quintals.

The other group members are Juana who has sold clothes and cosmetics for the last two years and Vilma, 52, who butchers pigs and sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, powdered lime, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children who are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase bags of beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to businesses.

loans.use: to purchase bags of beans for resale

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 42 years old and lives in Manamong Aloran. He is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Manuel has a business selling canned goods, soft drinks, milk, sugar, etc. He earns about PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. Manuel has  requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more merchandise for his  snacks business.

Manuel has been a member of PMPC for three years.  Manuel would like to thank PMPC because PMPC helps him to add his capital of his sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for his  snacks business.

loans.name: Las 5 Rosas Group

texts.es:
El joven Everfein vive en una localidad muy bonita, en donde las personas cosechan plántanos y  la  naranja. El es soltero y desea seguir estudiando.

    El solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ganados para luego venderlo en la misma región, en donde lleva apenas cinco meses  y   ve que le está dando resultado.
   
    Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó, ya que su papa tambien se dedica a lo mismo  y decidió trabajar con él  pero con su propio dinero.

    Lo que más desea es que así como está iniciando  día con día aumente más su ganancia y poder trabajar con el préstamo para a horrar y continuar estudiando.
 
    Las personas que integran en el grupo son: las señora Angelina, quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra de trastes de peltre y platico, así también está la señora Silveria  quien se dedica a la elaboración de pan y solicito el  prestar para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes y por último se integra la señora Benita quien  invertirá el préstamo en la compra de pollos de rancho para luego venderlo.
texts.en:
Young Everfein lives in a very pretty village where people grow bananas and oranges.  He is single and would like to continue with his studies.

Everfein requested this loan to invest in buying livestock which he will later sell in his region.  He has been in his business for just five months and he can see that it is providing good results.

Everfein's became interested in this business as his father is in the same business.  He decided to work alongside his father but with his own money.  What he would most like is to keep increasing his profits day by day and be able to work with his loan so that he can save and continue with his studies.

The members of this group are: Angelina, who will invest her loan in buying pewter and plastic utensils; Silveria, who makes bread and is requesting this loan to invest in buying ingredients and, finally, Benita, who will invest her loan in buying chickens which she will later sell.

loans.use: to buy livestock to sell in his own town and elsewhere

loans.name: Kobiljon

texts.ru: Кобилчон поле окончание института не смог устроится на работу по специальности. Он начал заниматься услугами таксиста по местным городам.  Более 3 лет он успешно работает в данном бизнесе. В этом году он женился и тратил все свои сбережения на свадьбу, теперь он хочет обновить свою машину для работы в зимний период. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 12500 Сомони. Он заранее благодарен всем кредиторам за их поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Kobiljon could not find work in his profession after he had graduated from college. He started to provide taxi services around the local towns. He has been working in this business successfully for three years. This year he got married and spent all his savings on the wedding and now wants to upgrade his car for the work during the winter months. Kobiljon is asking for a loan with this purpose in the amount of $12,500 somoni. He is grateful in advance to all the lenders for their support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy and repair a car.

loans.name: Monica Wambui

texts.en:
Monica is a married lady with two children whom they hope to provide with a good education to university level. She lives on an estate called Dandora in Nairobi where she operates a restaurant business. She has been doing this business for the last six years and has managed to hire four staff members. 

Monica says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to ensure her business is doing well. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to renovate the restaurant to create an ambience which is more appealing to her customers. She describes herself as clean and honest.

loans.use: to renovate the restaurant

loans.name: Heraclea

texts.en:
Heraclea, 54, is married and has ten children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Heraclea has a broom-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials to make brooms.

She has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Heraclea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her brooms.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Emma has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy stocks from NATASHA & AVON.

Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON.

loans.name: Manat

texts.en: Manat is widowed and a loving mother of three. Her elder two kids are college students and the youngest one goes to kindergarten. She started her garment retailing business in 2006 by renting a counter in the local market. Now that winter is approaching she needs to buy more warmer clothes to resell. She is a sharp and diligent woman who says, "It has been hard since my husband died. I try everything to support them and I will not rest until my kids get educated and independent." She is requesting MNT 1,000,000 to purchase more clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 39-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Emma has a shop that sells shampoo, detergents, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy shampoo, detergents & beverages for selling.

Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, detergents & beverages for selling.

loans.name: Zoilo Emiliano

texts.es: El señor Zoilo Emiliano es un señor de 47 años, casado tiene cuatro hijos. El es una  persona muy responsable y trabajador quiere brindarle a su familia las mejores condiciones. El motivo de crédito es para la compra de clavos, arena cemento bloques y otros. Zoilo tiene un sueño, por realizar que es la construcción de una pared y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Señor Zoilo Emiliano is 47 years old, married and the father of four children. He is a very responsible and hard-working person who wants to offer the best possible living conditions to his family. He applies for this loan to buy nails, sand, cement, blocks and other construction material. Zoilo has a dream, namely building a wall and continuing to help his family.

loans.use: to buy nails, sand, cement, blocks and other construction material.

loans.name: Mikhailo

texts.ru:
Михайло женат, у него двое детей. Михайло живет в городе Хуст, Западная Украина. Он торгует недорогой обувью при входе на местный рынок. Конкуренции у Михайла особой нет. А вот товар пользуется спросом, есть своя клиентская база. Торгует обувной продукцией уже 8 лет. Более того, по субботам вместе с женой торгует птицей на рынке: продает курей, уток и гусей. 

Михайло хочет вложить кредит в 5 000 гривен в закупку дополнительного количества обуви для последующей реализации. Он поедет за товаром прямо на обувную фабрику, чтобы приобрести партию товара без всяких посредников. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Mikhailo is married with two children. Mikhailo lives in the town of Khoost in Western Ukraine. He sells inexpensive shoes at the entrance to the local market. He does not have much of a competition. His wares are in demand and he has his own customer base. Mikhailo has been selling showes for eight years. In addition, on Saturday he and his wife sell poultry at the market: chickens, ducks, and geese. Mikhailo would like to invest his loan of 5000 UAH into purchasing an additional stock of shoes for subsequent resale. He will travel to purchase shoes directly from the factory in order to buy his wares without any middlemen. Note: the case description is in Russian.

loans.use: to stock up on shoes for subsequent resale

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man. He has two children aged 6 years and 10 years. He describes himself as an optimistic man. He provides motorcycle transportation services. He has been involved in this business for two years. In addition, he does farming to increase his income. His business is located near a shopping centre. He faces a challenge of insufficient funds for maintaining the business.

Francis will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle. His business goal is to triple his business income within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Cinthia's Group

texts.es:
Cinthia's group es una sociedad de tres mujeres emprendedoras que anhelan que sus negocios crezcan para seguir triunfando en la vida. En este grupo la presidenta es Cinthia porque es una mujer trabajadora, sociable, colaboradora y responsable en sus actividades.

Cinthia tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en la ciudad de Ibarra, en la provincia de Imbabura. Trabaja en la compra venta de ropa, negocio que le ayuda a sustentar los gastos familiares, pero tiene la necesidad de incrementar sus ventas, es por eso que realiza su primer crédito en Fodemi debido a que va a invertir en la compra de mercadería como camisetas, sacos, pantalones, calentadores porque las ventas suben en temporada navideña y le generará más ingresos.

Al igual que Cinthia las otras personas desean triunfar en la vida para mejorar la calidad de vida de ellas y de sus familiares.
texts.en:
Cinthia's Group is comprised of three women entrepreneurs who want to expand their businesses so they can continue being successful in life.  The president of the group is Cinthia because she is a hard-worker, sociable, collaborative and responsible in her activities.

Cinthia, 28, lives with her husband and their three children in the city of Ibarra in the province of Imbabura.  She sells clothing for a living and contributes her income to the household for expenses.  She wants to increase her sales volume and has requested her first loan through Fodemi.  She plans to use the loan to buy t-shirts, suits, trousers and legwarmers because of the higher demand at Christmas time.  This will increase her income.

Just like Cinthia, the other members also wish to lead a successful life and improve their families' quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as t-shirts, suits, trousers, and legwarmers for the Christmas season demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an additional welding machine.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria sells materials and plates at Soba, a community in Hohoe. Gloria has received education to the middle school level. She is married and has one child with her husband, who works at a saw mill. Gloria has been selling materials and plates for the past 12 years to support herself and her husband. She is also responsible for her parents. 

Her loan will be used to buy more cloth to expand her cloth business, which was the main reason why she joined her loan group. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy more plates to expand her working capital and enable her to sell an increased variety of plates.

loans.use: to buy more cloth to expand her cloth business.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: It was hard for Yasmeen  to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Yasmeen  is 52 years old, married woman. She is a mother of 6 children.  Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Yasmeen  has gained great confidence in the business as she has learnt how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Anis Gul

texts.en:
Anis Gul is a widow of 41 years old with her 11 children. She is a baker who is making bread in her house in a small Tandor (Local Stove) and then her son and her small daughter sell them in the street.

She also accepts orders from her clients to make breads from the dough that they bring. She is mainly from Shamali where there was war for almost 30 years and she lost everything there and now she is living in Kabul.

loans.use: To buy Flour to make dough for baking bread

loans.name: Dadashova

texts.en: E. is 48 years old and a resident of Beylagan region. She has been engaged in sheep breeding together with her family since 2005. When she started the business, she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch where she borrowed first $300 then $400. She breeds sheep and her husband sells them in the market, or delivers them to butchery shops. Having a good repayment history, now she applies for $600 to buy more sheep and expand the business.

loans.use: To buy ten sheep

loans.name: Rakhman

texts.en: Rakhman is an IDP from the Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993.  He is married and has two children. He started his business in 1998 in the center of the city, and borrowed four Normicro loans from the Baku branch, totalling $3600. Now he is willing to increase the assortment of his shop and would like to borrow $1200.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Margaret.

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has four children. She lost almost all of her business capital in a transport vehicle accident carrying a variety of articles including animals. The animals destroyed her products and she had to sell them at give-away prices. Since then, she has been barely surviving with her family. Pushed to the wall by these setbacks, she joined GHAPE in April 2007.

Given a loan of $100, Margaret plans to buy plantains, groundnuts, kernel, and chemicals for the sale of foodstuffs and the production of detergents and body lotion. She has always had a ready market as people need detergents in their day to day life for washing clothes, and dishes. 

She plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loans.use: Sale of food stuffs and production of detergents, and body lotion.

loans.name: Haydee Gloria

texts.es:
Ever since Haydee was a little girl she dreamed of having a shop, now that she is married she has realized this dream, and thanks to the efforts of her and her husband she can enjoy the benefits of her business without neglecting her family.

Until now, she has been able to grow the products in her small shop with the money generated. However, there has now been an event which causes her great sadness and which is still difficult for her to accept - the deceit of her husband.

The mother of the small child resulting from this betrayal filed a demand for support, and because he did not comply, he is now in the city prison. She loves him very much and she has forgiven him, and hopes he will return very soon, especially now that their second son has been born. These problems caused a decline in the prosperous shop which they had only run for a short time, and the ongoing losses reduced the quantity of products they offered. This is the reason they need our help to be able to recover economically. She is requesting a loan of $350 to stock the small shop one more time, so with hard work they can improve the well being of their two children.

Let's support this selfless mother who struggles despite the circumstances she is living with.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Doña Haydee desde muy niña soñó con tener una tienda, sueño que ahora de casada pudo consolidar gracias a su esfuerzo y al de su esposo puede disfrutar de los beneficios de su actividad sin descuidar a su familia.

Hasta ahora ha podido incrementar los productos de su pequeña bodega con los réditos que le generaba ésta, sin embargo se ha suscitado un hecho que le dió mucha pena y aún le cuesta aceptar, el engaño de su esposo. Fruto de esa traición la madre de su pequeño hijo le ha entablado una demanda por manutención y por motivos de incumplimiento hoy pasa sus días en la prisión de su ciudad. Sin embargo por el inmenso amor que le tiene lo ha perdonado y espera volver a reunirse muy pronto con él; ahora más que nunca porque acaba de nacer su segundo hijo. Estos inconvenientes han generado el declive de la próspera tienda que administraba hace poco y las continuas pérdidas aminoraron la cantidad de los productos que ofertaba, motivo por el cual requiere de nuestra ayuda para poder recuperarse económicamente. Solicita la suma de 350 dólares para implementar una vez más la pequeña bodega con el afán de procurarles bienestar a sus dos pequeños niños. Apoyemos a esta abnegada madre que lucha a pesar de las circunstancias que le tocó vivir.

loans.use: She will use this loan to buy the necessary items to stock  her small shop.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Mrs. Santos is 35-years-old and lives in the town of Canchachugo, in the district of Usquil in La Libertad. She only went to school until third grade, and she has 4 children who still depend on her. She makes a living by selling ponchos, knapsacks, hats, corn starch, and ice cream at the different festivals in the communities in Sierra de La Libertad, and mainly in a town called Chincimbara in the province of Julcán.

Mrs. Santos joined the Canchachugo Communal Bank through an aunt and obtained her first loan of 300 nuevos soles ($100), with which she purchased an ice cream machine. The recent loan from Manuela Ramos of 1,800 nuevos soles ($598) will be paid back in 4 months and will let her buy hats, for which she needs a large sum of money. She will also buy corn to make chuño, a starch extracted from corn.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Santos tiene 35 años de edad, vive en el caserío de Canchachugo, Distrito de Usquil departamento de La Libertad. Estudió solo hasta el tercer año de primaria; tiene 4 hijos que aun dependen de ella. La señora se dedica a la venta de ponchos, alforjas, sombreros, hasta chuño de maíz y helados en las diferentes ferias de las comunidades de la Sierra de La Libertad y principalmente en un caserío llamado Chinchimbara provincia de Julcán. La señora Santos ingresó el Banco Comunal “Canchachugo” por una tía y obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300 ($100) con los cuales completó el dinero para la compra de una máquina para preparar helados. El reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,800.00 ($598) que cancelará en 4 meses, le sirvió para comprar sombreros, para lo cual se necesita una fuerte cantidad de dinero, además compró maíz para la elaboración de chuño (alimento extraído del maíz).

loans.use: Purchase of hats and the purchase of corn to make starch.

loans.name: Fepuleai

texts.en: Fepuleai is a 72 year-old widow with 4 children. She is a very hardworking mother, and nobody can believe her age. She is very fit and very healthy. She has been running her shop for almost five years. She is very thankful for the help of SPBD for such a great opportunity to improve her shop and to help renovate her house. This is Fepuleai's seventh loan with SPBD and she has been extending her shop every few months. She is planning to have a small market in front of her house where she can sell her taro and other crops and vegetables.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Belkis

texts.en:
Belkis is twenty-seven years old, and she has one school-going son. Her husband is an independent truck driver. Belkis has been selling gold and silver-plated jewels for three years to the women of her community. Currently, she has a lot of loyal customers that visit her store everyday to make the purchase of bracelets, necklaces, chains and some fashionable trinkets.

Belkis expects her store to become the most well-established supplier of these goods in all the surroundings. With her loan, she will purchase more jewels in order to meet her clients’ needs and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase more jewels in order to satisfy the customers' needs.

loans.name: Saudat

texts.en: Saudat S. is married with 4 children. She is 35 years old and hails from Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a fashion designer and also sells clothes. She has been in business since 1993 and needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Kamuli Rd Village C(Vi) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Juliet M.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge. Juliet is 30 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from ages 5 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Juliet makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. Juliet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to buy furniture and the loan was paid back on time.

Juliet is joined in her small group by Annet A.. Annet A. has a business running a kiosk and wants to add more stock.

loans.use: To add more equipment to restaurant in order to offer better services

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa is 36 years old and is a widow woman with two children, ages 12 and 8. Arafa owns a small beauty salon, which she started in 2000. Every day, she works from 9am to 11pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $225 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items such as hair treatment, hair conditioner and other equipment for her business.

loans.use: To buy more salon items and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Abdou Aziz

texts.fr:
Abdou Aziz G. manages a hardware store in the Escale Sud district in Thiès. He is married and lives near the Jammy Xaléyi bank. He benefits from his experience in retail commerce. This is why he opened the hardware store in 2007. Renewing his inventory of merchandise is the purpose of applying for this loan.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

ABDOU AZIZ G. gère une quincaillerie au quartier escale sud à thiès. Il est marié et il habite près de la caisse de Jammy Xaléyi. Il bénéficie d'une expérience dans le commerce de détail c'est pour cela qu'il a ouvert la quincaillerie en 2007. C'est dans le but de renouveler son stock de marchandises qu'il sollicite ce prêt

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi O. is 41 years old. She lives near Day River, which makes it very easy for her job, fishing. In 1999, Mrs. O. joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) to take loans to buy fishing tools. Everyday, Mrs. O. and her husband, Mr. Vu Van Phuong, go farming during the day and go fishing during the evening to earn some extra income for their family. They have 3 children. Two oldest ones have been able to help their parents. From fishing, Mrs. O.'s family earns about 188 USD per month. Right now their boat is broken; other tools such as fishing nets, etc also need replacement. That's why Mrs. O. would like to borrow 425 USD to fix their boat and buy more nets for the coming fishing season.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị O. năm nay 41 tuổi.. Gia đình chị sống ở gần Sông Đáy nên rất thuận tiện trong việc đánh bắt cá. Năm 1999 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương vay vốn để đầu tư mua sắm các công cụ phục vụ cho công việc đánh cá của gia đình. Hàng ngày chị cùng với chồng là anh Vũ Văn Phương tham gia công việc đồng áng, tối về anh chị lại đi đánh bắt cá trên sông để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Anh chị có 3 con., hai trong số 3 con của anh chị đã lớn và đều có khả năng phụ giúp bố mẹ làm kinh tế. Công việc đánh bắt cá đã mang đến thu nhập ổn định cho gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000/ tháng. Sau một thời gian làm công việc đánh bắt cá hiện nay thuyền của anh chị đã hư hỏng, các dụng cụ khác như lưới... cũng cần phải thay thế, bổ xung. Vì vậy chị mong muốn được vay thêm 7 triệu đồng để đầu tư sửa chữa thuyền mua thêm lưới để phục vụ cho mùa đánh bắt cá sắp tới

loans.use: Catch Firher

loans.name: Thi Vinh

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Vinh, 52 years old, has 5 children, 1 of whom is still schooling. Her husband works as a barber with the monthly income of 1,000,000VND (about 64USD). In 2003, she discussed with her husband to join the TYM Fund to invest in raising livestock. With the help from her husband and her 4 grown-up children, her pig-breeding plant alway has high yield. This time, she would like to borrow 15,000,000VND (900USD) to renovate the pig sty and purchase more pigs. Her monthly income is 3,000,000VND (about 193USD)
 Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.
Chị Nguyễn Thị Vĩnh năm nay 52 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 5 người con trong đó có 1 con đang tuổi đi học. Chồng chị làm nghề cắt tóc cho thu nhập 1.000.000đ/ tháng. Năm 2003 để phát triển kinh tế gia đình chị đã bàn với chồng tham gia Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Cùng với sự giúp đỡ của chồng và 4 người con đã trưởng thành dự án chăn nuôi lợn của gia đình chị luôn cho hiệu quả kinh tế cao. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm lợn về nuôi
Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Breeding pigs

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy S. (48) and her husband, Mr. Samoeun Doeun (48), who live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1980 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of her daughters is married and lives with her husband’s family and the other two children study in a local school.

Mrs. Thy has been selling vegetables since 1993. Some of the vegetables she grows with her husband, and the rest she buys from her fellow villagers for resale.

Thy is requesting a loan of US$300 in order to expand her business of selling vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Tainghot

texts.en:
Mr. Tainghot H. (pictured with a cart for selling yellow cake), 28, and his wife, Mrs. Im It, 28, live in a small village off National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and have two children. One of them studies in the local school and the other one is still young and stays at home.

Mr. Tainghot and his wife have been selling yellow cakes for six years. He buys raw materials such as sugar, powder, cream, and eggs from the market to make yellow cakes, and sells them using his motor cart around his village and nearby villages. Tainghot is requesting a loan of US$200 to buy more raw materials to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business of selling yellow cakes.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián está muy agradecida con las instituciones que le ayudaron a adquirir una pequeña camioneta donde brinda servicios de transporte de carga a los pobladores de las zonas alejadas, así como también, él mismo puede trasladar sus productos agrícolas a las ciudades cercanas.  Las dificultades que se le presentan es debido a las largas distancias que recorre por zonas donde la carretera no está en buenas condiciones, entonces su camioneta necesita estar en constante mantenimiento, ahora ha presentado algunas fallas y esto ocasiona que no pueda realizar los traslados y no hay ingresos económicos para su hogar.  Es por este motivo que solicita un préstamo, para invertirlo en la reparación de su carro y además para sus plantaciones de café, las que requieren de los abonos necesarios.
texts.en:
Julian is very grateful to the institutions that helped him obtain a small truck which he uses to offer freight transportation services to people who live in remote areas. He also transports their produce to nearby towns. The difficulties he encounters are due to the long distances that he travels through areas where the roads are in poor condition. As a result his truck is in constant need of repair. Right now it is out of service, which means that he cannot transport goods and has no income. For this reason he is asking for a loan which he will use to repair his vehicle and also for his coffee fields which require fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his truck which he uses to transport freight, as well as to buy fertilizer for his coffee plants.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en: Lai M. lives in Koh Nhae Village in the Takeo Province.  Lai is 28 years old and the mother of two children. Her husband, San Both (both pictured), is a taxi driver who makes a small income to help support his family. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land and cultivates rice for a living. Although she and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot support their family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Lai is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Rubina Zakir Ali Group

texts.en:
Rubina baji is a 57-year-old lady and resides in a city named Vehari, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 5 years. Her husband's name is Z. A., and he is a milkman and sells milk in milk shops as well as in the community. He has been in this profession for the past 25 years. Rubina baji helps her husband in getting milk from the buffalo. They both get up early in the morning and get 12 kg milk and fill the milk jars. Presently they have one buffalo and they want to buy another buffalo to expand their milk selling business. 

She is a group leader of a few women in her locality. These women are very responsible and cooperative. Nazia Noreen baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her butcher shop. Tasleem baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats and sheep) for her animal selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Oeurn O. is a villager in Chi Paing village in Kampong Cham province. She is 44 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school.  Mrs. Oeurn O. is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. In her vegetable farming, she grows potatoes on 4-hectar field which it is too big for her to work so she has decided to ask for a loan of to hire laborers to work on the field. Her husband, Mr. Preap Sophal, helps her in the plantation.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Kea K. H. is 26 years old and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She owns a grocery store and typically makes about US$20 in revenue every day. Her husband is a soldier and earns US$2.5 per day. Recently, Kea K. H. decided that she needs to expand her grocery stand by adding additional products to meet her clients' demand. She is grateful for the loan from Credit MFI and Kiva.

loans.use: Expansion of a grocery stand

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a tailor and also sells tailoring materials from her shop. She started her business in 2006 and now hopes to expand. In order to do this, Mary has applied for a loan in the amount of N40,000 to purchase more tailoring materials. She is 36 years old and married with four children. Mary says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30 year old Mariam M. from Mwanza. She is widowed with two children, between the ages of 3 and 6 years old. Mariam has been running a shop since 2006. Our client’s business is to sell different items such as soap, biscuits, water and ground nuts. She works at the business for 13 hours per day, 7 days per week. Mariam currently earns about 200USD from her business. 
She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy rice, cooking oil, sugar and wheat flour. 
In the future, she plans to open another business. 
Mariam thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil, sugar and wheat flour

loans.name: Astou Sène

texts.fr: Astou Sène D. est une vendeuse de bois morts pour faire la cuisine surtout dans les villages et lors des cérémonies, elle a trois ans d’expérience. Elle habite à Diourbel une ville à 150 km de Dakar, elle est mariée  et a des enfants. Elle est à son premier prêt et sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité dont les revenues lui permettent de soutenir son mari à entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Astou Sène D. is a retailer of firewood for cooking, especially in villages and during ceremonies. She has three years of experience. She lives in Diourbel, a city located 150 km from Dakar. Astou is married and has children. She is on her first loan and is requesting it to bolster her business. The revenues from it enable her to support her husband in providing for the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Buzurg

texts.en:
K. Buzurg, 45 and married with two children, has been running a beekeeping business for 20 years, having started the enterprise after experiencing difficulty finding employment. Family effort has been the key to his business's growth since everyone collaborates, and now he has a steady customer base due to the quality of his products. Currently, Buzurg is seeking a loan of $800 in order to expand his business, thereby allowing him to offer better services. He promises to repay this loan in seven months. Be a part of this family's achievements. They sincerely thank you for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes:  its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
	
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce B. is a trader. She runs a provisions store on one of the main streets in her community. She also sells vegetables and other food items on a small tabletop in front of her store. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns.

Joyce is 31-years old. She is married and has three children: a son and two daughters. Her husband is a farmer. All of her children are in primary school. Joyce lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to help her husband provide for the family and especially to meet the children’s school demands.

Joyce has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Rehana Ashraf Masih Group

texts.en:
Rehana baji is the wife of A. M. and the leader of this loan group which has four other female members. All of the women live in the city of Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. They are all very hardworking and determined ladies who run their own businesses.  They use the income to pay the utility bills for their families. Rehana baji will use her part of the loan to buy wheat and rice at wholesale prices.  Allah rakhi baji will buy clothes to resell and Naziran baji plans to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business.  Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart and Tahira baji will buy goats for her animal selling business.

As a group loan, the funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business, but they all mutually guarantee the entire loan.  That is, if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wheat and rice at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr:
Née le 31/12/1978 à Aklakou, madame A. Kokoè demeure aujourd’hui à Aklakou avec sa famille. Avec trois personnes à charges, elle exerce comme activité la vente de produits de premières nécessités et de produits de ménage depuis six (06) ans. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de ces enfants.
Depuis un certain un temps elle assiste à une augmentation de sa clientèle mais par faute de moyens financiers, elle est incapable de satisfaire leur demande. Pour répondre à cet état de fait, elle sollicite un crédit pour accroitre le niveau de ses commandes. Ceci lui permettra de répondre aux besoins de sa  clientèle et d’améliorer considérablement son niveau de vie, celui de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1978 in Aklakou, Mrs. A. Kokoè still lives in Aklakou with her family. As the breadwinner for 3 people, she has been selling staple goods and household products for six years. This activity permits her to cover the needs of her children. For quite some time, she has been seeing her clientele grow, but because she lacks financial means, she is not capable of satisfying their demand. To respond to this situation, she is requesting a loan so that she can place more orders. This will allow her to satisfy the needs of her clientele, considerably improve her standard of living and that of her family, and reimburse her loan within 12 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of staple goods and household products

loans.name: Kellen's Group

texts.en:
M. Kellen is the group leader of Byeshembe. She is 36 years old, married, and has five children. In addition, she also takes care of her three sisters.

Kellen is involved in the tailoring business - she buys new textiles for sale and sewing, mostly for secondary schools, such as Kazo secondary, Buremba secondary, Kazo model secondary, St. Catherine secondary, and Kyabahura Primary school, all of which are in Kellen's locality.

With her previous loans, Kellen has already been able to buy two sewing machines, a flat iron and an overlock machine that have helped her in the tailoring business by making her work look neat and professional. Kellen needs a loan to buy more materials for sewing.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials for tailoring

loans.name: Ngô Thị

texts.en:
Ngô Thị Q. (1826071498) is a 35 year old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Q. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling liquor such as beer & wine in the local community. Q. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Q. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Q. successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Q. is now requesting a new loan of 12000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Q. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta is 28 years old. She is married and has two children, a son and a daughter, who are currently in primary school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a commercial town. She trades in cosmetics. Alberta sells cosmetics such as powder, assorted body and hair creams, perfumes, etc. She hawks to sell her cosmetics in her community. Aside from her cosmetics business, she also sells gari and palm oil on a table top at her residence. Alberta buys her goods from the central market in Accra. She has been in business for some years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Alberta aspires to expand her business so that she can depend on her proceeds in taking care of the family.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Las Rositas Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. LORENA A. A. TIENE 25 AÑOS DE EDAD Y VIVE CON SU ESPOSO CON QUIEN TIENE YA 10 AÑOS DE MATRIMONIO. ES ORIGINARIA DE LA COMUNIDAD DE LAS TRANCAS EL CUAL PERTENECE AL MUNICIPIO DE TLALIXCOYAN. SU LOCALIDAD ES MUY CONOCIDA POR QUE EN ELLA LA GENTE SE DEDICA PRINCIPALMENTE AL CULTIVO DE ARROZ, PEPINO Y MAIZ. SIENDO EL ARROZ EL PRINCIPAL SUSTENTO DE LA COMUNIDAD.

INICIALMENTE ELLA AYUDABA A SU ESPOSO EN LAS LABORES DEL CAMPO, SEMBRANDO ARROZ. PERO COMENTA ELLA QUE ERA UNA ACTIVIDAD MUY PESADA PARA ELLA YA QUE LAS CONDICIONES CLIMATICAS LE CAUSABAN PROBLEMAS DE SALUD.

ES POR ESTO QUE LA SEÑORA BUSCO OTRA FORMA DE APOYAR A SU ESPOSO ECONOMICAMENTE Y SE DECIDIO EN PONER UNA PAPELERIA YA QUE EN LA COMUNIDAD NO HABIA NINGUNA. LA GENTE TENIA QUE TRASLADARSE A COMUNIDADES ALEDAÑAS.

LLEVA APENAS 6 MESES CON SU NEGOCIO Y DECIDIO SOLICTAR UN CREDITO PARA PODER SURTIR MEJOR SU NEGOCIO Y ASI DAR UN MEJOR SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES.

DOÑA LORE COMO LA CONOCEN SUS VECINOS ES INTEGRANTE DE LA  UDE  LAS ROSITAS, LA CUAL ESTA INTEGRADA POR 10 PERSONAS. LAS CUALES SE DEDICAN A LA TIENDA DE ABARROTES, VENTA DE DULCES, DE REFRESCOS, VENTA DE ROPA Y CALZADO.
texts.en:
Ms. Lorena A. A. is 25 years old and lives with her husband, to whom she has been married for 10 years now. She is from the Las Trancas community, which belongs to the Tlalixcoyan municipality. Her community is well-known because people there mainly grow rice, cucumbers, and corn—the latter being the community’s main means of support.

In the beginning, she used to help her husband cultivate rice, but she states that it was very heavy work for her, and the weather conditions caused her to have health problems.

For this reason, Lorena looked for another way to help her husband financially, so she decided to set up her own stationery store because they did not have any in the area; residents had to travel to nearby communities.

She has been in business for only 6 months, and she decided to request a loan in order to better stock her store and provide better customer service.

Doña Lore, as she is known by her neighbors, is a member of the Las Rositas Group, which is comprised of 10 people who own general stores, candy stores, beverage stores, clothing and shoe stores.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, crayons, pencil boxes, and poster boards

loans.name: Grupo Pasuc Group

texts.es: Es un grupo de 7 personas que viven con condiciones económicas muy precarias el cual hace 2 años tomaron sus decisiones para emprender una actividad como un grupo de señoras el cual se dedican a la crianza de animales tales como cerdos, ovejas, gallinas, entre otras, la cual ellas contribuyen económicamente con sus esposos con para los gastos de cocina mensual, con las ventas que realizan de sus animales los cuales lo venden en un municipio llamada San Francisco El Alto, la cual es conocido por la venta de animales, que queda aproximadamente a 35 kilómetros del lugar donde viven cada una de ellas, actualmente acudieron a la Asociación ASDIR, para solicitar su préstamo con las buenas intenciones de comprar más animales y de esa manera poder obtener mejores ganancias mensuales, para el sustento de cada una de sus familias.
texts.en:
This is a group of 7 persons who live in economically precarious conditions. Two years ago, they decided to undertake an activity working together as a group of women, raising animals such as pigs, sheep, and hens. With the revenues that they get from the sale of their animals they contribute economically to the monthly food expenses of their household. The animals are sold in a city named San Francisco El Alto, which is known for the sale of animals and is approximately 35 kilometers from where they live. They are currently requesting a loan from the association ASDIR, with the intention of buying more animals so that they can obtain higher monthly earnings to support each of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital to purchase animals

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: A. Chantal est née vers les année 1966 à Agonli. Chantal est mariée à DOVIDE Pierre. Chantal est mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. La famille réside à Suru–Léré un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Chantal vend depuis les années 2000 de charbon de bois et de boissons liqueurs produit localement. Mais depuis 2003, Chantal a associé à ces activités la vente de gravier. Mais, Chantal fait cette activité avec son mari. Chantal a déjà eu trois crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Chantal demande un quatrième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de gravier et de sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.name: Vin

texts.en: Mr. Vin Y. is 60 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh City in Cambodia.
