He is married to Mrs. Mao Rith (shown in the picture), age 60, and they make a living planting crops in the village. This older couple has given birth to three children who are married and have already started new homes. One of them is a garment worker, while the others are also running a farming business. Because the farming business is the main source of income and a profitable one for the family, Vin Y. would like a loan of US$1000 from Kiva through HKL to be used to buy more farming supplies to grow his crops. In addition, he will use some of the loan to provide a small loan to his villagers with specific schedule repayments.

loans.use: To buy more farming supplies to grow his crops

loans.name: Zabi Ahmadi Group

texts.en:
This is Zabi Ahmadi group. There are four members in this group. Zabiullah is the group leader. Zabiullah wants to take out a loan for his tailoring business. He wants to buy the essential materials for his shop.

Rohullah wants to take out a loan for selling rechargeable phone cards. Freshta wants to take out a loan for her beauty salon to buy cosmetics and complete her other necessary materials. Freba wants to take out a loan for her embroidery business.

They have requested a group loan of 56,000 Afghani. They are all thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: completing their business requirements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Maintaining his rice paddy

loans.name: Pulefetii

texts.en:
Pulefetii F. is a 19-year-old woman living in the town of Asaga. She is single and does not have any children. To make a living, Pulefetii owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Pulefetii has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Pulefetii joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pulefetii is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Pulefetii plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Sod

texts.en: Sod S., 45, is married with five children. He resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, with his wife (in photo) and children. To make a living, he and his wife are engaged in the agriculture sector of growing morning glories (a kind of vegetable), earning approximately US$3 each per day. This source of income from Sod S. and his wife helps cover the family expenses especially for the children’s education in the future. The family is also assisted by two of his children who are working in different workplaces. S. and his wife are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase morning glory seeds and wooden pillows to grow more morning glories to meet his customers’ demand.

loans.use: To buy seeds and wooden pillows to grow more morning glories.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa O., 33, is from the village of San Manuel. She is married and has four school-age children. Elisa owns a general store and sells a variety of different products in the local community. Elisa has been engaged in her business for many years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Elisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elisa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 31 years old. She is married and has three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Comfort works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a hairdresser by profession. She works in a shop by the roadside in her community. Comfort has been in business for some time now and wants a loan to buy artificial hair, pomade, and other working materials to expand her business.  She also deals in dressing accessories.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair

loans.name: Brenda Cristina

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo en Managua, la señora Brenda G. se ha dedicado con mucho entusiasmo a atender su negocio de venta de comida la que es comercializada en su propio local donde cuenta con varias sillas y mesas para que los clientes disfruten ya sea de un buen desayuno, almuerzo o cena.

Ella está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima como lo es la carne de pollo y otros productos para la comida y de esta manera beneficiar a sus clientes con sus riquísimos platillos elaborados por ella misma.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo market in Managua, Brenda G. has dedicated herself with much enthusiasm to attending her business selling food from her own restaurant which has many seats and tables where customers can enjoy a good breakfast, lunch or dinner. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as chicken and other food products and, in this manner, provide benefit to her customers with her delicious dishes made by her.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicken and other ingredients to make dishes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose K. N. is 34 years old and married with two children, 4 and 7 years old. Her husband is a driver. Her business is located at Makonngeni, a busy open air market in Thika, the region in Kenya known for pineapple production. She has been selling cereals such as maize, beans and green grams (mung beans) for the last five years to the local people. She has one employee. She says that her business is profitable and her major challenge is the lack of variety of cereals. However, she works very hard to keep her business going well. She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy more cereals to expand her business and become a distributor. She hopes to become a wholesaler, have many business outlets and supply her cereals to different parts of the country in the future. She is very hardworking and honest.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and green grams

loans.name: Merelyn

texts.en:
Merelyn B. is from the village of Plaridel, in Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old. Merelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Merelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Merelyn has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Merelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merelyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Merelyn’s 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: La Gran Familia Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado La Gran Familia y está conformado por 18 socios, pertenecientes a la comuna La Granja. La Granja es una comuna ubicada en la zona sur del gran Santiago, capital de Chile. Corresponde a un territorio urbano con viviendas e importantes empresas relacionadas con la madera, manufacturas y metales. 
Estos socios se dedican a diversos negocios independientes tales como confección de ropa, panadería, pastelería, artesanía, coupage (decoración de objetos como cajas de madera, botellas y cuadros), verdulería, almacén de abarrotes, peluquería, fabricación y reparación de calzados y preparación y venta de comida rápida.
La socia entrevistada fue Carolina, quien es la secretaria de este grupo. En la foto se encuentra en la última fila, a la derecha y viste polera (camiseta manga corta) naranja. Ella vende verduras y ensaladas preparadas, en su casa. Invertirá este préstamo en bolsas para las ensaladas y en verduras, además ahorrará para comprar una camioneta usada para comprar mercadería. Sus sueños son tener un Kiosco, que sirva también de bodega, con el mismo rubro (verdulería) y tener un puesto en una feria. Su gran anhelo es mejorar su calidad de vida, aumentar sus ingresos, contribuir con los gastos de su familia, como por ejemplo comprar los medicamentos de su madre. Sus grandes motivaciones son su pequeño hijito y una sobrina pequeña que está a su cargo. 
Carolina nos contó que su experiencia  de  trabajar con Fondo Esperanza al principio fue el temor de ser aval de personas desconocidas (sus compañeros de grupo, ya que ese es el sistema de Fondo Esperanza), pero que impulsada por sus proyecciones y sueños se atrevió a participar de estos préstamos y sus resultados han sido hasta el momento muy satisfactorios, ya que se a sentido apoyada  y segura. También comenta que se manifiesta mucha solidaridad entre los miembros de su grupo.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called La Gran Familia, and it is comprised of 18 members of La Granja commune. La Granja is a commune, which is located in the area south of the great Santiago, the capital of Chile. It belongs to an urban territory with houses and important businesses having to do with wood, factories, and metals. These members work at different independent businesses like making clothes, a bakery, a pastry shop, handicrafts, decoupage (decoration of objects like wooden boxes, bottles, and pictures), greengrocery, grocery store, hair salon, making and repairing footwear, and preparing and selling fast food. Carolina was the member that was interviewed. She is the secretary of this group. In the photo you can find her in the last row to the right. She is wearing a short sleeve orange t-shirt. She sells vegetables and prepared salads in her house. She will use the loan to buy bags for the salads and vegetables. Also, she will save to buy a used light truck to purchase merchandise. Her dreams are to have a kiosk, which would also serve as a convenience store within the same field (greengrocer), and to have a stall in a fair. Her great desire is to improve her quality of life, increase her earnings, and contribute to the family expenses. For example, she would like to help buy her mother’s medications. Her great motivators are her small son and a small niece that she is raising. Carolina told us that when she first started working with Fondo Esperanza she was afraid of being a guarantor for people she did not know (the colleagues in her group because this is the Fondo Esperanza’s system). Driven by her projections and dreams, she dared to participate in these loans. The results have been very satisfactory because she has felt supported and secure. She also says that there is a great deal of solidarity among the members of the group.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables and bags

loans.name: Uini

texts.en:
Uini  F. is 35 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Uini  has 5 years of experience in this business.  Uini  needs a loan of WST $1700 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Uini  joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Uini 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gbombaya Group

texts.en:
Marie F. (on the right in the photo) is the leader of this group called "Gbombaya." She is a small-businesswoman. She sells gara lappers (locally dyed cloth), wool, rice etc. She is 40-year-old and married to a teacher. They have five children. Three of her children are in secondary school and two are in primary school. Like other mothers, she wants to give them a proper education and a bright future. She thanks God for her business because it helps provide for the increasing needs in her household. It is also a big help in sustaining her children’s education. 

Marie F. has applied for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to expand her business. She will buy materials to make gara lapper like inks, caustic soda, powder and cotton. She will also buy bags of rice.

loans.use: To buy inks, caustic soda, powder, cotton, and bags of rice

loans.name: Nguyet's Group

texts.en:
Nguyet T. N. is 28 years old. She lives in Co Duong, Tien Duong, Dong Anh. She is married with two children. She makes tofu at home, and then she sells it in the market. She has been doing this work for two years. Not to waste, she also raises pigs and poultry. She has a monthly income of about $160. She has participated in SEDA's micro-financing program since 2007 and has repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 2,834,000 VND to buy beans to make tofu.

About the other one in her group:
Phuong T. N. is 34 years old. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to breed chickens.

loans.use: to buy beans to make tofu

loans.name: Bernabe Trinidad

texts.es: Bernabé Trinidad tiene 50 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de cerdo. Por lo que tiene más de 10 años de tener este negocio, pues siempre ha sido una persona muy dedicada en su trabajo, pues sus inicios se dan porque anteriormente su familia se dedicaba a la venta de ganado, fue así que el adquirió experiencia además siempre se ha preocupado por sus 3 hijos que tiene a su cargo. Tiene una gran variedad de clientes que siempre recurren a Don Bernabé porque ofrece una muy buena calidad de productos. El financiamiento es para la compra de cerdos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Bernabé is 50 years old and takes care of his three children. He buys and sells hogs and has been in this business for more than ten years. He has always been very dedicated to his work and began doing this because his family has always been in the livestock business, which gave him the necessary experience. He has a large variety of regular customers because he offers them good quality. He will use the money from this loan to buy more hogs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hogs

loans.name: Maria Lorenza

texts.es:
María de 42 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, tiene cuatro hijos que viven con ella. Para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares ella invirtió sus ahorros en cuadernos y en una vitrina. Readecuo su casa para tener espacio para construir el local y ubicar hay su tienda. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación ella y sus hijos trabajaron hasta ahora que tiene una tienda con papelería y víveres de primera necesidad. Trabaja desde las 06:30am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. Ahora ella quiere implementar una fotocopiadora en su tienda para eso quiere utilizar el préstamo. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
42-year old María and her four children live in the suburban area of Fortín de Guayaquil. To help with family expenses María spent her savings on notebooks and a display cabinet. She altered her house so there would be space to build a small store. Gradually with hard work and dedication she and her children built up the business so that now she has a store selling school supplies and everyday basic necessities. She works from 6:30 am to 11pm every day. Now María wishes to invest in a photocopier; she plans to use the loan for this purchase. Her future plans include finishing building her house and expanding her store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a photocopier

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma has five children. She lives with her family in a mid-sized city called Vehari and her husband sells sweet ice balls to earn a living.  
Najma is very caring for her family. She takes care of her children and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife. She has applied for a loan from Asasah to invest the loan amount in her husband’s business. He will buy more ice and sweet syrups to expand his business. 

Her children are getting their education, and Najma wishes for them that they might complete their education. She hopes that the investment in her husband’s business will enable her to improve her family's living standards and she will be able to complete her children’s education by sending them to better education centers.

Note: Najma has showed her husband's sweet ice ball business in this photo. Sweet ice balls are well-known by people and specially kids to entertain them in the summer season by putting sweet colors on them.

loans.use: Purchase ice & syrups for her husband's sweet-ice-ball making business

loans.name: Amormia Ancero's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Amormia A., a 35-year-old single mother of an infant, is a resident of P2 Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental and the leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While both members receive an individual loan, each is responsible for paying back the loans of her fellow group member if delinquency or default occurs. The official name of this borrowing group is Amormia A.’s Group.

Amormia has been operating a sari-sari store for a year already, earning an average net income of not less than Php2,000.00 a month. As an active member since 2009 of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reaches out to the rural poor, she is requesting a new loan, her second, of Php6,000.00 to be used as additional capital for her store. The future income derived from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, make loan repayments to PMPC, pay for her child’s education, and finance future business expansion.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

location.town: Ozamis-P2-A Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is now a divorced parent with two children, both in school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Sarah changed her business from selling bananas to selling clothing. She has been in this second-hand clothing business a few months. She buys these second-hand clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala city. Sarah uses public transport to and from shopping and goes for shopping once a week.   She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.  She works six days a week and her stall is in Ntinda market in Nakawa Division Kampala district. Sarah sells to all categories of people at retail. She depends on this job for a living. Her business challenges include the rainy season and transportation of bales of clothes from Kampala to Ntinda. Sarah aspires to educate her children up to university.  She decided to join MCDT because of the low interest they charge. She resides in and rents a two-room house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of three young children. He has owned a barber shop in his town since 1990. The borrower is well-known in his town and all the clients ask for his services and they feel comfortable with him. He has taken a first loan from Ameen s.a.l. and has been very punctual with his repayments. Today, he is asking for his second loan of $300 to purchase merchandise such as shampoo, wax, gel, etc., to be always ready for his customers. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance. At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 34-year-old lady, married with three children aged 2, 4, and 11 years old. She looks after her family and pays school fees for her children. She lives in her own house with 6 other dependents and her family goal is to educate her children.

She lives in Masindi, Uganda and her business is hiring out tents and chairs and doing outside catering. She has been in this business for 8 years and she started it with 80 chairs now she has 250 chairs with 2 tents. The challenge she has is that people tend to break her chairs and don’t replace them. In future she expects to be a prominent service provider in her area. She wants the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for the children.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia S., from Ugac Norte, Tuguegarao City, is 43 years old and married. To make a living, Amelia owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products such as hats, eyeglasses, and other accessories in the local community. Amelia is just starting this business.

In 2007, Amelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 40,000 PHP from ASKI, she is now requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 40,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Amelia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Edwar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Edwar; el tiene 30 años de edad y es soltero; el socio estudia la carrera profesional de informática y también tiene un negocio de bar que atiende desde las 7:00 p.m hasta las 2:00 a .m, el socio quiere mejorar su negocio y también quiere terminar de estudiar para que pueda abrir su negocio de computadoras. El socio solicita el préstamo para pagar las cuotas de una computadora 

 
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Edwar is a member of the community bank "Development Bank", located in the Wanchaq district in the province and department of Cusco.

Edwar is 30 years old and single.  He is studying for a professional career in computer science and also owns a bar, which he tends from 7:00pm until 2:00am.  He would like to improve his business, and also finish his studies so that he can open a computer business.  He is asking for a loan to pay for the costs of a computer.

He appreciates the people who are helping his dream come true, and he promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: The costs of a computer

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida C. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 35 years old. Aida is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Aida owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Aida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Aida is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 15th loan taken out by Aida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia G. is currently in the charcoal selling business. She sells the charcoal from her home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Cicilia is 42 years old and is married to a business man. She has 8 children, 4 of whom go to school. With the extra profits, Ciclia hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Laura Piedad

texts.es:
Laura Piedad  M. C. tiene 25 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Laura pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Laura  se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además tiene animales de cría y ganado para luego vender,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar vehiculo y comprar casa.
Le gusta las fiestas por que le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Laura Piedad  M. C. is 25 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children.  She lives in the canton of  Guaranda in the Bolivar province.  She has 2 children.

Laura belongs to the rural communal bank "Guantucoto," located a half hour from Guaranda.  The members of this group work in agriculture and livestock production, particularly the cultivation of corn and potatoes in the highlands and rice in the coastal area.  This communal bank has 25 members.

Laura has been farming for a number of years.  She grows corn and potatoes, and in addition she raises livestock to later sell.  She buys her animals in Guaranda and she makes her sales in the wholesale market in the same city. 

She requests a loan to buy supplies to cultivate corn and potatoes.  The support of this loan will help her financially to provide the necessities for her family.  They encounter challenges such as pests and diseases with the crops.  Her dream is to buy a vehicle and a house.  She enjoys parties because she likes to dance.

loans.use: to buy supplies to cultivate corn and potatoes

loans.name: Maria Petronila

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, estudió educación primaria incompleta.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 03 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de animales.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero con la que podrá comprar ovejas para su engorde y poder venderlos.

Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar los ganados.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones, y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Punta Sahuacasi” community bank which is located in Azángaro district, in Azángaro province, in the department of Puno.  She is 46 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She didn't complete her primary education.

María has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years.  Her original loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she used the money to increase the working capital of her animal sales business.

She is requesting a new loan for 1,000 nuevos soles which she will use to buy sheep to fatten and then sell.

Her dream for the future is to improve her livestock.

What she most likes about her community bank are the meetings and what she makes on her savings.

loans.use: To buy sheep to fatten and then sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers for the crops.

loans.name: Rwenshama Tukore Group B

texts.en: T. Mauda  is 30 years old and married with four children. She has a fishing business in Rwenshama from which she is able to make 210,000/= as weekly profits. She is trustworthy and supplies her fish to restaurants and hotels in Rukungiri as well as selling to homes. Her dream is to be able to build a good house for her family and improve her business. She needs a loan to buy more fish for resale.

loans.use: Buying more fish for resale

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose de 45 años, es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 15 años empezó a trabajar como comerciante informal y después empezó a vender lotería y frutas con su esposa pero para obtener más dinero comenzó a trabajar en “Tía” (supermercado).  

Hace 5 años atrás con esfuerzo y dedicación decidió tener su propio negocio e independizarse comprando una tienda. Por esa buena decisión en la actualidad el tiene una tienda de víveres donde vende legumbres a $ 0.25c/u, lácteos $ 0.60, bebidas $ 0.50, arroz, etc. Trabaja desde las 04h30am cuando va a comprar los víveres hasta las 06h00 que abre la tienda hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.   
 
Para seguir con su negocio él quiere comprar con el préstamo enlatados, granos, bebidas y otros víveres para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un vehiculo para poder transportar la mercadería.
texts.en:
José, 45, is a hard working man who started working as an informal merchant 15 years ago.  He then started selling lottery tickets and fruit with his wife.  However, in order to earn more money, he started working at “Tía” (supermarket).

Thanks to his effort and dedication five years ago he decided to open his own business and become independent buying a store.  That good decision has led to his having a grocery store today where he sells vegetables at $0.25 each, dairy products at $0.60, soft drinks at $0.50, rice, etc.  He is open from 4:30am which is when he goes to buy foodstuffs and then opens the store at 6am and works until 8pm every day.

To stay in business he wants to use the loan to buy canned goods, grains, beverages and other foodstuffs for his store.  In the future he’d like to have a vehicle to transport his merchandise.

loans.use: For canned goods, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua K. operates a food stall where people come to eat at Abura. She cooks foods such as fufu (mashed cassava), banku (maize porridge), yams and others. She is married and has five dependents. Ekua has been in the cooking business for three years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be added to her working capital to increase the number of foods cooked for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her dependents.

Ekua is stirring one of the soups (palm-nut soup) she plans to serve her customers.

loans.use: add to her working capital to increase the number of foods cooked for sale

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
El señor S. tiene 3 años de laborar en ENACAL ubicada en Masaya, departamento de Masaya, como Fontanero, es casado, su núcleo familiar es de cuatro personas: él, su esposa y sus dos hijos.

En estos momentos el señor requiere de hacerme mejoras a la vivienda en la que habita, por esta razón está visitando las oficinas de CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para dicho mejoramiento de vivienda y así contribuir con un hogar digno para su familia.
texts.en:
Señor S. has worked as a plumber for ENACAL in Masaya for three years. He is married, and his family consists of himself, his wife, and their two children.

He currently wishes to make some improvements to his home so he visited the offices of Kiva partner CEPRODEL to ask for a loan so he can provide a decent home for his family to live in.

loans.use: house renovations

loans.name: Francia Edith

texts.es:
Francia de 62 años, es una mujer trabajadora que desde joven ha trabajado para solventar los gastos económicos de su familia. Tiene una pequeña tienda en la pate delantera de su casa donde vende víveres. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro por eso quiere continuar con su negocio trabajando con ayuda de su hijo desde las 06h00am en su tienda hasta las 22h00pm. Tiene en su tienda víveres como arroz, enlatados, bebidas, azúcar etc.  Necesita comprar con el préstamo arroz, bebidas, azúcar etc. Y poder así asegurar el capital de su futuro ya que es viuda.
texts.en: Francia is 62 and very hardworking, having worked from a young age to support her family.  She runs a small store out of the front area of her home. Francia has high aspirations for the future and hopes that her son can help her manage her business, which is open throughout the day, from 6 am to 10 pm.  She sells staple foods such as rice, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. She seeks a loan in order to buy more inventory. In this way, Francia hopes to secure a stable income, as she is a widow.

loans.use: Increase inventory of staple foodstuffs

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr:
Cliente âgée de 44ans et mère d’un enfant, elle a sa charge 7 orphelins de  sa défunte sœur.

Elle ouvre le restaurant spécialité MABOKE en 2004 vente de poisson d'eau douce cuit dans les feuilles de maniocs a l'etoufee sur un barbecue. 
Avec le prêt qu'elle va recevoir, elle va acheter des cuvettes de poissons d'eau douce comme la silure, l'anguille et les carpes, bidon d'huile de 25l, filet d'oignon, les feuilles d'attache, poivre blanc , piment..

Ses ventes journalière sont de 30.000F a 80.000 par jour et ses clients les chauffeurs et les vendeurs du marche.

Tres entreprenante , elle veut continuer dans cet élan pour faire plus des benefices  afin de soutenir ses neveux dans leurs études et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This customer is 44 years old and the mother of one child. She also has seven orphaned children of her deceased sister in her care. She opened a specialty restaurant named Maboke in 2004, where she serves freshwater fish steamed in manioc leaves on a barbecue.

With this loan she would like to buy freshwater fish such as catfish, eel and carp, a 25-liter jug of oil, a bag of onions, leaves for wrapping, white pepper, hot pepper… Her daily receipts range from 30,000 to 80,000 francs, and her customers are drivers and market vendors. Very enterprising, she would like to use this momentum to increase her income in order to be able to help her nephews pay for their studies and to improve the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: Purchasing freshwater fish, oil, carbon, condiments, and household items

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando, de 63 años, es un hombre soltero, noble y muy responsable. Vive en compañía de sus inquilinos, en su casa propia. Desde hace 25 años Rolando, se dedica a los trabajos de albañilería  y pintados de paredes internas y externas de las casas. Con las ganancias que recibía, logró construir de a poco su casa y acondicionar algunas habitaciones. Como resultado de ello, vio lo rentable que sería alquilar las habitaciones, es así que han transcurrido 12 años, alquilando dichos espacios que le resulten lucrativos. Por ello, todo lo que gana lo invierte en la restauración de su casa, como la: conexión de agua, instalación de luz  y los  servicios sanitarios,  todo ello para el bienestar de sus inquilinos. De está manera trata de brindar una mejor comodidad para que permanezcan más tiempo en su casa, aunque muchos de ellos lo deterioran, y siempre tiene que dar el mantenimiento necesario. Para el futuro, tiene el propósito  de  instalar un negocio, ya que su edad y sus problemas de su salud, no le permiten desarrollarse en su trabajo de la actualidad. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, dice “que confíen en él, porque  pagará todas sus cuotas de manera responsable”, como líder que es,  de su pequeño grupo comunal está orgulloso de representarlos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará cemento para restaurar las paredes de su casa y apoyar a su sobrino, para que instale su local para ofrecer el servicio de llamadas.
texts.en:
Rolando is 63 years old and single.  He is an honest and very responsible man who lives with his tenants in his own home.

For 25 years, Rolando has been doing construction work and painting houses (both interior and exterior painting).  With the profits that he has made, he has managed to gradually build his home and adapt some rooms.  He saw how profitable it would be to rent out rooms and so he has been renting out these spaces in his home for the past 12 years.  This has been very profitable for him.

Rolando invests all the profits that he makes in doing work to his house, for example, connecting water, installing light and installing bathrooms.  He does all this for the well-being of his tenants.  He tries to make his tenants comfortable so that they stay in his house longer, though many of them damage his property and he has to make necessary repairs.  In the future, he plans to set up a business since his age and health problems do not allow him to work at the moment.

This is Rolando's tenth loan from MFP and he says that he can be trusted to make all his repayments responsibly.  He is the leader of his small community bank and is proud to represent it.  He will use his loan to buy cement to do work on the walls in his house and also to support his nephew in setting up premises for a 'locutorio' (an establishment that provides telephone booths for public use).

loans.use: to buy cement to do some work on the walls in his house and to support his nephew in setting up a 'locutorio' (an establishment that provides telephone booths for public use)

loans.name: Joas

texts.en: Joas is a businessman who runs a taxi business. Apart from the taxi business, he supplies soda and water for extra income. He has been in the business for three years and has two employees. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He has been guaranteed a loan of 50,000 Kes by his group members in Faulu Kenya. He will use the loan to buy soda, water and a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy soda, water and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Judith Isilma

texts.es:
Judith, vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 6, 5 y 8 años D. edad, residen en la ciudad D. San Miguel, administra una panadería en la cual trabaja con su esposo, todos los días ya que deben proveer a los vendedores D. ruta, para hacer llegar su pan hasta los pueblos D. los alrededores.
Ella actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra D. harina, manteca, azúcar, esta compra la pretenD. hacer por cantidades grandes, permitiéndole almacenar para cierto tiempo estos materiales y en un futuro disminuir los costos.
Para Judith su principal sueño es ampliarse hasta administrar dos panaderías, para bastecer a más personas y crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Judith lives in the city of San Miguel together with her husband and her three children, aged six, five, and eight. Judith runs a bakery where she and her husband work everyday to prepare the bread and supply it to traveling vendors who then deliver it to nearby towns.

Currently Judith is seeking a loan to purchase flour, butter, and sugar; she wants to buy these items in large quantities which would allow her to have a supply of these raw materials and also to decrease future costs. Judith's dream is expand her business and have two bakeries so that should could proviD. bread to more people and grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase flour, butter, and sugar

loans.name: Emilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Emilia, reside en Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután, ella vive con sus tres hijos de 14, 12 y 9 años de edad, se dedica a un taller de costura, lo tiene desde hace 5 años y lo aprendió en una academia de corte y confección.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas e hilos, pues le hace falta material para confeccionar los trabajos pedidos por los clientes.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio más grande, con más maquinas de coser y distribuyendo su producción de ropa.
texts.en:
Emilia lives in Puerto el Triunfo, located in the department of Usulután. She lives with her three children ages 14, 12, and 9. She has been running her own sewing workshop for 5 years, and she learned her skills at a tailoring academy.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase fabric and thread because she needs materials to make special-order clothing for her customers.

She aspires to expand her business with more sewing machines, and she hopes to distribute her apparel.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Chilamate Ii Group

texts.es:
El grupo Chilamate II está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Masaya. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Leila de 40 años quien desde joven se dedica a la costura ya que su madre era costurera ella aprendió el negocio y cuando se independizo puso su taller.
Ella invertirá el crédito en materiales (tela, hilo…etc.) y su meta es tener un gran taller.
Las otras integrantes son Nereida de 36 años realiza delantales desde hace 5 años y Isolda también se dedica a realizar delantales.
texts.en:
The group Chilamate II is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women from Masaya. The group's coordinator is Señora Leila, 40, who has worked since she was very young in dress-making since her mother was a tailor. She learned the business and when she became independent she set up her workshop. 

She will invest the loan in materials (cloth, thread, etc.) and her goal is to have a large workshop. 

The other members are Nereida, 36, who has made aprons for five years, and Isolda who also earns a living making aprons.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, etc.

loans.name: Firdausi

texts.en:
Firdausi is 18 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Firdausi has an outdoor catering business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Firdausi has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for cooking. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Firdausi hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Firdausi is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food for cooking.

loans.name: Alcanzando Nuestras Metas Group

texts.es: La señora Milagors pertenece al alcom Alcanzando Nuestras Metas el cual se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo su cargo es D. tesorera en el grupo. La señora Milagros tiene 34 años y tiene 02 hijos que son menores D. edad, en la actualidad se dedica a la venta D. ropa a pedido su deseo es poder reaperturar su tienda ya que por diversos motivos tubo que cerrarla. Con este negocio ella a podido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos D. casa. El prestamo lo invertira en la compra D. ropa ya que es campaña del dia del padre y tiene varios pedidos.
texts.en:
Milagros is a member of the 'Alcanzando Nuestras Metas' (Reaching our Goals) community bank which is in its fourth loan cycle.  She is the group's treasurer.

Milagros is 34 years old and has two dependent children.  She currently sells clothes to order.  Her wish is to be able to reopen her store as, for various reasons, she had to close it.  Through her business, Milagros has been able to help her husband with their household expenses.  She will invest her loan in buying clothes since Fathers Day is approaching and she has several orders.

loans.use: to invest in buying merchandise

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is 32 years old and is married to Purity. He owns an electrical hardware shop in Lainisaba where he supplies electrical goods.  He has been running this business for the last five years and earns an income of  KES 20,000 per month.

Douglas was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is a KADET client.  He has a good credit history with KADET and is applying for his third loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to open another electrical shop.

Douglas hopes to have a big electrical shop. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: add more stock of electric sockets, bulbs, etc.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Doña Josefa de 29 años, casada con dos hijos. Su esposo trabaja independiente mente vendiendo verduras en el cenma mercado de la capital Guatemala, uno de sus hijos estudia, doña Josefa vende ropa típica como cortes, güipiles, cortes, blusas etc. En frente del mercado municipal de su comunidad, vende solamente los días de mercado desde hace 5 años martes, jueves, viernes, sábado y domingo, su clientela aumenta dien a dia, necesita otro crédito para la compra de ropa tipica, y así ayudar a su esposo con la economía familiar,de su hogar
texts.en: Josefa, 29, is married with two children. Her husband works  independently selling vegetables in the CENMA market in the capital of Guatemala. One of the children is in school.  Josefa sells traditional clothing such as cuts, huipiles (colorful dresses in Mayan style),blouses, etc. In front of the municipal market in her community, for 5 years she has been selling only on market days:Tuesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday.  Her clientele increases daily, so she needs another loan to purchase traditional clothing.  This will help her husband with the family finances and their home.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 58 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children.

Bernadette has a dressmaking business and earns approximately 9,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more clothes for her clothing business.

Bernadette has been a member of PMPC for over one year. In the future, Bernadette hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, oil, condiments and snacks to prepare tortillas.

loans.name: Mansur

texts.ru:
Мансур честный и целеустремленный человек. Она женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он начал свой бизнес для того чтобы обеспечит свою семью так как у него большая семья и не хватает денег на обеспечение 3 детей. Он занимается купля продажей полиэтиленовые пакеты. Он имеет свою торговую точку на центре рынка города. Он покупает товар с других рынка города и продает на местом рынке. Мансур хотел бы получит кредит в размере 800$ США для покупки полиэтиленовые пакеты. Он заранее благодарен всем за поддержку и милосердие.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Mansur is an honest and goal-oriented person.  He is a married and loving father of three children.  He started his business in order to provide for his family because he has a large family and does not have enough money to support three children.  He is involved in buying and selling plastic bags.  He owns a retail outlet at the market in city center.  He buys merchandise from other city markets and sells it at the local market.  Mansur wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $800 for the purchase of plastic bags.  He thanks you in advance for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bags

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge,  vive con su madre y una hija, solamente él trabaja en una panadería, inicio por sus amigos, quienes influyeron para que iniciara el negocio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar, huevos, aceite, leche, entre otros que son necesarios para preparar el pan, esta compra le ayudara a tener los materiales necesarios para la producción y así atender de una mejor manera a los clientes, este es su segundo préstamo para esta actividad.
El propósito es mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia, a través de su esfuerzo diario.
texts.en:
Jorge lives with his mother and daughter.  He works on his own in a bakery which his friends encouraged him to set up.

Jorge is currently requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, eggs, oil, milk and other products which he needs for making bread.  This purchase will help him to have available the materials he needs for making his products and to improve his customer service.  This is the second loan he has taken out for his business.

Jorge's goal is to improve his family's financial situation through his daily work.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs, oil and milk for his bakery

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
This is Benilda, 46, resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Edward, a maintenance staff member, and mother to her children. By the grace of God, She has managed to support her child's schooling. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Benilda operates a perfume business. What she basically does is buy perfume from wholesalers, sell them with a profit to her contact and customers. She also retail electronic cell phone loads for added income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php38, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of perfume products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Benilda dreams to expand her knowledge in doing business and also to be able to give her child a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for perfume products needed in her business

loans.name: Samarkan's Group

texts.en:
Samarkan is the leader of this group. She is 40 and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband she brings up three sons. The first son studies at school and the other two are preschool age. In 1995, with an initial investment of 2,000 soms, Samarkan started to sell grocery goods. At the moment her monthly profit is about 7,500 soms. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more home products, such as macaroni, sugar and oil. In the future with the profits gained from the trade she plans to expand the business.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase macaroni, sugar and oil to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 53 years old and married with six children.  She earns a living raising pigs in the Philippines.  Myrna is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase medicine and vaccines for her pigs.  Myrna has been raising pigs for 15 years.  She earns additional income buying and selling cosmetic products.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: purchase medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Elsa has a shop that sells ethyl alcohol, sanitary napkins, lotions & deodorants. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy stock like alcohol, sanitary napkins & lotions.

Elsa has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock like alcohol, sanitary napkins & lotions.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is 27 years old and the father of two daughters and one son.

Osama started a small business selling fruits and vegetables years ago. Because he didn’t have enough money to open a speciA. shop for that, he decided to use his bus as a base for his business. 

Now Osama has applied for a new loan to buy more fruits and vegetables that are requested by his customers so he can serve as many of the people living in the neighborhood as he can.

In the future, he is planning to open a grocery store in his area.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Edetha

texts.en:
Edetha is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Edetha has a shop that sells canned goods, eggs, coffee powder, and noodles. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more stock of eggs, coffee powder, noodles, and canned goods to sell.

Edetha has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edetha hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy eggs, coffee powder, noodles, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with four children. Elizabeth is 55 years old and lives in Mabini Street, Molave.

Elizabeth sells electronics to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month she earns 20,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase electronic materials for her electrical supply business.

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to invest in a business that will give satisfaction to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase electronic materials for her electrical supply business

loans.name: Volodimir

texts.ru:
Володимир – предприниматель из Ивано-Франковска. Он живет в городе вместе с женой и 10-летней дочкой. Володимир занимается пассажирскими перевозками по территории Украины. У него есть собственный автомобиль ГАЗ 31105, в котором стоит газобаллонное оборудование (метан).Транспортные услуги Володимир предоставляет уже на протяжении 2 лет. На данный момент его ежемесячный доход составляет около 6 000 гривен.  

Володимир планирует использовать сумму в 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы подготовить свое транспортное средство к зимним погодным условиям: приобрести зимние шины и сделать текущий ремонт ходовой части автомобиля. Этот бизнес является главным источником дохода для заемщика. Прибыль, полученную от бизнеса, Володимир хотел бы вложить в ремонтные работы в собственном доме.   
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Volodimir is an entrepreneur in Ivano-Frankivsk. He lives in the city with his wife and 10-year-old daughter. Volodimir drives a taxi in Ukraine. He has his own car, a GAZ 31105, which runs on methane. Volodimir has been driving a taxi for two years. Currently, his monthly income is about 6,000 hryvnia. 

Volodimir plans to use 5,000 hryvnia to winterize his car: to buy snow tires and to repair the suspension on the car. This business the primary source of income for the borrower. Volodimir would like to use the profit he makes to repair his home.

loans.use: to winterize his taxi

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu lives in Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (two sisters and a brother). 

Nulu has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Nulu sells her products from home. Nulu has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through rental houses.

The main business challenges for Nulu include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big, start selling through wholesale only and also to educate her children up to the university level. Nulu lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es:
Kelly, de 20 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, es soltera y no tiene hijos ya que desea primero poder formarse profesionalmente y luego tener un hijo. Vive en casa de sus padres en donde todos los días comparte con ellos la alegría de estar juntos y trabajar para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Kelly consiste en la venta de comida, todos los días sale a la vereda de su casa por las mañanas para así vender sus jugos y sandwich, después por las tardes vende menú ya que tiene muchos clientes que se van a su establecimiento y reciben un trato amable, buena sazón y alimentos de calidad. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 3 años y empezó siendo ayudante de su madre quien ahora le dio el control total del negocio ya que desea descansar, es por eso que ella ahora trabaja mucho ya que además de todo esto estudia y tiene que darse tiempo y sobre todo tener los ingresos para poder realizar ambas cosas.
Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que aparte de brindarle un tiempo disponible, también le genera muy buena ganancias, antes de poder realizar este trabajo tenía problemas con el pago de su mensualidad en el instituto en donde estudia, pero ahora esta mas tranquila ya que tiene un respaldo económico. Le gustaría mucho poder ampliar su negocio y colocar mesas, sillas e implementar con utensilios que le faltan. Este será el crédito número 4 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Ella por su parte se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, así como lo hizo en sus créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para poder seguir realizando su trabajo, además implementarlo y así poder brindar una mejor atención.
texts.en:
Kelly, 20, is a good-hearted, kind and hard-working woman who is single and has no children.  She wants to receive professional training before having children.  She lives with her parents and enjoys being close to them while working to give them a better quality of life.

Kelly's work consists of selling food off the front porch in the morning.  She sells juices and sandwiches and in the afternoon menu items, since she has many customers who go to her establishment because of her attentiveness, quality food and delicious dishes.  She has been in business for three years and started with the help of her mother who has now turned over the control because she wants to retire.  In addition to working hard, Kelly also studies so she needs an income to be able to do both things.

She enjoys her work because it allows her to have time off but also generates a good income.  Before she started the business she had problems paying the monthly fee at the institute where she studies, but now she feel relieved that she has economic support.  Her goal is to expand her business and set up tables and chairs and buy the utensils she needs.  This is her fourth loan through MFP and she is very content knowing she can count on the financial support which makes her more confident that her business will advance.

She is committed to paying the loan on time as with the previous loans.  She plans to use the 1,200 PEN loan to buy ingredients and supplies to continue with her work and provide better customer service.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 46-year old married woman with 8 children living in a permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. Her current business is selling secondhand clothes. She has been dealing in this business for the last 10 years. She started with 2,000,000 UGX, but now it is worth 5,000,000 UGX. Although Jane is progressing well, she faces a challenge of high fuel and transportation costs. Her dream is educating her children and expanding her business into a renowned boutique in town. Jane needs the loan to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario tiene 35 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Gloria de 33 años y sus 03 queridos hijos. Mario es un hombre muy trabajador, pues se dedica con mucho esmero en el cultivo de café, producto que una vez cosechado los lleva a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, en donde ya tiene diversos compradores, que por la calidad del mismo compran al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva  22 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus chacras de la plaga de insectos, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado por que los productos químicos causan reacciones y teme por su salud posteriormente. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos por que desea comprar nuevas tierras. Por tanto este será su crédito número 05 con MFP, sabe que éste aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, contratará jornaleros para que lo apoyen en el mantenimiento respectivo de sus cultivos como: podar las plantas, sacar la maleza y fumigar.
texts.en:
Mario is 35 years old and a very hardworking man.  He lives in his own house with his spouse, Gloria, 33, and their three beloved children.  Mario is a very hardworking man who puts much dedication into his coffee crops; a product that once harvested is taken to be sold in the city of San Francisco where he has several buyers who buy from him at wholesale because of its quality.

What he most enjoys about his work is planting his fields and making them fertile and productive.  He’s been in this line of work for 22 years and considers the most difficult part fumigating his fields for insect infestations because he has to do it very carefully because the chemicals cause reactions and he fears for his health in the future.

He hopes to continue saving income because he wants to buy new fields.  This will be MFP loan #5.  He knows that this will be very beneficial for his work’s development.  He will use the 1000 new soles to hire day laborers who can help him with crop maintenance: pruning, weeding and fumigating.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du BENKADI II sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Beleniko, un des villages de la   préfecture de Dioïla.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, OUMOU, première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare  de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  75.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en: Elnora was born in 1983 year. She is divorced and brings her son alone. Her son Jahongir is little. Elnora always tries to offer good living condition for her son. She has been busy with farming. She grows crops and vegetables. She has additional income from animal husbandry during some years. She buys cows, feeds some months and sells in a local market. Thanks good condition of cows she has repeated buyers in a local market. Elnora now feeds 4 cows. She has a big cowshed in her house. Elnora makes twice sowing in a year. She is asking for a loan of 7800 Somoni to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel for new sowing season. She awaits your mercy and generosity.

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel for new sowing season

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en: Mrs. Adesuwa O. is 34 years old, and is married with two children.  She lives in an urban area in the Edo State of Nigeria, and owns a clothing store. Adesuwa spent five months learning her trade before she started her own business in 2005. She would like a loan to increase her inventory and grow her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Julie is 48 years old and married with 4 children. She had no formal education but manages a popular spot that provides catering services to residents of the haulage terminal. Her work sometimes goes deep into the night since some drivers arrive late and must be attended to.

As a recent beneficiary of KRABAN'S learning sessions, Julie sees the KIVA loan as a major boost to her business. She would like to take full advantage and accordingly provide quality service to her clients.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en: Etibar is an IDP from Jabrail district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is married and has four children. He started his business in 1996, and borrowed four Normicro loans from Baku branch  totaling $5050. He would now like to borrow an additional $1200 so that he may increase the variety of goods he can offer.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
32 year-old GUADALUPE is seperated and is the mother of 3. She dedicates herself to the sale of grains (beans, coffee, maiz, pumpkin seeds) that she purchases in bulk from the city and sells them at the marketplace outside the city. She is a member of the group Agua 2 along with doña Juana B. Hernández who also sells beans and maiz. Both anticipate investing in the purchase of more merchandise and preparing a location from where to sell their goods.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

GUADALUPE, tiene 32 años, 3 hijos, separada se dedica a la venta granos, (fríjol, café, maíz, pepitas de calabazas) que compra con mayoristas de la ciudad y posteriormente lo vende en las afueras del mercado de la ciudad. Pertenece al grupo Agua 2 junto con doña Juana B. Hernández quien también se dedica a la venta de fríjol y maíz Ambas esperan invertir el préstamo comprando más artículos y acondicionar un lugar donde colocar sus productos a la venta.

loans.use:
Traditional Foods Vendor

VENTA DE ALIMENTOS TIPICOS

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad, 44-years old, married and father of five children, owns a tailor factory in a village close to Saida in the South of Lebanon. Mohamad has been a client of Majmoua for the past five years. When he first came to Majmoua, he had a single machine and a lot of debts. With the consecutive loans he received from Majmoua, he bought new sewing machines for his factory, was able to recruit seamstresses increase his inventory of fabrics, and was finally able to answer the demand for his clothes. He has a very good record of on-time repayments. Mohamad is requesting a loan for $1,200 to purchase a large quantity of fabrics to produce winter clothes as the summer season is now over. Mohamad, who has a very high business turnover, will be able to repay the loan within four months.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of fabrics to produce winter clothes

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: With her second loan, Victoria hopes to buy more things for her sewing business. This has been a main source of income for her, and she wants to ensure that the business continues in the future. Through SPBD, she has been able to start a sewing business, and this has also meant saving a lot of costs for her, as she is now able to make clothes for her family and children. She also makes her own children’s school uniforms and with the white Sunday that has just passed , new clothes for her children was the least of her worries as she was able to make them herself. She is thankful for the assistance from SPBD and that she now has a business of her own. She will continue to use the help of SPBD in the future where needed to ensure that she sustains her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Yulyani

texts.en: Yulyani is a 28-year-old woman who has five children aged 14, 12, 10, 4 and 2 years old. The first three are boys and the last two are girls. She collects and sells waste materials such as plastic cups, bottles cups, etc. She usually earns US$15 income per week. Her husband, J., is a driver who earns US$3 per day. She is a member of MBK and requesting a loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Zulfuzor

texts.ru:
Zulfuzor B. is 36 years old; she finished high school, is married and has 5 children. Zulfuzor sells food at "Dekhon" market in Tursun-zoda city. Her primary goods are cookies and other sweets.

With the loan that she hopes to receive, she will purchase more goods. She buys her goods in Dushanbe. This loan will give local buyers an opportunity to buy cookies and sweets during holidays and other days without having to leave their city.

The client plans to repay the loan within 4 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Болтаева Зулфузор, возраст – 36 года, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 5-х детей. Зулфузор имеет торговую точку по торговле продуктами питания на рынке города Турсунзаде под названием «Дехкон». Основным её товаром, которым она торгует это печенье и другие сладости. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести новый ассортимент товар. Товар она приобретает в городе Душанбе. Данный кредит даст возможность местным жителям приобретать печенье, сладости в праздники и в другие в дни, при этом не выезжая за пределы своего города. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 4 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase food for resale

loans.name: Patricia.

texts.en: Patricia I. is 35 years old, is married with four children, and hails from Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She lives in Okoko, Lagos State. She sells drinks and bakes snacks for sale and has been in business since 2003. She needs a loan of $600 to enable her buy an industrial oven to make her business more profitable. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy an industrial oven.

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Mrs. Orn C. and her husband have been married for thirty-seven years. They have eight children; six sons and two daughters. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home; the other three are farming with their parents. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Orn and her husband have been farming for forty-three years. They grow bananas and corns on a farm far from their house. They are in late 50’s but still strong enough to work.

Mrs. Orn is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $1100 to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides for growing corn and cucumbers.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides for growing corn and cucumbers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
K. Mary is a fishmonger. She is a single parent and has 5 dependents. She buys fresh fish from  fishermen processes and then sells the fish to her customers. She wants to increase sales to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

She is asking for $425 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.
