loans.name: Julie

texts.en: “Big J. Food is a very neat restaurant, and the food is sweet; coupled with the services, I like it,” says one of Julie I.'s numerous customers. Julie is 39 years old and married with 5 children; she operates a restaurant, which she learned from her mother, and she started hers in 1989. She needs the loan of $875 to buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale. She says, “Thank you, Kiva and its lenders.”

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Salomatkhon

texts.en:
R. Salomatkhon is 41 years old. She is a widow and has three children. Her eldest son is already going to university. She has to work hard as she is the only source of income for her family. Salomatkhon is a market vendor selling children's clothing. She has been in the business for two years. She began her business with $100 US Dollars and currently has $1000 US Dollars of working capital.

She delivers the goods from the market “Korvon” with the help of her eldest son. She is trying to diversify the range of goods that she sells to satisfy the needs of her clients, who have various levels of income. The business is stable, allowing Salomatkhon to be able to keep her family intact and provide the best future for her children, with education.

Salomatkhon is planning to purchase new children's clothing for the summer season. For this purpose, she requests 1700 Somoni ($500 US Dollars) for the term of 8 months.

Salomatkhon thanks all those supporting her and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner. Let’s get behind this dedicated working mother and help her grow her business.

loans.use: Purchasing new children's clothing to increase the variety of goods sold

loans.name: Tuti

texts.en:
Tuti F. is 48 years old. She is a widow with four children. After the death of her husband she was depressed and couldn’t find a place for a long time. Now 3 months has passed since her husband died of a heart attack and she has decided to continue her life for the sake of her children. For about ten years Tuti has been selling clothing for kids and women. As she had always liked sales, it went well after the business was started, and she has continued selling clothing since then. From the profit of her business, she takes care of her  children. She tries to choose various goods of good quality and attractive prices which allows her to keep her clientele. 
Today Tuti requests a $900 loan  for the term of 12 months. She will use the loan to purchase  new summer goods for kids and women. This purchase will enable her to restore her business, to earn money, and to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: Purchasing of  new summer clothing for kids and women to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Maibonu

texts.ru:
Maibonu Z. lives in the city of Yavan. She sells children's clothing on the central market. She has spent all her money to purchase goods at the beginning of the season. Currently she needs to pay for rent and has decided to obtain a loan for 10 months. She will pay rent, which will allow her to work at her sales location for a long time without any issues. She has permanent clients that know where she is located and therefore it would be not to Maibonu's advantage to change locations. She has been in sales for the past 8 years. She is divorced and has 2 daughters.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Зикирова Майбону проживает в городе Яван. Работает на центральном рынке , где торгует одеждой для детей. С началом сезона все ее деньги ушли на приобретение товара. А в данный момент ей необходимо оплатить арендную плату , поэтому она решила получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев. Она оплатит аренду и будет долгое время торговать на своей торговой точке без проблем. Кроме того у нее есть постоянные клиенты , которые знают ее постоянное место работы. И поэтому менять его ей не выгодно. Занимается троговлей уже 8 лет. Она разведена и имеет двух дочек.

loans.use: Rent

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married and has seven children, all between 1 and 24 years old. Rehema works as a charcoal seller, earning a monthly profit of about US$35.

Currently, she needs a loan to buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 34 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos, los mismos que están estudiando, el vive junto a su pareja Viviana, con quien mantiene una relación conyugal de 12 años, y la apoya mucho.  Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, es chofer, desde hace 3 años, gracias a su buena administración del dinero, ahora es propietario de un motocarro, el cual le ayuda a fortalecer su hogar, con el ingreso que tiene de su motocarro apoya a su pareja, que se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches . Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer a mucha gente con quienes incluso comparte ideas y además no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido.   Trabaja para la educación de sus hijos y desde luego para solventar sus gastos diarios.  Desea mandar a reparar su motocarro y trabajar tranquilo, posteriormente quiere comprarse otra moto.
texts.en:
Luis is 34 years old and he is the father of three children, all of whom are attending school. He lives together with his partner Viviana, with whom he has had a common-law relationship for the past 12 years. She supports him in everything. His occupation is passenger transport. He has been a driver for the past 3 years and thanks to his savvy financial administration, his is now the owner of his own motorcycle, a tool that has helped him establish his home. With the income earned with his motorcycle he is able to support his partner, she sells prepared foods in the evenings. What he loves about his work is that he gets to meet so many people and he gets to share ideas with them, and also, he loves that he can choose his own hours of work. He works hard to provide an education for his children and to cover the daily expenses. He wants to have his motorcycle repaired to work without worries of it failing, and in the future, he hopes to purchase a second motorcycle.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle, with which he provides passenger transport.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Mrs. Sara N. was born in 1968 and lives in Trapeang Svay Village in Takeo Province. She is 40 years old and the mother of five children: one of her sons is a construction worker, another is a monk, two others attend the local school, and her youngest, at one year old, is too young to work or study.

Mrs. Sara N. is a farmer, and she cultivates rice on a small plot of land to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Ngaet Ork, is a construction worker who earns $2 a day. Despite their both having jobs, this is not enough money to support their family.  In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sara N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a breeding cow. She hopes to increase their income by selling bred cows in addition to rice.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
La señora Vicenta vive en alquiler en la calle Alcoreza de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene una tienda de abarrotes a una cuadra de su casa , con cuya actividad sustenta su alimentación y necesidades mensuales.

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de arroz, fideo y otros productos para poder surtir su tienda y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos 

La señora trabaja con Impro desde hace mucho tiempo y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno y por lo tanto califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Vicenta lives in a rental apartment on Alcoreza Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosi area of the city of La Paz; she has a grocery store a block from her house, which provides for her monthly expenses.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of rice, noodles and other products to supply her store and improve her income.

She has worked with with Impro for a long time, has a very good payment history and thus is eligible to obtain a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, and other products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Qatrawi

texts.en: Quatrawi E. lives in Ştefăneşti village, in the district of Stefan Voda. Since February 2008, she has been active in the village Ştefăneşti Hall, and is currently the board secretary. She previously worked as a secretary at the City of Stefan-Voda district. She has requested a loan to buy a portable computer, which is very necessary for both her work and her free time. This portable computer will be very helpful in the future.

loans.use: To buy a portable computer

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam B., 41, pictured here, is married and lives with his wife in Battambang province, Cambodia. He purchases and sells rice to earn a living and is able to make around US$10 in revenue every day. His wife, Huy Maly, 24, is a housewife and stays at home to cook food for the family and look after the children. Mr. Sam B. would like to take out a loan to purchase rice in bulk for re-sale.

loans.use: Purchase of rice in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Loyda

texts.es: Loyda tiene 46 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en una casa arrendada. Ella tiene un puesto de comida en una zona turística y campestre de su localidad, vende los platos típicos de su tierra a los turistas y visitantes que acuden en busca de la gastronomía típica, es por ello que Loyda ha logrado  tener ventas exitosas que la coronan como una de las mejores cocineras de su región. Este negocio lo realiza los fines de semana, los demás días se dedica en organizar lo que cocinará y comprará para preparar sus comidas y cuando llega el día sábado se va muy temprano con todo lo preparado para  su puesto de ventas. Con esta forma de trabajo Loyda ha obtenido ingresos para su hogar desde hace más de 2 años, y tiene deseos de seguir trabajando, ya que para ella cocinar es una gran recompensa. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a ser parte de su banco comunal al ser conocida por los integrantes que notaron la responsabilidad y compromiso con el que trabaja. El dinero que solicita es para invertir en la compra de cuyes, base de la preparación de uno de los platos más famoso de su zona, con ello podrá cubrir un pedido que le hicieron para un evento social grande.
texts.en:
Loyda is 46 years old and lives with her three children in a rented house. She has a food stand in a touristic, rural town in her area. She sells regional dishes to tourist and visitors looking for local cuisine. She has had good fortune with her sells and has been recognized as one of the best cooks of the area. She works on weekends; during the week she organizes her shopping and makes the preparations for the weekend sells. On Saturdays, she leaves the house very early taking the food with her to the stand. This kind of work is rewarding for her and has provided an income for the last two years, so she would like to continue. This is the first time Loyda requests a loan from MFP. She was invited by her community bank to join, because they see her as a very responsible person with a lot of commitment towards her work. The loan, would allowed her to buy guinea pig meat, the staple ingredient for one of the most popular dishes of the area, for a large social event order entrusted to her.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pig meat to prepare her dishes

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz A. Velásquez vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Las Lomas, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo,  y sus dos  hijos.
Beatriz es empleada en una lavandería y su esposo realiza empanadas que vende a las tiendas de barrio.
El crédito es para la refacción del ambiente que usan para la elaboración de masitas, y así lograr una mejor producción.
Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Beatriz A. Velásquez lives in her own house in the zone of Las Lomas, on the west side of La Paz, with her husband and her two children. Beatriz works in a laundromat and her husband makes empanadas which he sells to neighborhood shops. Her loan will go towards refurbishing of area they use to prepare the dough, enabling them to achieve greater production. This is the first loan request from Beatriz and their socioeconomic analysis shows she and her husband to be favorably qualified to have access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Nicoll, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Mukimichon

texts.ru: Магазин Мукимчона изменился с тех пор как он получил свой прошлый займ на КИВА. Ассортимент увеличен, и он включил в него новые товары: рис, масло растительное, муку и тп. Его старшая дочь помогает ему в бизнесе. Мукимичон планирует и дальше развивать свой бизнес, так как это его единственный источник дохода. На новый займ планирует приобрести оптом муку, так как цены на нее немного снизились, а спрос вырос и он считает что получить хорошую прибыль.
texts.en:
Mukimichon's store changed since his last Kiva loan. The assortment of goods is larger; now Mukimichon offers rice, vegetable oil, flour, etc. His elder daughter helps him with the store. Mukimichon is planning to expand his business because it is his only source of income. He plans to use the new loan for wholesale purchase of flour, because flour prices are currently down but demand for flour is up. This would allow Mukimichon to make profit.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wholesale purchase

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Ruth M. P. from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has three children between the ages of 13 and 20. Ruth has been running a batiki business since 2004. Batick pieces are traditional African clothing which is mostly worn by women. They look good when they are painted with dye and many people like them. Ruth works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Ruth currently earns about US$318 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase cloth and dye for making batik. In the future, she plans to establish a new business. Ruth thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and dye for making batik.

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en: Natsagdorj T. is 40, married and the father of two sons. Both his sons go to an elementary school. His family lives on rented land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2004, he started running a business at the "Harhorin" outdoor market selling men's and women's apparel. Natsagdorj's spouse, Enhtsetseg, helps her husband's business by going to Beijing, China once every two months to buy cheap clothing. With his profit Natsagdorj has opened a savings account in the name of his eldest son to prepare for his future. He also paid for his youngest son's tuition to study in an English language course in Ulaanbaatar. Natsagdorj is an open-minded and cheerful person. He requests a loan to buy more clothing to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Domingo Antonio

texts.es: Domingo Antonio M. C. de 30 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San José Villa nueva junto a su abuela. El posee una venta de helados y paletas en el municipio de Zaragoza, contiguo a la alcaldía de dicho lugar. Domingo obtiene muy buenas ganancias ya que es un negocio en el cual posee cliente los cuales consumen sus productos constantemente. Es por esto que Domingo solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más helados y paletas, de manera que pueda aumentar sus ganancias las cuales lo beneficien a él y a su abuela.
texts.en:
Domingo Antonio M. C., 30, lives in the San José Villa Nueva municipality with his grandmother. He sells ice cream and popsicles by the town hall in the Zaragoza municipality. Domingo gets good earnings since he has customers who eat his products all of the time. That is why Domingo is asking for a loan to buy more ice cream and popsicles. This way he can increase his earnings, which will benefit him and his grandmother.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ice cream and popsicles

loans.name: Mirzaga

texts.en:
The fact that Mirzaga S. is a hard-working person has allowed him over many years to earn enough income to support his four children. Together with his wife, Mirzaga is devoted to the raising of animals, especially cows which he buys and sells in his local market. In this manner, he obtains the income that he needs.

In order to increase his income and revitalize his business, Mirzaga is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase young cattle. This purchase will enable him to increase his sales, earn more, and meet the needs of his children.

loans.use: To purchase four calves.

loans.name: Ojelabi

texts.en: J. sells foodstuffs. She has been in this business for eight years. She is requesting a loan amount of N160,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. J. has been borrowing from LAPO for over three years. She is 54 years old and is married with two children.  She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is already 59 years old. She helps her husband manage their rice fields so that they develop a good harvest every cropping season. In connection with this, she is requesting loan assistance from Kiva amounting to PHP 24,000 to buy their needed farm inputs such as fertilizers, seed variety and some insecticide/pesticide. She is thankful that through ASKI, she learned about Kiva loans and has had an opportunity to have financial assistance for their field. 

Virginia hopes that Kiva lenders will grant their needed amount. Virginia further said that, through farming, they are able to surpass every economic crisis. However, due to the prevalent increase in the prices of farming inputs, and just to survive every difficulty of life, they used to depend on lending traders who charge high interest rates. She hopes that through a Kiva loan, which is more favorable than loans from other traders, she and her husband will soon have a better harvest.

loans.use: To buy their needed farm inputs such as fertilizers, seed variety and some insecticide/pesticide

loans.name: El Buen Futuro Group 5

texts.en:
Antonia S. is the group leader of El Buen Futuro (a Good Future) Group. She has been selling new clothes for many years and loves helping people shop and giving people fashion advice. Four years ago, she started taking out micro-loans to grow her business. Since then, she has seen great success and has been able to sell much more. Her success even allowed her to send one of her children to college. 

Now she is seeking another loan to buy more pants to grow her business even more. Right now, she sells clothes from her house but her dream is to one day open up a store downtown. 

By helping to fund this loan you can help Antonia and all her group members come one step closer to achieving their dreams!

loans.use: Buy more pants

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 52 year married with seven children aged between 12 month and 30 years. Six of her children go to school. She resides and owns a two roomed house where she is staying with ten people. Margaret takes care of her mother who is 80 years There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area.   She doesn’t incur any extra transport as she buys from her place of work selling local brew and on average she sells to 15 customers a day. Margaret sells to mature people only people and works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent and medication. She has been in this business for the six and half years Margaret has been with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local brew .Margaret is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger so that she starts selling beers.  
 

.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local brew and Gin

loans.name: Silivelia

texts.en: Silivelia T. (0) is a 25-year-old woman living in the town of Saasaai. She is married and has four school-aged children. Silivelia owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling baked goods in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 400 WST a month. In 2009, Silivelia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversifier ses marchandises

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: The person appears in the picture here is Mrs. 58 years old Thy K. and a resident of Phnom Penh, where she has owned a plot of land that inherited from her grandfather since 1979. She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. She is widowed and the mother of seven children: one is married and live away from the family home, two are garment workers, and other four also take a farming business. Thy K. works hard at her business activities every day and never wastes time. Rice growing is Thy K.'s main source of income to sustain her family. She is applying for a loan to buy other farming supply which she will use to greatly grow crop on her own farmland.

loans.use: To buy other farming supply which she will use to greatly grow on her own farmland

loans.name: Arce

texts.en:
Arce Q. is from the village of Brgy, Kahulogan, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old. Arce is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Arce owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks such as "kiping" in the local community. Arce has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arce joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arce is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Arce from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family and save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Barangay 26, Kahulogan, Gingoog City, Misamis Orie

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Edelien

texts.en:
Edelien Y. is from the village of Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Edelien is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Edelien owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste, canned goods, bread etc. in the local community. Edelien has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Edelien joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edelien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Edelien is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Edelien from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando R. is from the village of Tamucco Sto.Niño, Cagayan. He is 40 years old. Rolando is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Rolando works in a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Rolando has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP every harvesting season.

In 2008, Rolando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolando has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. Rolando is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rolando from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Shella May

texts.en:
Shella May M. is from the village of Nicdao, Baungon Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Shella May is married and has one school-age child. 

To make a living, Shella May owns a specialized retail store which primarily sells gasoline and bananas in the local community. Shella May has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Shella May joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shella May is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Shella May from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is thirty-seven years old. He is married and has three children who are all in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading.

As the man of the family, Emmanuel works very hard to be able to cater for the home. He trades in electrical goods which he procures from Accra. He sells in a store by the roadside in his community.

Emmanuel has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods in bulk

loans.name: Government Technical Institute Group

texts.en:
These gentlemen are staff members of the Government Technical Institute Magburaka, Tonkolili District, northern Sierra Leone. Government Technical Institute, Magburaka, was founded in 1962 by the government for the promotion of technical and vocational education. They teach mechanical engineering, carpentry and joinery, block laying and concreting, automobile engineering, plumbing and sheet metal work, painting and decoration and many more subjects. Presently, the institute has a total of 17 staff and 300 pupils.

Government Technical Institute Magburaka is the only government technical institute in Magburaka town. Over the years, the institution has been able to train many technicians serving both within and without Sierra Leone. It makes good grades at the external examinations organized by City and Guilds of London Institute. The institution also serves as a consultancy and guard to the people of Magburaka.

This is the second loan Government Technical Institute is requesting from Kiva through SMT. School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Santigie A. T. (first row, second from right) is a lecturer at the institute and head of this group. Santigie is 56 years old, married and has 3 children – 1 in Senior Secondary School and 2 already grown-ups and on their own. Santigie has been teaching for 10 years now. With his share of the loan, Santigie will pay school fees for his child and invest the rest in his farm. He will buy goats and sheep and palm seeds to plant in his palm-tree farm.

loans.use: Pay school fees for his child and invest the rest in agriculture

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr: D. A. P. Germaine est née le 26 Décembre 1958 et est mariée à GOMEZ Marcel, un frigoriste. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Germaine vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses charges, Germaine mène comme activité, la vente de tissus et des mèches dans sa boutique size à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Germaine vend également des produits de la SOBEBRA (boissons) dans sa boutique, ce qui lui permet d'avoir plusieurs sources de revenu. Germaine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Germaine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de la clientèle.
texts.en:
P. Germaine D. A. was born on December 26, 1958 and is married to Marcel Gomez, a refrigeration engineer. They have four children who all attend school. The family lives in the Zogbo neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Germaine helps her husband to provide for their family, in that she sells fabrics and hair extensions in her home-based store. Additionally, she sells drinks from the Beninese Brewing Company (Sobébra) in her store, which enables her to have several sources of income. Germaine gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, and in Lomé (Togo). Since the demand of her customers keeps on increasing, Germaine came to Alidé and applied for a loan to boost her activity and better satisfy her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics and hair extensions

loans.name: Brak

texts.en:
Mr. Brak L., age 26, is single and lives with his widowed mother, sister and brothers in a small village off of National Road Number Two about 20 km south of Phnom Penh. He is a construction contractor. In the past, he used to be an electrician too. He wants to purchase construction materials to operate his business, but he does not have enough money. Hence, he is requesting a loan of US $1,200 to use for that purpose. 

Brak is not in the photo; his mother is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Maria Irene

texts.es:
La Sra. B. C. vende frutas y verduras en su casa de habitación y vende gaseosas y cosas de bisuteras en la acera de la escuela especial  Teodoro King.
Ella va a utilizar el crédito para comprar 1 termo grande para meter gaseosas y bisuterías como galletas, chicles, bombones, chocolates, etc. para vender. 

Ella ha tenido 2 créditos con la Institución, los cuales dice que le han servido de mucho porque gracias a la ayuda que le ha brindado CEPRTODEL, ha podido ampliar su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Irene B. C. sells fruits and vegetables out of her home, and she sells pieces of jewelry on the grounds of the Teodoro King School. She plans to use her loan to buy a large cooler to put her beverages in and and for the other items she sells, which include crackers, gum, candy, chocolate, etc. She has had two previous loans with this lending institution, and she says that they have served her well as, thanks to the help from Ceprodel, she has been able to grow her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a large cooler for beverages and jewelry items

loans.name: Seydy

texts.es:
Seydy M. Suarez   es una señora de 30 años de edad la cual  es una madre soltera que vive con su hijo de 10 años en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Doña Seydy decidió hace  año un tener su propio negocio es así como inicio con una librería, considera que fue una buena idea ya que no había ninguna en su comunidad y los estudiantes tenían que viajar en Bici varias horas para poder adquirir sus materiales. Asegura que su negocio le ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo. Ella considera que es hora de dar un paso adelante y hacer más grande su librería. 

Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo por ¢665000 (seiscientos sesenta y cinco  mil colones) para comprar  más libros para abastecer su librería y así brindar más y mejores servicios que puedan satisfacer las necesidades de los habitantes de la comunidad en especial los estudiantes. 

Doña Seydy es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito pueden ayudar a muchas madres soltera a ser exitosas como microempresarias.
texts.en:
Seydy M. Suarez is a 30 year-old woman. She is a signle mother who lives with her 10 year-old son in a community named Santa Fe located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. The community is known for being a mountainous zone near the northern border of the country. Her principal economic activities are livestock and agriculture, specifically the planting of basic grains, sugar cane, and oranges. A year ago, Ms. Seydy decided to start her own business, so she opened a boookstore. She thinks it was a good idea because there was no bookstore in her community and the local students had to travel hours on bike to get their materials for school. She assures her business improved the quality of life for her and her son. She believes it is time to move forward and enlarge her store. Currently, she needs a loan of ¢665000 (six hundred sixty-five thousand colones) to buy more books to stock her bookstore. This will allow her to offer greater and better services that will be able to satisfy the needs of the community, particularly the students. Ms. Seydy is a member of the community bank Manantial in Santa Fe, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and with it she hopes to grow on a personal and economic level. She also stresses that thanks to these types of organizations and means of facilitating loans can help many single mothers be successful small businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying books and improving store

loans.name: Asterios

texts.es:
El señor Asterio de 45  años de edad es comerciante,  se dedica a la venta de carnes. 
Cuenta con la ayuda de su familia conformada por su señora esposa  y un hijo barón de 20 años de edad. 
Anteriormente trabajaba para otro negocio luego se independizó y abrió su propia carnicería, actualmente cuenta con todos los equipos necesarios de carnicería(ceruchos electricos, heladeras, mesa carneceria), y con clientela formada.
 
Solicita el préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra de carnes en cantidad para satisfacer  la demanda que tiene.
texts.en:
Mr. Asterio is years old and works selling meat. He depends upon the help of his family, which is made up of his wife and a 20 year old son. He previously worked for a different business, but then he started a business by opening his own butcher shop. He currently has all the necessary butcher equipment (electric saws, freezers, butcher block) and regular customers. He is asking Fundación Paraguaya for a loan to buy meat in bulk to provide for the current demands.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat in bulk

loans.name: Litia

texts.en:
Litia O. is 51 years old, married, and blessed with five children. She and her husband work together to raise their big family. They are currently living at Talim, Binangonan Rizal, Philippines. Litia is a woman of good faith who wishes to conquer all challenges to achieve her family's dreams. 
Litia’s main goal is to build a sustainable business to meet the needs of her five children. To do this, she was encouraged to join Kiva partner, ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), a microfinance institution in the Philippines, in 2007. The previous loans she has received from ASHI were carefully invested in her sari-sari (variety) store. Since then, the business has been performing well and earning her sufficient profit. She is grateful that she has been able to educate her children using proceeds from her business as she continues to expand. Litia now needs a loan to boost her business for increased profitability.
Litia started her sari-sari store on her own initiative. She wants to continue her business, and is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to use as additional capital to improve her business and income. Specifically, the money will be used to purchase five sacks of rice, charcoal, sugar, canned goods, cigarettes, fabric conditioner and other supplies for her store. 
Litia dreams of growing her variety store into a mini-grocery store and expanding it to other villages. Her family is her inspiration to pursue her business. She now feels very happy with ASHI's services as they give her a big chance to pursue her family's dreams. She hopes that they continue their services for a long time and help many families who want to get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of rice, charcoal, sugar, canned goods, cigarettes, fabric conditioner and other supplies

loans.name: Diakher

texts.fr: Diakher D. est une femme de 35 ans, elle est célibataire sans enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de NDONDOL depuis le 25 juin 2002 et a 15 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et a toujours remboursé à 100%. Elle développe diverses activités, à savoir le commerce de parfums, l’embouche ovine et de produits cosmétiques. Elle est également tresseuse. Avec son crédit elle va s’approvisionner en marchandises et acheter des mèches pour son activité de tresse. Ces activités lui procurent de revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et de renforcer son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
Diakher D., 35, is single and has no children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" of NDONDOL since June 25, 2002 and has received 15 consecutive loans which have always been reimbursed 100%. She has several businesses, selling perfume, fattening sheep, and selling cosmetics. She is also good at braiding hair. With her loan, she is going to add to her inventory and also buy hair extensions for her braiding business. These activities earn income that allows her to support herself and put aside more in savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: develop and promote her income-generating activities

loans.name: Jazmin Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Jazmín” esta representado por la señora Mercedes y conformado por 10 socias D. los cuales 3 son varones y el resto son mujeres, este banco se caracteriza por ser muy unido y responsable. La señora Mercedes muy respetada por sus compañeras del banco comunal, tiene 3 hijos, el menor D. ellos tiene 3 años, mercedes se dedica a la venta D. suministros y víveres que da a crédito y también se dedica a la venta D. electrodomésticos, vive en la misma zona con sus compañeros D. grupo por lo que es muy conocida y la mayoría la respetan y aprecian, las expectativas D. Mercedes son D. crecer y aumentar el capital con el cuál trabaja y un día llegar a contar con un capital propio, para ampliar sus mercados. El resto del grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades como la venta D. quinua, tienda D. barrio, venta D. comestibles, venta D. ropa, venta D. artículos D. limpieza, venta D. comida. El grupo en general tiene bastante experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan y es por esta razón que tiene ya un mercado fijo en el cual desempañarse. Si bien la competencia en general es bastante amplia, el grupo cuenta con experiencia y también con clientes fijos que reconocen su trabajo y demandan sus servicios, por otra parte es importante el entusiasmo que ponen a lo que hacen. El presente crédito será utilizado como capital D. operaciones, unos comprarán más productos y mercaderías, otros utilizaran el crédito como capital D. trabajo. La expectativa que tiene el grupo es D. seguir trabajando y contando sobre todo con el apoyo económico para seguir creciendo en sus negocios. El banco tiene bastante experiencia crediticia ya que no es la primera vez que obtienen un crédito, el presente por ejemplo es su cuarto ciclo en nuestra institución y durante todo el tiempo D. relación comercial ellos demostraron ser personas responsables y puntuales con sus pagos.
texts.en:
The Jasmine Communal Bank is represented by Sra. Mercedes and consists of ten members. Three are men while the remaining members are women. This Communal Bank is known for being close-knit and responsible.

Sra. Mercedes is well-respected by her fellow Communal Bank members. She has three children. Her youngest child is three years old. Mercedes sells supplies and groceries on credit. In addition, she sells household appliances. She lives in the same area as the other group members. Mercedes is well-known and most of the members respect and appreciate her. Her expectations are to grow and increase her working capital so that one day she has her own resources to expand her businesses.

The other members have different business activities including selling quinoa, operating a neighborhood store, selling groceries, clothing, cleaning supplies, and food. They have enough experience to develop their businesses and operate in stable markets. Even though competition continues to increase, the members are experienced enough and have established customers who are familiar with their work and demand their services. Their enthusiasm also plays an important part in what they do. Some will use this current loan to buy more products and merchandise. Others will use the funds as operating capital. The group expects to continue working and receiving the financial support needed to grow their businesses. This is not the first time they have obtained a loan, so the Communal Bank members have sufficient credit experience. At the moment, they are in their fourth loan cycle with Fundación AgroCapital. All this time, the members have proven that they are responsible and prompt with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn B. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 37 years old. Jenelyn is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Jenelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jenelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month for these activities.

Jenelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jenelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean C. is from the village of Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 20 years old, is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Jean owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing tricycle transport services to local community members. Jean is just starting this business.

In 2010, Jean joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to repair the transport vehicle used in the business. Jean is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will also be used to repair her business's transport vehicle. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jean from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her extended family members. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the transport vehicle used in the business.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Eron

texts.en:
Eron is a single mother of ten children, six of whom go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member. Eron rents a two-roomed house with no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, food and rent.
Eron owns a stall in Naguru selling second-hand clothes. She buys bales of second-hand clothes from traders in Nabugabo Road in Kampala city. She uses public transport to and from the traders and visits them once every two weeks. She wants to use this loan of 800,000 UGX to buy more bales of second-hand clothes for her business.
Eron doesn’t pay rent for her business but she does pay monthly market dues. She has been in this business for over 18 years. She sells retail to all categories of people. She works six days a week and, besides this clothing business, she also rears chickens at her home. Her business challenge is the rainy season as she works from an open place.
Eron's aspiration is to start to import bales of second-hand clothes herself. She joined Kiva partner, MCDT, because of the low interest charged.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en: Samvel A. has been in the furniture business since December of 2002. He supports his immediate family and his elderly parents. Currently Samvel is making and selling furniture made to order. To increase his turnover, Samvel has applied for the loan aiming to purchase readymade furniture items.

loans.use: purchasing readymade furniture items

loans.name: Pedro Hernan

texts.es: El Sr. B. C. Pedro Hernan vive en el distrito de Tate junto a su esposa. Trabaja como obrero de campo en el fundo El Pedregal desde hace 10 años. Cuenta con casa propia a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para terminar de realizar acabados a su vivienda a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. Su sueño segun nos comenta es poder darle a su esposa una mejor calidad de vida. El Sr. B. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Pedro Hernan B. C. lives with his wife in the Tate district. He has been a field worker for the El Pedregal farm for ten years. He has his own home, and he is making the final touches. He is requesting a loan to complete the final touches on his house. He wants to do this to be able to give his family a better quality of life. His dream, as he tells us, is to be able to give his wife a better quality of life. Mr. B. is grateful for the support that we are able to give him through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Costa

texts.en:
Costa K. is married and has seven children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of some of her in-laws. Costa lives in a home that she owns in the Kawempe neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and rent for her business premises.

Costa recently changed her business enterprise from frying samosas and chapatti to selling cereals. She has been in this business for a few months, and she works six days a week. Costa sells her products wholesale at the market. She also generates additional income by renting rooms. The main business challenges for Costa include transportation and seasonality.

Costa has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of cowpeas. Her goal for her business is to start going directly to farmers for cowpeas and also to own a delivery van.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cowpeas

loans.name: Segundo Julio

texts.es:
Segundo es un padre de familia de 69 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de San José, una zona agrícola perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad. Ubicada a mas de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la crianza y venta de animales menores, el cría patos, gallinas, cerdos cuyes y conejos en unos corrales situados en la parte posterior se su domicilio, alimentándolos de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Esta actividad es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia por lo que siempre se esfuerza para mantenerla.

Segundo desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas animales para criarlos y venderlos, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.

Segundo es una persona entregada a su trabajo y que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y responsable.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 69 year old father who lives with his wife in the San José district, an agricultural area in the Pacasmayo province, in the La Libertad region. It is located more than two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. For more than five years he has raised and sold small animals, he raises ducks, chickens, pigs, guinea pigs and rabbits in some pens situated at the back of his home, feeding them grain and natural fodder. When they have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to the business owners who always visit the area where he lives. This business is an important source of income for the economic well being of his family therefore he always works hard to maintain it. Segundo wants to grow his business buying more animals to raise and sell, as he does not have sufficient capital to realize this he has seen the need to request from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 600 nuevos soles for the first time. Segundo is a person who is devoted to his work and who always gives his best to get his family ahead. People who know him consider him to be a calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals to raise and sell to increase business.

loans.name: Benkadi (Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 7 enfants et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Chien Kamakan ex-arrondissement de Yangasso, préfecture de SAN  (région de SEGOU République du Mali). 
Elles se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles exercent presque la même activité d’achat et de vente  des condiments et de diverses marchandises. Elles sont très sollicitées dans ces différentes activités. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe a décidé d’intégrer ’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). 
DJENEBOU T., la présidente du groupe compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une grande quantité de  condiments alimentaires à un prix abordable à Bla. Les condiments sont vendus en détail et au comptant  à la foire hebdomadaire du village et dans les autres foires environnantes du village. 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 10.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. 
Elle ambitionne d’agrandir son commerce avec l’ouverture d’un magasin de vente de condiments.
texts.en:
The women who form the Benkadi group are all married, averaging 33 years of age and 7 children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Chien-Kamakan, ex-district of Yangasso, San Prefecture (Segou Region of Mali). They know each other as neighbors and relatives. They all do similar work, buying and reselling condiments and various goods. Their businesses are very popular with customers.

In order to meet the ever growing customer demand, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yriwaso and are now on the first solidarity loan (group loan). Djenebou T., the group’s leader, plans to use her loan to purchase a large quantity of food condiments at reasonable prices. The condiments are retailed for cash at the weekly market at their village and at other nearby markets. Djenebou plans to achieve an average monthly income of 10,000 West African Francs, which will be used to pay off the interest on her loan and provide for family needs, with the rest reinvested in her business. Her goal is to enlarge her business and open a condiment store.

loans.use: Purchasing condiments

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik H. is from the village of Vahramaberd in the Shirak region of Armenia. She previously lived it the city of Gyumri and moved to the village for the possibility to start up her own business. For the past eight years, Hasmik has been raising cattle and growing vegetables. She considers herself to be an honest hardworking person.

In addition to her small business, Hasmik is a teacher at a nearby university. The income she receives from her own business helps support the family as teacher’s salaries are quite low. Hasmik is married with twins – a boy and girl (nineteen years old).  In addition to supporting her family, Hasmik dreams of remodeling the family home. She is looking for a loan to purchase additional cattle and grow her business. She expects the family's income to increase by thirty percent with the investment.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Erika Anay

texts.es: Erika, es una persona que trabaja en una maquiladora, y vive con su hermana menor que depende de ella, ya que su familia se encuentra en estados unidos, y la casa donde viven es prestada por un familiar cercano, erika se intereso en  Fundacion para la vivienda, solicitando un prestamo para comprar una computadora que le hace mucha falta a su hermana , ya que donde estudia le encargan mucha tarea impresa y consultas pero no tenian la solvencia economica para comprarla de contado, y  recurrieron a la ayuda de esta institucion, y lograr el sueño de su hermanita, y siente que el tener la computadora  los estudios mejoraran cada dia mas.y asi tener un futuro prospero y feliz.
texts.en: Erika is a person who works at an assembly plant and lives with her younger sister who depends on her since their family is in the United States. The house where they live was loaned to them by a close relative.  Erika became interested in the Foundation para la Vivienda and she is asking for a loan to buy a computer that her sister really needs, since where she goes to school they assign a lot of printed homework and research. She does not have the money to pay for it upfront, so they turned to this insitution for help. This will acheive her little sister's dream and she feels that having the computer will make her education improve more every day. This way, she will have a happy and prosperous future.

loans.use: She will buy a computer for her younger sister who depends on her.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 31-year-old innovative father of three living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to increase his daily income and savings for his family and to educate his children so they attain better qualifications. He sells secondhand shoes and has been in the business for four years. The business is profitable; however, his goal is to have a wholesale shop. Moses intends to use the loan funds to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Lorenza Agustina

texts.es:
Lorenza Agustina H. M. tiene 69 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Lorenza se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando.


Le gusta hacer la limpieza de la casa.
texts.en:
Lorenza Agustina H. M., 69, is married living with her husband and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  She has 6 children.

The members of the LUZ Y PROGRESO (Light & Progress) communal bank are located 20 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  It belongs to the Chillanes canton and the bank is dedicated to farming and other professional jobs.  It has 17 members.

Lorenza is a corn, broad bean, pea and chayote farmer.  She buys her supplies in Chillanes and sells her products in the Chillanes market and in her home settlement.

She is asking for the loan to buy corn, broad bean, pea and chayote seeds.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The face challenges like infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  Her dream is to stay in business.

She enjoys house cleaning.

loans.use: For seeds.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 


She has been operating a fresh water selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors.  Mary faces a major challenge in  seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the loan for 35,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy building materials to extend her apartment.

loans.name: Luis Roberto

texts.es:
A sus 45 años Luis Roberto B. B., por la falta de oportunidades para conseguir empleo y después de haber laborado en algunas ventas ambulantes y gracias a la oportunidad brindada por una amiga, inició con su propio negocio, un carro de comidas rápidas que es su única fuente de sustento. 

Luis Roberto sueña con tener otros puntos de venta con el fin de ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos. Por ahora, este emprendedor necesita de un préstamo para comprar silletería ya que la que tiene actualmente está en malas condiciones, así le podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, además desea comprar mayor cantidad de insumos para tener mayor capacidad de respuesta para los pedidos que le realizan.
texts.en:
At the age of 45 facing the lack of employment opportunities after having worked in ambulatory sales, Luis Roberto B. B. started his own business with help from a friend.  He set up a fast food cart which is his only source of income.

Luis Roberto dreams with having other sales points in order to expand his business and improve his income.  For now, this entrepreneur needs a loan 
to buy tables and chairs because what he has now is in bad condition and he could then offer better customer service.  Besides, he’d like to buy larger amounts of ingredients so that he can meet greater demand of orders placed.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and ingredients.

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees lives in Faisalabad which is a big city located in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its textile industry. She has been living with her family in a two-room brick house in the area of Ghulamabad for the past 20 years. She is a widow and has five sons and a daughter. Her four sons work and remain illiterate due to financial constraints. Her eldest son has a business selling scrap. He provides scrap on order to different factories and other scrap dealers. Three of the other four sons work in a private organization for a low income. Only her youngest son was able to get education till the 4th standard.

Bilqees has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her elder son’s business. With the loan, he will buy scrap such as plastic bottles, iron, used paper, etc., in bulk to meet the demands of his customers and make extra income. Bilqees is hopeful that her son’s 6 years of experience will help him establish his business with the loan investment, and she will be able to marry her daughter (who is now 18 years old) with the help of the increased profits. 

Bilqees is a new loan applicant of Asasah. In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Bilqees.

loans.use: To buy scrap for a scrap business

loans.name: Delmy Magaly

texts.es: Delmy Magaly
texts.en: Delmy Magaly

loans.use: To stock up her store with more basic products.

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Carla Jimena

texts.es:
La señora Carla es socia del banco comunal Las innovadoras del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. Su esposo es policía. 
Lleva recién 2 años perteneciendo al banco comunal, hace un par de meses que alquiló dos puestos en el mercado  numero 2 de la ciudad para poner su tienda de ropas, anteriormente vendía su ropa en su propia casa.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará 2 maniquís, ½ doc. De pantalones para damas, 6 vestidos, faldas, 10 blusas, 6 polos para damas, 6 polos para niños, 3 vestidos para fiesta.
Espera que le vaya bien y tenga para poder seguir trabajando y así dar una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Carla is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Innovadoras” (The Innovators) in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 34 years old, married, and has three young children. Her husband is a policeman. Carla joined the Communal Bank two years ago. Two months ago, she rented two stalls at the Number 2 Market in the city where she has established a clothing shop. Carla previously sold clothes out of her home.

With her new loan of 1200 PEN, Carla will buy two mannequins, a half dozen women’s trousers, six dresses, skirts, ten blouses, six women’s polo shirts, six children’s polo shirts, and three party dresses. Carla expects to do well and keep working so that she can provide her children a good education.

loans.use: Purchase two mannequins, a half dozen women’s trousers, six dresses, skirts, ten blouses, six women’s polo shirts, six children’s polo shirts, and three party dresses

loans.name: Mama

texts.en: Mama B., a divorced high school graduate, is a cosmetics-seller and a seamstress  at Abura near Frami.  Mama, who  has been a seamstress for years, wants to expand her sewing business and so is requesting a loan to buy materials, thread, lining, etc.  She hopes to reinvest her new profits.

loans.use: to buy materials, thread, lining, etc. to enhance her sewing business.

loans.name: Jicayan Group

texts.es:
Grupo “Jícayan” llamado así porque todas las personas que integran este grupo son D. esta localidad que significa “lugar que produce jícaras (tazas)”, es una localidad habitada por indígenas mixteco, además que es una localidad que se dedica a la elaboración D. artesanías D. telares como enaguas y servilletas. Este grupo esta formado por 11 personas que se dedican a diferentes actividades Albina y Elena (elaboración D. enaguas), Rosa y Sofía (venta D. antojitos), Juana, María y Leonarda (venta D. abarrotes), Elvira, Gisela y Adela (elaboración D. servilletas) y Catalino (elaboración D. pizzas).
La representante D. este grupo es la señora Rosa H. M. quien esta casada con el señor Jacobo Hernández, tiene 2 hijos que estudian la primaria. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder comprar insumos como son maíz para las tortillas, carne, jitomate, chile y entre otros ya ella se dedica a la venta D. antojitos como son tacos dorados D. pollo, tacos D. res y enchiladas. Sus ventas las realiza en la primaria D. su localidad.
Otras D. las integrantes del grupo es la señora Juana Jiménez Gómez esta casada con el señor Rogelio H. quien se dedica al campo, tiene 3 hijos que estudian , Juana se dedica a la elaboración D. servilletas y naguas con la técnica D. telar en cintura una actividad que aprendió desD. muy joven ya que ha sido herencia D. sus antepasados, el cual le ah ayudado a sobresalir adelante con L. gastos D. su familia, ya es un actividad que es muy laboriosa pero el resultado es muy bonito ya que son artesanías reconocidas en la regio y que sirven D. vestimenta para muchas personas D. esta región. Ella comenta que le ah ido muy bien en sus ventas ya que ah vendido un poco mas desD. que solicitó el préstamo ya que este le ayudo para poder comprar mas materiales que necesita para su elaboración como son: mantas, hiL. D. colores, hiL. D. algodón, entre otros.
Su sueño mas anhelado es que sus hijos tengan una profesión para que le día D. mañana tengan mejores oportunidades.
Las personas que integran este grupo son muy humilD. y sencillas pero muy trabajadoras ellas están agradecida con las Fundacion por el apoyo que les brindan con el préstamo.
texts.en:
This group is called Jícayan because all of its members are from the village of Jícayan which means "place where jícaras (calabashes) are produced".  This is a village which is inhabited by Mixtec indigenous people.  It is a village whose inhabitants work making handicrafts on looms such as 'enaguas' (traditional skirts) and napkins.

This group has 11 members who all work in different businesses.  Albina and Elana make 'enaguas' (traditional skirts), Rosa and Sofia sell 'antojitos' (traditional Mexican snacks), Juana, Maria and Leonarda sell groceries, Elvira, Gisela and Adela make napkins and Catalino makes pizzas.

This group's representative is Rosa H. M. who is married to Jacobo Hernández and has two children who are attending elementary school.  She requested this loan so that she could buy supplies such as corn for making tortillas, meat, tomatoes, chilis, etc. since she sells snacks such as golden chicken tacos, beef tacos and enchiladas in the elementary school in her village.

Another of the group's members is Juana Jiménez Gómez who is married to Rogelio H., a farmer.  They have three children who are in school.  Juana's business is making napkins and traditional skirts using a backstrap loom.  This is an activity that she learned when she was very young since it was an inheritance from her ancestors.  It has helped her to cover her family expenses.  This is a very laborious task but the result is very beautiful and her handicrafts are recognized throughout the region.  Many people in this region wear these skirts.

Juana tells us that her sales have done very well and she has sold more products since she requested this loan.  The loan helped her to buy more materials that she needs to make her products such as blankets, colored threads, cotton threads, etc.  Her most important dream is for her children to have a profession so that they have better opportunities in life.

The members of this group are very humble and simple but also very hard working.  They are grateful to Fundación Realidad for the support that they have offered them with this loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making snacks

loans.name: Mayra Katherine

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo en el Km # 5 vía Manta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Loma De Los Vientos, aquí la mayoría de su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Mayra, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una niña de seis  años de edad la  misma que estudia en escuela. El marido realiza trabajos de carga en una comercial.
 
Ella es una gran ama de casa que se dedica al comercio en sociedad con su cuñado, venden todo tipo de artículos o mercadería de temporada, en la actualidad están dedicados  a la venta de útiles escolares, tienen un puesto en Manta aunque hay días que también venden en Portoviejo. Trabajan todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 16h00, pero ella solo trabaja hasta las 12h00 ya que tiene que ir  a hacerse cargo de su hija que a esa hora sale de la escuela. La mercadería la compran en Guayaquil.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar útiles escolares  para aprovechar la temporada de entrada a clases. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta ya que los créditos le ayudan mucho en su negocio.

Su sueño es tener casa propia y bien construida.
texts.en:
In the suburbs of Portoviejo, at Km 5 in the direction of Manta, the members of the Loma De Los Vientos (Windy Hill) Community Bank meet every two weeks. It’s an area where people are mainly engaged in agriculture and in raising animals.

23-year old Sra. Mayra is a member of the Bank. She lives with her partner and their 6-year old daughter who attends school. Mayra’s partner works loading freight for a company.

She is an excellent housewife who also runs a business with her brother-in-law selling all kinds of seasonal items. At the moment they are selling school supplies. They have a stall in Manta although sometimes they go to Portoviejo to sell their products. They work every day from 8am to 4pm, although Mayra has to leave at noon to look after her daughter who leaves school at that time. They buy their merchandise in Guayaquil.

Mayra will use the loan to buy school supples and make the most of the upcoming start to the school year. She has been a member of the Bank since the beginning and enjoys it. The loans have helped her greatly with her business. Her dream is to have a well-built house of her own.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Pulekeria

texts.en:
Pulekeria is 22 years old, married and has two children. Pulekeria owns & operates a business running bingo games. She has 1 year of experience in this business. Pulekeria needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase game prizes such as washing powder, snacks, soaps, sacks of flour and sugar. She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2011, Pulekeria joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Pulekeria's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase game prizes such as washing powder, snacks,soaps, sacks of flour and sugar.

loans.name: Luna Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento " LUNA  " se encuentra en su segundo ciclo dentro de la Institución, compuesto por 8  personas en la cual 6 son mujeres y dos varones,  sus actividades están entre venta de comida,  promotora  de cosméticos , venta  de ropa  ,  panadería, venta de cuadros, son de la zona del Plan 3000. El grupo se fundo por la iniciativa de tres socias: La Sra. Aida es la presidenta del banco, se dedica a la panadería ya lleva en esta actividad varios años, vive en casa alquilada  hace 3  años, se levanta desde tempranas horas de la mañana para la elaboración de pan y después lo comercializa entregando a tiendas del barrio ella es muy conocida por las vecinas es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, con el dinero del crédito comprar insumos para la elaboración de pan como harina, manteca levadura, etc., su deseo de la Sra. Aida es la de comprarse su casita propia y así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The “LUNA” (Moon) communal bank is in its second cycle within the Institution.  It has 8 members, 6 women and 2 men.  Among their activities are: food sales, cosmetics sales, clothing sales, bakery, picture sales.  They are all from the Plan 3000 zone.  The group formed through the initiative of three members.

Aida is bank President.  She has had a bakery for several years.  She’s lived in a leased house for the last three years.  She rises very early in the morning to bake bread which she later sells to neighborhood stores.  She is very well known by her neighbors because of her kindness and hard work.

She will use the money from the loan to buy baking supplies like flour, lard, yeast, etc.  Aida’s wish is to buy her own little house to provide her family with more comfort. She is grateful for the support the institution has provided her.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is 53 years old. She has 11 children between the ages of 23 and 40 years old. She is a very hard working mother and she works with her husband. She sells locally made alcohol, made out of sorghum(the brown grains on the ground) and bananas. She has done this business for 6 years and her business is going on well. She is requesting a loan to buy sorghum and green bananas to make the beer.

loans.use: to purchase sorghum and green bananas.

loans.name: Elizabeth
