texts.es: Elizabeth, de 28 años  reside en el caserío de Llanco; ahí formó su familia junto a Jorge de 32 años, su esposo con quien tiene 3 hijos y a los que cuida con mucho amor y cariño en una casa alquilada. La principal actividad económica de la zona es la agricultura, desde niña aprendió a trabajar la tierra y vivir de ella. Desde entonces trabajó sembrando arvejas, papa y flores, en un terreno alquilado; ya son 5 años que se dedica a la agricultura y está muy contenta con su trabajo, ya que viaja constantemente a la capital para vender las verduras que siembra durante el año. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder desarrollar los conocimientos adquiridos de parte de sus padres. Por tal sembrará flores y papa ya que es la temporada donde tiene mayor demanda, “se invierte poco y se gana mucho”, afirma.  Además de tener apoyo de parte de su esposo quien trabaja todos los días en una empresa de la zona. Asimismo Elizabeth se dedica también al cuidado de sus hijos, y por ello trabaja para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a ellos. Por eso está juntando dinero para poder comprar su propio terreno y extender la siembra, así logrará ganar más y comprarse una pequeña casa para su familia. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los ángeles de Llanco” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Elizabeth de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja que sembrará dentro de poco en terrenos con regadillo. Asimismo comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 28 years old and lives in the small village of Llanco.  There she formed her family together with her husband, 32 year-old Jorge.  They have three children who they care for with a lot of love and affection.  They live in a rented house.

The main business activity in this area is farming.  Elizabeth learned to work and live off the land when she was a young girl.  Since then she has worked growing peas, potatoes and flowers on a plot of land which she rents.  She has been working in agriculture for five years and is very happy with her work since she is always traveling to the capital city to sell the vegetables that she grows throughout the year.  What she most enjoys about her work is being able to further develop the knowledge that she gained from her parents.

Elizabeth is going to sow flowers and potatoes since this is the season where there is most demand.  "You invest a little and earn a lot" she tells us.  Elizabeth has the support of her husband who works every day for a company in the area.  Elizabeth also looks after her children and she works to provide them with a better quality of life.  Elizabeth is saving up so that she can buy her own plot of land and extend her sowing.  In this way, she will earn more and be able to buy a small home for her family.

Elizabeth is a member of the "Los Ángeles de Llanco" community bank and this is her first loan with MFP.  She hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  Elizabeth enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.

With your support, Elizabeth will invest the money she is requesting in buying two bags of pea seeds that she will sow soon on irrigated land.  She will also buy several sacks of organic manure and natural fertilizers so that she can give her crops a successful start.

loans.use: to buy bags of pea seeds and several sacks of organic manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil is a 39-year-old married man and a father of three children. He has owned a furniture shop since 1999. He worked hard to open his business and improve it over this period.

Jamil works hard to improve his works' quality, and he works on marketing them as quickly as possible.

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to buy a machine necessary to improve his business, in addition to a power generator. Electricity is a main issue in the area, and he has to reply to customers' needs as fast as he can.

Jamil hopes to buy the requested machines, in addition to having a special future for his family, children and business.

loans.use: to buy a new machine necessary for his business, in addition to a generator.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El señor Miguel trabaja como  operador de máquinas en una empresa grafica de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material educativo (libros) ya que Miguel está estudiando la carrera de diseño grafico. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Fátima en la ciudad de La Paz; Miguel es soltero  y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que Miguel trabaja con nuestra institución y el análisis económico de su flujo de caja le permite ser sujeto de crédito.
texts.en: Miguel works as a machine operator in a graphics company in the city of La Paz.  He needs this loan to buy educational material (books) as he is studying for a degree in graphics design.  He lives in his parents' home in Villa Fátima district, in the city of La Paz.  Miguel is single and doesn't have any children.  This is the first time that he has worked with our institution and an analysis of his current finances show him to be eligible for a loan.

loans.use: to buy books and educational material so that he can continue with his graphic design studies

loans.name: Emee

texts.en:
Emee is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Emee has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & biscuits. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, noodles & detergents.

Emee is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Emee hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles & detergents

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for planting corn

loans.name: Cherry Group

texts.en:
Cherry is married with three children. Cherry is 36 years old and lives in Ramon Magsaysay.

Cherry sells  to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 2000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Cherry has been a member of PMPC for one year. Cherry is the leader of a three person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos es casada, tiene 52 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene un hijo quien la apoya con al trabajo que realiza, ya que se dedica a la confección de camisas de diferentes tamaños, colores y diseños, inició este negocio siendo operaria y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo y producir más camisas, ya que va a comprar telas he hilos, ya que en el futuro espera tener una fabrica grande
texts.en:
Sra. Santos is married and is 52 years old. She never had the opportunity to go to school and has a son who helps her in her work. She makes shirts in different sizes, colors and designs. She started in the business as an employee and at present has 10 years of experience.

She has decided to request a loan in order to expand her working capital and produce more shirts. She will buy fabric and thread. In the future she hopes to have a large factory.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Seif

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26-years-old, single and lives with six family members; three of them work.

Seif has been an owner of a grocery since 2009 and sells all kind of fruits and vegetables. He worked with his father for two years in this field so he gained a good experience. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His shop is located in an area where they are in need for foodstuffs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the area.


He is requesting a $2400 loan in order to make a sliding door, purchase a refrigerator and an electric generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make a sliding door, purchase a refrigerator and an electric generator.

loans.name: Aida Fary

texts.fr: Madame Aida habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et gère un atelier de couture dans un marché de la place non loin de la  localité ou elle habite. Elle est secondée par 2 apprentis.  Elle a d’abord travaillé dans une entreprise  de la place ce qui lui a permis de constater que c’était une activité  porteuse. Pendant les périodes de fête  religieuses son activité est en pleine extension. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2006 et a déjà bénéficié de 3 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs prévu pour l’achat  d’une nouvelle  machine a coudre plus performante. Son objectif est de mieux rentabiliser son activité, maximiser ses bénéfices pour mieux supporter ses besoins personnels.
texts.en: Madame Aida lives in Senegal.  She is 43 years old.  She is married and manages a sewing shop at a market not far from where she lives.   Two apprentices work with her.  She began working at a business in her area which showed her that this was profitable work.  During the religious festivities her work increases considerably.  She has been a member of l’U-IMCEC since November 2006 and has already taken out three previous loans.   She is requesting a loan of 250,000 frs to buy a more sophisticated sewing machine. Her goal is to make her work more profitable and maximize her income to better meet her personal needs.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a 27-year-old who is engaged in the buying and selling of fish.  She already has two years in this kind of business and it has been serving as a source of income for their daily expenses. No day has passed that she would not sell in their community carrying her fish and weighing scale. Even though it is difficult for her, she still continues dealing to her customers and it feels good when she sells all her fishes. She sacrifices for her her two children.

She wanted to lessen her burden and reduce her difficulty in selling as she used to walk every day to get income through fish selling. For this reason,she is asking a loan amount of P5,000 to buy additional fishes of different types to sell in order to earn a higher income than the usual so she could save enough money for her dream service.

She is dreaming to buy a motorcycle that will help her in selling fish every day. She hopes this will be achieved as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy additional fishes of different types to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Arely

texts.es:
Claudia, es empleada de una joyería, vive con su hija, es madre soltera, tiene dos años de trabajar en dicha joyería, es una persona honesta y muy trabajadora, además que tiene la responsabilidad familiar con su hija, para quien tiene que proveer todo lo necesario.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de utensilios para el hogar, plancha, licuadoras, y pagar un saldo pendiente en otra institución, este préstamo le ayudara para tener lo necesario en su hogar y solventar cuentas pendientes.
El objetivo de Claudia es continuar en su empleo, generar ingresos para el hogar y velar por las necesidades de su hija.
texts.en: Claudia is an employee of a jewelry store.  She lives with her daughter and is a single mother.  She has worked in said jewelry store for two years.  She is a very hard-working and honest person, besides the fact that she has the family responsibility for her daughter, for whom she has to provide all that is needed.  At present she requests a loan for the purchase of utensils for the home such as an iron and blender, and to pay a pending balance in another institution, this loan helps her to have the necessary things in her home and to settle outstanding accounts.  Claudia's objective is to continue in her employment, to generate income for the home and to provide for the needs of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy utentils for the home such as an iron and blender and to pay a pending balance

loans.name: Chehadeh

texts.en: Chehadeh is a 27-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. He has owned a mobile shop since 2007 where he sells different types of mobiles and related accessories. Today, he’s asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his merchandise selection and purchase additional cell phones and prepaid cards to sell. He is a smart businessman and strives to work really hard. In the future, he plans to enlarge his business and add new technological devices.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise selection and purchase cell phones and prepaid cards to sell

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is a 47-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children and she has been running a beverage store for 20 years. 

Anh would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverage to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en: Oyungerel is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband is a cab driver, her elder son is employed, and her younger son is a college student. She started her business journey in 2000 by selling meats, however she started selling groceries, which is more profitable, in 2010. She already bought a pick-up truck with the profits from her business. Now that her business is profitable, she rented another counter in the market to run the same business. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my kids are grown, it is time to concentrate on my business." She is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy more grocery products at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products at wholesale prices.

loans.name: C8029 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Elina is 27 years old and is married. She has no children. Her business is well organized and she sells breads. Her business is open from 6am until 6pm every day. She currently employs two people to help her. 

Elina is the leader of the group which is called "C8029 Abishyizehamwe", in the local language. Elina is the first person in this line. She has five years of experience in this work. Elina has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more breads to sell. With this profit, she will save money for her future, to pay her children's school fees and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: to purchase more breads to sell.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en: Felecia is 29 years old, married and lives in Buchanan with five children between 3 and 14 years old. All of them are in school and live at home. For the past fifteen years she has been selling palm oil and used clothes at the market and elsewhere.  She established the business through her mother. She enjoys the idea that her mother gave it to her. Her best trading takes place during traditional holidays and Christmas. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business, In the future, she plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Joffre Antonio

texts.es:
Joffre Antonio tiene 40 años vive en Unión Libre, y vive con su  cónyuge y sus hijos. Vive en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla el recreo  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz, fréjol y soya.
Joffre se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol. Desde hace cinco  años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, líquidos, insumos, fertilizantes  para la siembra del maíz,   El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Su sueño  es poder tener estabilidad económica   para su familia.

En los tiempos libres me gusta  jugar indor y pasar  con toda mi familia.
texts.en:
Joffre Antonio is 40 years old. He lives with his partner and their children. He lives in Recinto San Vicente Las Lomas in the Canton of Ventanas. The "El Recreo" Community Bank is  located in Recinto San Vicente las Lomas that belongs to the Canton of Ventanas. This community bank is dedicated to short term agricultural work such as growing corn, rice, beans and soy beans. For the past five years Joffre has worked in agriculture growing corn and beans. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the market in the same location. 
The loan he is requesting will be used to buy seeds, liquids, supplies and fertilizers in order to grow corn. This loan will help him increase his earnings so that he can support his family. His dream is to have economic stability for his family. 
In his free time he likes to play volleyball and pass time with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, liquids, goods and fertilizers in order to grow corn.

loans.name: Maria Gladis

texts.es: La señora Maria Gladis ha sido una persona reconocida por ser dedicada a su trabajo y a su hogar. A sus 41 años, tiene una hija por la que se esfuerza todos los días por sacar adelante, y poder brindarle todo lo que necesite. Maria Gladis trabaja en una casa de familia, y para generar ingresos extra para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, tiene unas vacas lecheras desde hace algún tiempo. Actualmente una de sus vacas se encuentra enferma y esto le ha traído algunos inconvenientes, sin embargo, el espíritu de lucha de Maria Gladis la ha hecho seguir adelante.
texts.en: María Gladis has been a person recognized for being dedicated to her work and her home.  She is 41 years old and has a daughter for whom she makes the effort every day to get her ahead and be able to give her everything she needs.  María Gladis works in a family home, and for some time she has had dairy cows to generate extra income to cover her household expenses.  Currently one of her cows is sick and this has brought some problems.  Nevertheless, María Gladis's fighting spirit has made her carry on.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Alicia Dominga

texts.es:
Alicia es una mujer muy luchadora, ella ha sacado a delante con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio a su hija de 15 años de edad, la cual actualmente se encuentra estudiando el cuarto año de educación secundaria, ya que por circunstancias muy ajenas se quedo solo apenas nació su hija, Alicia es muy alegre a presar de los contratiempos que le han sucedido, a ella le hubiera encantado estudiar enfermería, pero por los pocos recursos de sus padres solo pudo estudiar hasta el cuarto grado de educación secundaria. Alicia como buena peruana le encanta el conocido platillo “Arroz con Pollo”, ella nos comenta que no hay nadie que la pueda igualar en la preparación.

Alicia es muy buena cocinera y trabaja vendiendo uno de los platos bandera de nuestro país El Ceviche, trabaja alrededor de 7 horas diarias; ella vende su producto en un triciclo al cual le ha adaptado un mostrador para colocar allí el ceviche y mantener la comida con higiene, tiene muchos clientes puede atender en un día alrededor de 30 clientes y a veces tanta es la acogida que se agota muy rápido y muchos clientes se quedan sin ser atendidos.

Actualmente Alicia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá renovar su triciclo en el cual labora y también comprar uno nuevo, para que su hija también la pueda ayudar en la venta del producto, con esta mejora podrá tener mayores ingresos ya que desean ambas ahorrar el suficiente dinero para que puedan cumplir uno de los sueños más grandes que tiene Alicia y es: Darle la carrera de Enfermería Técnica a su hija” y por el cual Alicia no descansara hasta ver hecho realizad su sueño ya que desea que su hija sea mejor que ella.
texts.en:
Alicia is a very tenacious woman who has worked hard and sacrificed a lot in order to provide for her 15-year-old daughter who is currently in the fourth year of her secondary education.  Owing to circumstances beyond her control, Alicia was left alone shortly after her daughter was born.  Alicia is very happy in spite of the setbacks that she has suffered.  She would have loved to have studied to become a nurse but, owing to her parents' limited financial resources, she was only able to study up to the fourth year of her secondary education.

Like all good Peruvians, Alicia loves the well-known dish 'arroz con pollo' (chicken and rice).  She tells us that she has no equal when it comes to preparing this dish.  Alicia is a very good cook and her business is selling one of our country's most important dishes: 'ceviche' (a marinated seafood dish).  She works around 7 hours a day and sells her food from a three-wheeled vehicle to which she has added a counter where she can place the ceviche and keep it in hygienic conditions.  She has many customers.  Every day she is able to serve approximately 30 customers and sometimes the food is so well received that she runs out very quickly and many customers are unable to get served.

Alicia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to renovate the three-wheeled vehicle from which she works and also buy a new one so that her daughter can help her sell her food.  This improvement will enable her to make more income as both she and her daughter want to save up enough money to fulfill one of Alicia's biggest dreams which is to enable her daughter to study for a degree in nursing.  Alicia will not rest until she has seen her dream come true as she wants her daughter to do better than her.

loans.use: to renovate a three-wheeled vehicle (with food counter) and buy a new one

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 34 years old, married and has two children. 

Iman is a seamstress and she is been in this field since 1998. She makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally including suits, coats and trousers for women and kids. She has a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting a $2400 loan to purchase two sewing machines and fabrics. She is aiming to increase her production and gain more profit. This will offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase two sewing machines and fabrics

loans.name: Hawasata

texts.en:
Hawasata is divorced and has one child. After successfully completing middle school, Hawasata is now an established businesswoman. She is a seamstress in Ebubunko (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 15 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Hawasata uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Hawasata will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cloth, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hawasata plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers' preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cloth, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 31 years old. She is an honest, sensible, charismatic, and hard-working woman. She is a wise farmer who is respected by her neighbors and fellow farmers as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, which is in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. 

Norah is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, growing maize and vegetables. She also has dairy cows. Norah has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not discouraged her. She states: “I have to do something for my family." 

Norah joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists smallholder women like her. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Norah is from a remote village that has poor roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) that require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Norah to achieve her dream and reach her goals. 

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Norah feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help women gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. 

The benefits of this loan are many because Norah will never suffer losses due to delays in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. Her income will increase.

Norah is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Norah will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future.

You can be part of this dream. Be inspired and support the life of this super incredible woman with a loan during this festive season!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is 53 year old married woman running a low income private school for many years. This school was started by her family and later on she take up this school as life mission. She shared that this school has faced many challenges such as lack of furniture, rooms and assert for schools. Today, these are almost 156 students at the school and 39 % female studying. She is an efficient and responsible school manager and focuses on providing an inclusive learning environment to her students.  She requested a loan amount 100,000 PKR for school construction and to repair school building.  She feels her school has the potential to grow more and facilitate more community students.

loans.use: for school construction and to repair school building.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil is married. 33-year Kamil is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. Kamil has been engaged in newspaper sales and an lottery sales, to improve his family’s living condition. Having borrowed the 2 loans from Normicro he solved his business problems.
Now he plans to sell office supplies. He applies for a loan amount of $700 to buy the different office supplies.

loans.use: To buy the different office supplies

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married with three children. She lives in the outskirts of Dar es Salaam (Capital city of Tanzania) where water supply is irregular. She dug a well about twelve months ago. She sells water to her neighbors and nearby communities. She currently use a bucket to fetch water from the Well.

She needs an additional capital of USD 1200 to buy an electrical pump and two storage tanks to effectively run her business. Tanks will act as a reservoirs and water treatment points. Water is very important in her area due to usual cholera and amoebic dysentery outbreaks. Dar es Salaam is now in the rainy season.

loans.use: PURCHASE AN ELECTRICAL PUMP AND STORAGE TANKS

loans.name: Santos Irma

texts.en:
My name is Santos L., and I have a store that sells popular consumer products. I have had my business for 2 years, and my clients are excellent. I am located near a bus station, and therefore I get a lot of foot traffic. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to diversify my products and increase my sales and profits. I would like to be able to pay for my daughter to go to school, as she is now nearing the age when children enter into school.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer

Mi nombre es Santos L. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, mis clientes son excelentes ya que estoy ubicada cerca de una estacion de buses, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayor variedad en mis productos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder pagarle el estudio a mi hija que esta en la edad de ingresar a la escuela tambien alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To buy churros, drinks, candy, salt, sugar, butter, oil, bread, juices, ice, sauces, markers, envelopes, paper, milk, butter, cheese and meats.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Born in 1960, Mariana M. is married to a polygamist George M. and has five children. The death of her father left her unable to obtain a secondary education and with little commitment from her polygamous husband to provide basic need for his family, she was led to become a GHAPE member; she now is trained in business management, marketing techniques, and credit discipline. Since 2004, she received loans which she succeeded in investing and repaying. The profit raised was used to provide basic family needs like school fees, medication, and clothing.

Given a loan of $400, she plans to continue selling cooked food. Her restaurant is situated in the motor park where there are many customers including passengers and drivers that provide a ready market for her cooked food. She will repay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase rice, cocoyam, potatoes, fish, beans, corn, and okra

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer is 27 years old and single and lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. He has had his own business for 2 years and has been selling fruits. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to expand his range of fruits and his client base.

loans.use: To expand his range of fruits and client base.

loans.name: Vaeluaga

texts.en: Vaeluaga is married with three kids. She believes that she can make a decent living out of her family’s land, which is why she applied for her loan to buy the necessary products for her plantation business. She sells her crops at the market two times per week and makes a profit of 280 Tala ($112 US) per day, which is very good in her eyes. She hopes to apply for another loan to expand her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: To buy products and tools for her plantation

loans.name: Raheem

texts.en: Mr. Raheem is a 39-year-old married man with two childtren. He is a farmer. He lives with his family in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 1995, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. The work is hard but interesting and takes a lot of effort. Raheem purchases calves, breeds them, cuts and sells to butchers at the local market. At the same time, his income is not enough to cover all of Raheem’s family expenses. To increase his profit margin, Raheem has to invest some money to increase the size of his herd. A loan of $500 will allow him to buy two calves.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Rahman

texts.en: Rahman Y. is 44 years old, married and has three children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Rahman owns a small stand near his home where he and his wife sell household products and vegetables to many people in his neighborhood. Although his stand is very old and not in good shape, he has many loyal customers. However, he is caught in a cycle in which he can only re-stock the products that he sells. Rahman has applied for a loan of $600 to fully stock his shop with a greater variety of goods, maximize sales, and expand his business.

loans.use: To increase inventory to expand business

loans.name: Sulmira

texts.en:
Sulmira G. R. owns a mini-market in the neighborhood of Partido Alta in Tarapoto, San Martin.  She started the store 15 years ago with $300 and a table in her living room.  Now she has a sizeable store which sells goods of primary needs, firewood, meats, fruits, vegetables, candy, and gas in a remodeled garage outside of her house.  She puts her success down to hard work, location, family, and charisma.
Sulmira is now 44 years old, happily married, and has 3 children.  She started the business because she wanted to help her family and she enjoys working.  Everything she does is for her family.  She loves working from home because she gets to spend time with her children.  Her plans for the future are to improve her business and send her youngest child to University.
A member of the community bank Nuestra Sra De La Paz, Sulmira is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 6 months.  With the loan she would like to invest more gas and increase the number of goods she has in stock.

loans.use: With the loan she would like to invest in more gas and increase the number of goods she has in stock.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Jamshed G. lives in Rudaki. He is 26, married, and has 3 children. Jamshed G. works as a policeman in Rudaki. As a supplemental source of income, he also has a cattle farm. Jamshed G. buys the animals at a local market, raises and profitably resells them after 40-45 days. He has been in this business for 3 years. Jamshed G. will use this loan to purchase young bulls. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ганиев Джамшед проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 26 лет . Женат, имеет 3 детей . Образование средне-специальное. По профессии милиционер, работает в ОВД района Рудаки. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо. Покупает товар на рынке района, откармливает около 40-45 дней , а затем перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 3 года. Этот бизнес является дополнительным источником дохода его семьи. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом. Клиент хочет получить кредит для того чтобы закупить молодых бычков. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu is 50 years old and married, with 5 children. She sells beans, rice and palm oil in Makup Bana village. With her previous loans from SMT, she diversified the business, but Isatu wants to be able to consistently provide the food items her customers demand. She needs additional capital to purchase extra food stock so that she can keep her customers coming back!  She is requesting a loan of $350 US  for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchase food items to meet customer demand

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of a collection of oral care products to keep running her small business.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vũ Thị Thiện, 54 years old, lives with her husband and 3 children. Two of them are still in school age and the grown up one has a job with an average wage of 1,500,000 VND a month. It’s been 10 years now that the family’s businesses have been operating a rice mill and raising livestock. She joins the TYM Fund in 2001 and has been taking out loans to invest into her family’s businesses. She raises both pigs for pork and breeding pigs. The rice mill provides everyday income. In average the income is about 3,500,000 VND a month. She is applying for a loan of 15,000,000 VND to invest in her businesses.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Vũ Thị Thiện 54 tuổi sống cùng chồng và 3 con, 2 con đang đi học, 1 con đã đi làm thu nhâp bình quân 1.500.000đ/ tháng, gia đình chị làm máy xay sát gần 10 năm. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2001 với mục đích vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, việc gia đình chị có máy xay sát nên đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn được anh chị lựa chọn là dự án tốt nhất, từ những đồng vốn vay của Quỹ đều được gia đình chị sử dụng hiệu quả, nay mô hình chăn nuôi của gia đình chị đã mở rộng, hiên tại gia đình chị nuôi cả lợn thịt và lợn nái. Làm máy xay sát nên thu nhập của gia đình chị đều đặn hàng ngày. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và tu sửa máy xay sát. Thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Rice mill and livestock

loans.name: Von

texts.en: Mrs. Von S. lives with her husband and their two young children in Thmei Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a chef who cooks food for laborers, while her husband, Mr. Mit Chea, is a construction foreman. Even though Mrs. Von S. and her husband have different income activities, they still cannot afford to repair their old house. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Von S. has decided to ask for a loan to build a new house. In the past Mrs. Von S. has already obtained a loan from AMK that she successfully paid back. She and her husband are pictured inside the frame of their new house.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Gulizor

texts.ru:
Gulizor N. lives in the city of Yavan. She lives in one of the more distant villages. She is a housewife. She raises animals and sells milk. She would like to obtain a loan in order to by a machine to make dairy cream. This will allow her to make dairy products including kaymak. She will be able to sells dairy products to her neighbors at a lower price. This will allow her to improve her own situation and help others. She plans to repay the loan within an 8 months period. Gulizor is 46 years old and she has 6 children.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Норова Гулизор жительниц города Яван. Живет в одном из отдаленных кишлаков. Домохозяйка. Занимается животноводством и продажей молока. Хочет получить кредит и купить аппарат для выжимки сливок. Это даст ей возможность производить кисломолочные продукты , а так же каймака. Она сможет продавать производимую продукцию соседям по низким ценам. Таким образом она поможет себе и близким людям. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев.Гулизор 46 лет и унее есть шестеро детей. У нее очень дружная и веселая семья.

loans.use: Purchase a machine to make dairy cream (separator)

loans.name: Mirzeta

texts.en: Mirzeta I. is 36 years old. She is married and has two high school children. Her husband is employed and he pays for everything his family needs. Mirzeta wants that she, also, should earn and contribute, so she decided she will take a loan from Women for Women International in the amount of 1200 KM ($US900). This loan she will use to buy poultry. Her wish is that her business goes well and she will bring in income before winter.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Wiriasih

texts.id:
Situsi ekonomi yang semakin sulit seperti sekarang ini sangat dirasakan oleh Ni Ketut Wiriasih. Suaminya yang bekerja sebagai seorang petani terkadang penghasilannya tidak mencukupi kebutuhan hidup keluarganya, selain itu Ni Ketut Riasih juga harus membiayai pendidikan anaknya yang sekarang duduk di kelas 2 SMU. Hal ini yang mendorong Ni ketut Wiriasih membantu suaminya memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya dengan beternak babi. Ni Ketut Wiriasih sudah menjalankan usaha ternak babi sejak 10 tahun yang lalu namun karena kekurangan modal usaha yang dialaminya sehingga Ni Ketut Wiriasih mengaku sangat sulit untuk mengembangkan usahanya.
Untuk mengembangkan usahanya Ni Ketut Wiriasih memilih mengikuti progran ternak babi yang dikelola oleh DINARI dengan pinjaman awal yang didapat sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,- jangka waktu pinjaman 6 bulan dan pembayaran dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman, Ni Ketut Wiriasih menggunakan pinjaman tersebut untuk membeli bibit penggemukan dan sisanya akan digunakan untuk membeli pakan. Ni Ketut Wiriasih berharap melalui pendampingan dan pinjaman usaha yang diberikan olah DINARI usahanya bisa lebih berkembang dan hasil yang didapat juga akan lebih meningkat dari keuntungan yang diperoleh sebelumnya.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Wiriasih is feeling impact of increasingly difficulty economic situation. Her husband works as a farmer with uncertain income that is often insufficient to afford the family's need. Ni Ketut Wiriasih also needs to pay for her child's high school tuition fee. This situation motivated Ni Ketut Wiriasih to help her husband earn some income by farming pigs. Ni Ketut Wiriasih has been farming pigs for the past 10 years. However due to insufficient funding, she has ben unable to grow the business. Ni Ketut Wiriasih started joining DINARI's pig farm improvement program. She is currently applying for $575 loan with 6 month tenor. She will be using the loan to purchase feeds. Ni Ketut Wiriasih is hoping that through DINARI's funding and training assistance, she can grow her farm and bring in more earnings to pay for her family's daily needs

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Piglets and feeds

loans.name: Dementria

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Dementria S. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with 1 child who is 9. Dementria has been running a grocery store since 2005.

A Tanzanian grocery store is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, bottled water, tomatoes, soda, chili, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

Dementria works at the business 9 to 12 hours a day and is assisted by her husband. She is requesting a loan of $550 in order to keep up the maintenance of her business as well as expand her business.

Dementria thanks you for her support!

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Celestino Minaya

texts.es:
C. forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Grandes Retos” del distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 31 años de edad, es casada con un profesor y no tiene hijos. Menciona que su principal logro ha sido tener un puesto en el segundo piso puesto 02 del mercado central de Huaraz. Vende ropa y joyas, debido a que la venta en este puesto es lenta, tiene que salir a vender a las casas de sus clientes. Empezó su negocio con S/. 25 y ahora comenta que tiene invertido en todo su negocio aproximadamente entre S/. 5,000 a S/. 6,000 en ropa, zapatos y joyas. Su principal dificultad es que los productos que brinda a crédito no le pagan o no le pagan a tiempo. Afirma que trabaja para ella y que los ingresos que le brinda su esposo son específicamente para la casa.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir para adultos, ropa para niños y zapatos. Todos los productos serán traídos desde las ciudades de Lima y de Trujillo.
 
C. comenta actualmente se encuentra bien en su negocio, pero de todas maneras le encantaría recibir talleres para mejorar su negocio. 
.
texts.en:
C. belongs to the Mujeres de Grandes Retos ["Women Facing Great Challenges"] community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. She is 31 years old, married to a teacher and has no children. She says that her main achievement has been to set up a space on the second level of the central market in Huaraz. She sells clothing and jewelry. Because sales in the market have been slow, she has to go out to her customers' houses to sell. She began her business with S/.25 [25 Peruvian soles] and she tells us that she's invested somewhere between S/.5,000 and S/.6,000 in clothes, shoes and jewelry. The main problem for her is that the products she sells on credit don't pay or only pay over time. She says that she works for herself and her husband's income is specifically for household expenses.

With this loan of S/.3,000, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will invest in buying articles of clothing for adults, children's clothing and shoes. All the products will be brought from the cities of Lima and Trujillo.

C. says that she's doing well with her business now but she would still like to attend workshops designed to help her improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina realiza diferentes actividades comerciales, ya que por ahora vende chamarras pero el crédito será destinado para la compra de papel y botellas que posteriormente vende a las empresas que reciclan ya que por ahora es mejor negocio que el primero y le genera mejores utilidades.
Vive en la zona irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz en alquiler tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Saturnina makes a living selling different kinds of merchandise. She's been selling coats but this loan will be used to buy paper and bottles that she will then sell to recycling companies because that's a better business now and will generate better returns. Saturnina lives in rental housing in the Irpavi neighborhood of La Paz. She has two school-aged children. This is her fourth Impro loan. Her history qualifies her as a premier customer because she has successfully repaid past loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy paper and bottles for sale to recycling companies.

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: Denise A. est une boulangère à Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agée de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Pour donner plus d’élan à son activité, elle souhaite avec ce crédit se faire construire un nouveau four et aussi acheter les  sacs de farine de blé, de sucre et du bois de chauffage. Elle compte sur cette occasion pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Denise A. is a baker in Lomé, the capital of Togo. Aged 35, she is married and the mother of 2 children. To make her business more effective, she wants to use this loan to have a new oven built and also to buy sacks of wheat flour, sugar, and firewood. She is counting on this opportunity to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: building an oven and buying sacks of wheat flour, sugar, and firewood

loans.name: Chaska Group

texts.es:
Este banco se denomina "CHASKA", nombre en quechua, idioma original de los Inkas, que significa "Estrella"; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq de la cuidad del Cusco, cuenta con 11 miembros entre los cuales se tiene a 09 mujeres y 02 varones, Todos ellos con muchas ganas de hacer sus propios negocios y así contrubuir a sus hogares.

Estos socios, desean invertir el préstamo otorgado, en diferentes negocios, 04 socias invertirán en la apertura de un restaurant de comida típica, otras 02 socias en un cafetín y comida rápida, otras 02 socios en la compra de artesanía al por mayor y revender a tiendas minoristas, 01 socia invertirá el préstamo en la compra de 02 licuadoras para su pequeño negocio de juguería en el mercado central, 01 socia para la garantía de alquiler de su nuevo negocio (snack café), 01 socia desea ivertir el dinero prestado en el pago de sus estudios en un instituto de turismo, ella trabaja también medio tiempo, pero el pago de sus mensualidades no le espera a que en su trabajo le paguen.

Los socios agradecen y valoran mucho el apoyo y la ayuda brindada, ya que en otras instituiones de banca financiera, los trámites son muy engorrosos; ellos harán buen uso de ese préstamo y se comprometen a pagar lo solicitado en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
This bank is called “CHASKA” which means “Star” in quechua, the original language of the Inkas. This bank is located in the Wanchaq district of the city of Cusco. It has 11 members, 9 women and 2 men. All are very much looking forward to starting their own businesses and contributing to their households.

These members wish to invest the loan money in different businesses. Four women will invest in opening a restaurant of local food, 2 other women in a small café and fast food and 2 men in the purchase of crafts wholesale to resell to retail stores. One woman will invest the loan in the purchase of 2 blenders for her small juice-drinks business at the central market, 1 woman to guarantee rent for her new business (snack café) and 1 woman wishes to invest the loan money to pay for her studies at a tourism school. She works part time but her monthly payments are due before they pay her at work.

The members are grateful for and value the support and the help offered since the paperwork at other financial institutions is very bothersome. They will make good use of this loan and they promise to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and spices to make foods and purchase material for crafts.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: El señor Juan se dedica ala reparación de zapatos desde hace veinte años, el inicio desde muy joven, con dinero propio y cada día ha ido adquiriendo habilidades y clientela por su buen trabajo. Tiene 51 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles sur, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 14 y 15 años de edad. Su esposa lava y plancha a personas particulares para obtener ingresos para la alimentación de la familia. Sus planes de don Juan es terminar de construir su casa de concreto ya que tiene una parte de piedra y el resto es de tabla y zinc, lo que más desea es poder tener una vivienda digna para su familia. El ha ido poco a poco construyendo su casita con los prestamos que Afodenic ha otorgado este es su sexta solicitud que va invertir en comprar materiales de construcción para seguir levantando las paredes de concreto. Sus objetivos captar más clientela, para mejorar sus ingresos y poder cumplir sus anhelos.
texts.en:
Juan repairs shoes. He started very young, with his own money, and he has been doing this for twenty years. He is skillful, and he gets customers because of his good work. He is 51 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. He and his wife have two children, ages 14 and 15. His wife washes and irons for private individuals to get money to feed the family. Juan plans to finish constructing his house with concrete. Now part of it is made of stone and the rest of boards and iron. What he wants most of all is to be able to have a decent home for his family. Little by little he has been building his house with loans from Afodenic. This is the sixth loan, which he will use to buy construction materials to continue putting up concrete walls. His objective is to get more customers to increase his income in order to reach his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to put up concrete walls on his house

loans.name: 3 De Junio Group

texts.es:
El comité Oñondivepa se formo a partir de la union de varias vecinas del barrio 3 de junio de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Todas las integrantes del comité tienen un trabajo donde invertir el dinero que reciben.  Varias integrantes del comité son artesanas, dedicadas a la confeccion de ropas tradicionales y otros trabajos manuales, asi tambien la gran parte del comité se dedica al micro comercio, ya sea vendiendo ropas, verduras, comidas, etc. 

Maria Cristina D.	Despensa
Adela C.	  Venta de ropas
Delia M.	  Manicurista
 Alicia C.	  Recicladora
Maxima I.	  Venta de ropas
Pablina Gonzalez  Despensa
Benita O.	  Venta de cosmeticos
Felicita R.  Venta de dulces
Norma L.	  Peluquera
Maria V. L.	Costurera
Maria V. T.	Kiosco
Maria M. M.	Venta de carne
Laura C.	Venta de Bebidas
Magda N.	Venta de bebidas
Lisandra S. 	Venta de comidas
Sady Leiva I.   Artesana
Nilda C. F.	   Kiosco
Sandra C. N.	   Venta de ropas
texts.en:
This group was formed when several women from the “3 de junio” neighborhood in Villa Elisa united. Each member has a job where they will invest the money they will receive from this loan. Several of the members are artisans dedicated to making traditional clothing; other work doing manual labor and the majority of the members work in small businesses, selling clothes, vegetables, food, etc. Maria Cristina D. has a small grocery store. Adela C. sells clothing. Delia M. is a manicurist. Alicia C. works in recycling. Maxima I. sells clothing. Pablina Gonzalez has a small grocery store. Benita O. sells cosmetics. Felicita R. sells candy. Norma L. works in a salon. Maria V. L. is a tailor. Maria V. T. has a kiosk. Maria M. M. sells meat. Laura C. sells drinks. Magda N. sells drinks. Lisandra S. sells food. Sady Leiva I. is an artisan. Nilda C. F. has a kiosk. Sandra C. N. sells clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase goods for resale; materials

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience E. sells drinks, provisions and food supplies. Her husband sells medicine. She is 36 years old and married with 4 children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 90,000 NGN to purchase more provisions, drinks and food supplies to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Batbayar S. lives with his wife and three children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Batbayar's wife is a trained hairdresser but recently started staying home due to illness. Batbayar's three children are all high school students. A mini-truck that Batbayar owns is the only source of income for his family. He uses his mini-truck to transport various things. During the summer he uses his mini-truck to carry construction materials when building activity is at its peak. During the winter he carries coal and firewood to individual family's homes. His family now lives in a ger (a round, mobile, felt yurt) on his neighbor's plot of land. He dreams of one day building a house on the plot of land that he hopes to own. Batbayar requests a loan to buy new tires and necessary accessories to fix his mini-truck.

loans.use: To buy new tires and necessary accessories to fix his mini-truck.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La señora Maria Esther, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, vive en el Jr. Prolongación La Merced Nº 316 – Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 70 años y es madre D. 08 hijos, todos ya independientes y con familia ya constituida..

Ah Maria, le encanta trabajar, y a pesar D. su edad, se siente con ganas D. seguir adelante, se dedica a la venta D. viseras D. ganado vacuno y chancho, en este negocio también su esposo es quien la ayuda, cuenta también con una chacra donD. cría sus animales: chanchos y ganados.                                               
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicado en su propia casa, donD. sus principales clientes son los vecinos y amigo D. su barrio.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 comprará  un ganado vacuno para sacrificarlo en el camal y vender su carne y vísceras en kilos. 

Hoy se siente muy feliz del servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos por apoyar a mujeres como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Maria Esther belongs to the “Micaela Bastidas” Cooperative Bank. She lives on La Merced Street, in the Juanjui district of the Mariscal Cáceres province, in San Martín. She is married, 70 years old, and the mother of 8 children who are now living independently and have their own families. Maria loves to work and, despite her age, yearns to continue to get ahead. She dedicates herself to selling cow and pig entrails, and her husband helps her with the business. She also has a farm where she raises her animals: pigs and livestock. She currently continues in the same line of business, which she runs out of her house. Her main customers are neighbors and friends in the area. With this loan of 2,000 soles, she will buy a cow to butcher and sell its meat and entrails by the kilo. Today, she feels very content with the service she provides and thanks Manuela Ramos for supporting women like her that want to work and progress. She hopes that they will continue like this for a long time, and help many women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Sỹ Nguyễn Thị (1615050523) is a 36-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has three school-aged children.

Sỹ owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling metal and metal-related products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month.

In 2005, Sỹ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Sỹ is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 5th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Bikamwa Plus Group

texts.fr: Véronique T. vend du maїs et du manioc devant sa parcelle. Le riz et le haricot étaient les premiers produits alimentaires qu’elle a vendus en 1979. Au fil des années, Véronique a acquit une expérience solide dans cette activité. Le besoin des clients en maїs et en manioc et surtout le bénéfice réalisé, l’ont poussée à opter pour ces nouveaux produits. L’obtention des différents crédits de Hope RDC, ont renforcé son affaire et l’ont aidée à avancer dans la réalisation de son ambition d’ouvrir un jour un dépôt de maїs et de manioc à livrer aux mamans de son quartier. Le prêt qu’elle a  reçu ce mois lui a servi à acheter quelques sacs de mais et de manioc à revendre en vue d’accroitre le revenu. Actuellement, son activité lui génère un bénéfice de $15 par semaine. Véronique est âgée de 59 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 40 et 17 ans. Deux seulement vivent avec eux et sont scolarisés. Tandis que d’autres sont indépendants.
texts.en:
Véronique T. sells maize and manioc in front of her property. Rice and beans were the first foodstuffs she sold in 1979. Over the years, Véronique acquired a solid experience in this business. The fact that her customers need maize and manioc and the profit she makes from these sales pushed her to opt for these new products.

Obtaining various loans from Hope RDC bolstered her business and helped her progress toward achieving her goal of one day opening a depot for maize and manioc that she would deliver to the mothers in her neighborhood. The loan that she has received this month will be used to buy several sacks of maize and manioc for resale so as to increase her profit.

Presently, her business is generating a profit of US$ 15 per week. Véronique is 59, marrried and the mother of 9 children whose ages vary between 40 and 17. Only two live with her and are enrolled in school, whereas the others are all independent.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing several sacks of maize and manioc for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow maize

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is forty-five years old. She is married and has three children. One of  her children is in school, one will enter the university this year and her first child just graduated from the university. Cecilia and her family live in the greater Accra region of Ghana. 

Cecilia makes and sells batik and tye-dye fabrics. Batik and tie-dye are local textile designs in which raffia or waxes are used to prevent pigment (dyes) from getting to undesired areas. She buys raw materials, such as mercerized cotton, caustic soda, etc., from the city. She has been in the business for fifteen years. She hawks (sells door-to-door) in the community. Cecilia wants a loan to buy more raw materials so that she can produce on large scale, trek to more markets, and supply to other regions in Ghana, and even beyond.

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia is a member of the Salvadorean Mothers communal bank. She is 69-years-old and has been of widow for the past 17 years. She has eight children all of whom are married and 3 of which live with her along with their spouses. Alicia began her business selling chicken sandwiches from her home. Her friend and her created a joint venture selling chickens wholesale. She saved enough money to start her own business selling raw chickens and is still successfully doing business. Currently she buys raw chickens wholesale and distributes them to local restaurants with the help of her son. 

Since joining FINCA, she has learned to manage her loans and make payments on time as well as save some of her revenues. Alicia needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in a joint venture with her daughter-in-law opening a shop that sells rice, sugar, and convience goods. Her dream is to grow this new shop into a successful business.

loans.use: invest in a joint venture with her daughter-in-law opening a shop that sells rice, sugar, and convience goods

loans.name: Sulmira

texts.es: La señora Sulmira, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 46 años, 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes que poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  En la actualidad tiene sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con alegría y entusiasmo. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Anhela convertir su bodega en un minimarket y manifiesta que lo va a hacer realidad  porque es una mujer que cuando se propone algo lo cumple.

loans.use: Comprará abarrotes, para aumentar sus productos.

loans.name: Las Bordadoras Group

texts.es: Las señoras Bordadoras acudieron a la Instituciòn ASDIR para poder ayudarlas para tener mejores ingresos ya que ellas se han dedicado a trabajar en bordados de guipiles a mano y esto les han servido como mantener a su familia y a ellas mismas, durante los  5 años que han venido trabajando se han dado cuenta que necesditan màs capital para poder inventir y tener màs ventas en los guipiles bordados  pero ellas no cuentan con ese fondo, ya que el lugar donde vivien es de zona de pobreza, por lo tanto a cuden a peder ayuda para ser conpetitivas en el mercado y asi tener una mejor nivel de vida; y  sacar a sus hijos  avantes y con estudios.
texts.en:
The Bordadoras ladies have come to the Institución ASDIR to be able to get help to have better incomes. They embroider “guipiles” (traditional Mayan blouses) by hand. This has supported them and their families. During the five years that they have been working they have realized that they need more capital to be able to invest and to sell more of the embroidered “guipiles”. They do not have the money. The place where they live is an area of poverty. That is why they come to ask for help to be more competitive in the market. That way they will have a better level of live and get their children ahead with their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente M. is from the village of Cabungaan Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 39 years old. Vicente is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Vicente plants, harvests, and sells corn. Vicente has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Vicente joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicente has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Vicente is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Vicente's second loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for his children's tuition and for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Emeliano

texts.en:
Emeliano V. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. He is 47 years old and married, with 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Emeliano raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for his business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Emeliano has been engaged in his business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Emeliano joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emeliano has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Emeliano is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Emeliano from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es: La cliente Noelia  trabaja en esta actividad desde hace tres años, su esposo se dedica a trabajos de publicidad, forman una pareja joven, aún no tienen hijos,por el momento necesita mayor capital ya que por las fiestas de fin de año ella tiene varios pedidos de electrodomesticos, con el credito anterior ella compro licuadoras y zumidoras; con este, ella pretende comprar DVDs, sandwicheras y otros artefactos que le piden sus clientes. La Sra. vive en la zona los rosales, ubicado aproximadamente a 20 Km de la ciudad de La Paz
texts.en:
Our client Noelia has been in the retail business for three years, while her husband works as a publicist. This young couple does not have any children yet.

At the moment, she needs additional capital in time for the year-end holidays. She has several orders for various electrical appliances. Noelia used her previous loan to buy blenders and juicers. With this loan, she intends to buy DVDs, sandwich makers, and other devices requested by her customers. Noelia lives in Los Rosales district, which is located approximately 20 km from the city of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Salcedo

texts.en:
Salcedo J. is from the village of Eastern Poblacion Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. He is 56 years old. Salcedo is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Salcedo owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish in the local community. Salcedo has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Salcedo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salcedo is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Salcedo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Thomas Tangai

texts.en:
Thomas Tangai, 44, is married to Dorcas, 33, who is a businesswoman. They have four children, ages 12, 10, 8 and 6. 

Thomas is a "jack of all trades" when it comes to business. He runs a greengrocer stand in the open air market at Kangemi, and he also runs two other businesses: a café and a tailoring shop.  He makes a profit of about $330 a month from all his businesses. His grocery business is strategically placed and normally very busy. He says that within 30 minutes he can serve up to 15 customers.

Thomas had never borrowed from another MFI (micro-finance institution), but he was introduced to Kadet by a friend who is a member. He has just applied for his first loan, which he plans to use to add more groceries to his greengrocer stand, to restock his café, to buy more materials for his tailoring shop, and he also wants to buy cereals to sell in his greengrocer business. 

In the future, he hopes to get into the transport business and also to farm for his grocery stand.

loans.use: He wants to restock all his businesses; more groceries for his store, restock items in the cafe and materials for his tailoring shop.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando D. is 39 years old and married with 2 school-aged children, living in the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. To make a living, Armando owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp. Armando has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Armando joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Armando is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Armando from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding his seafood store

loans.name: Imuentiyen

texts.en:
Imuentiyen sells drinks and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to be a major drink distributor in the future.

Imuentiyen needs a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. She hopes to experience an increase in her business. She says a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

Imuentiyen lives in Benin City. She is 27 years old and married with a child. Her husband is a press man.

Imuentiyen is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Los Coquitos Group

texts.es: El grupo Solidario Los Coquitos lo conforman Paz Catalina de 67 años y Mayra Modesta de 36 años. Ambas se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas, por lo que este no es el primer financiamiento que realizan ya que ha sido de gran progreso para las dos. Ellas son personas muy humildes y trabajan para proporcionarles a sus hijos los estudios y alimentos diario, por lo que ellas no tuvieron la oportunidad de estudiar. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. El deseo de ellas es que las personas que siempre están ayudando a otras a salir adelante continúen apoyando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Solidarity Group “Los Coquitos” (The Little Coconuts) consists of Paz Catalina, who is 67 years old, and Mayra Modesta, who is 36 years old. Both women are engaged in different businesses, so this is not the first time they have received financing. They have made great progress as a result.

Both women are humble individuals who work to educate and feed their children since they did not have the opportunity to attend school. The loan being requested will be used as operating capital to purchase raw materials. Their wish is to see people always help one another succeed and continue to support each other in improving their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 41years old and married with five children. Her husband is an auto mechanic. She is a merchant who specializes in selling foodstuffs such as yams, plantains, tomatoes and peppers. She has been in this business for 7 years. She is an LAPO client. Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Juliana hopes for more progress in her business and to use her profits to improve her family’s standard of living. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, de 29 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja y sus 3 menores hijos; juntos buscan que salir adelante a base de mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.

Cada día se despierta al amanecer y se dirige hacia sus campos de maíz, junto con su esposo, para vigilar sus tierras, pues la cosecha futura debe ser muy productiva. La agricultura es una actividad que le genera buenas ganancias que le permite brindar a su familia una adecuada calidad de vida. A Silvia le gusta sembrar en sus tierras, ya que sabe cómo hacerlo, lo que no le gusta son las constantes plagas que muchas veces arruinan gran parte de la cosecha, por eso es necesaria la constante vigilancia. 
Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, ya que ante cualquier emergencia que se le presente puede vender alguno y ganar dinero. Y como es una mujer emprendedora, tiene muchos planes para progresar, entre ellos se encuentra el de comprar mayor cantidad de ganado para continuar en la comercialización, pues obtiene buenas ganancias en este negocio.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible que pueda recibir el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra fertilizantes para asegurar sus tierras, además quiere comprar dos cabezas de ganado que engordará para después verderlos.
texts.en:
Silvia is 29 years old and lives in her own home with her partner and their three dependent children. Together they seek to get ahead on the basis of much effort and work.

Every day Silvia wakes up at dawn to begin work in her cornfields. Both she and her husband look after their land so that they can be assured of a good and productive harvest. Farming generates a decent income that gives her family an adequate quality of life. Silvia enjoys planting seeds because she knows exactly what to do, but she does not like constantly dealing with pests that have ruined a large part of her harvest on several previous occasions. Therefore, it is necessary that she remain vigilant. Silvia also raises cattle. Whenever emergency situations arise, she can always sell a head of cattle to earn some money. Being an enterprising woman, Silvia has many plans to keep progressing. One of her goals is to buy more cattle so that she can continue to sell them, thereby generating more income.

This is her second loan with MFP. Silvia is very grateful to everyone who made it possible to receive this loan that will allow her to continue working. The money will be used to purchase fertilizers for maintaining her land. She will also buy two heads of cattle for fattening and eventual resale.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & two heads of cattle

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el sector 25 de Febrero del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito ubicado al norte de Chiclayo y que se caracteriza por tener a la mayoría de su población en la zona rural. Este distrito queda ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años tiene instalado en su vivienda un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, la idea del negocio surgió de la necesidad de obtener un ingreso económico extra, ya que su esposo trabaja como agricultor y esta actividad no le genera ingresos permanentes.
