El negocio goza de mucha acogida debido a la calidad de los productos que ofrece y al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes, en poco tiempo, el negocio de Paula se ha hecho conocido y está creciendo.

Es por ello que Paula desea ampliarlo para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes para lograr su objetivo.

Paula es una madre trabajadora y bastante emprendedora, su mayor anhelo es hacer crecer su negocio para salir adelante poco a poco. Ella es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Paula is a 44-year-old mother of a family, living with her husband in the 25 de Febrero area of the Mórrope district to the north of Chiclayo. This district, characterized by having the majority of its population in rural areas, is located a half-hour from the city of Chiclayo. Two years ago, Paula installed in her home a small business selling groceries; the idea for the business came from her need to increase her income, since her husband works in agriculture, which cannot generate a regular income. Her business enjoys much popularity thanks to the quality of the products she offers and the good treatment provided to her clients. In a short time, Paula's business has become known and is growing. It is for this reason that Paula wants to enlarge it, to satisfy the demand of her clients, so she has realized the necessity of requesting a first-time loan for $250 from Edpyme Alternativa that she plans to invest in the purchase of basic necessities and groceries in order to achieve her objective. Paula is a hard-working mother, quite enterprising, whose greatest desire is to grow her business to get ahead little by little. She is a well-known and well-regarded woman in the area where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grocery stock

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel A. Araya es un señora  de 47 años de edad quien vive con su esposa e hija  en una pequeña comunidad llamada La Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.

Doña María se dedica a la agricultura, en estos momentos ella se dedica a la siembra de yuca, un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Costa Rica como en otros países.

Actualmente doña María está solicitando un préstamo de ¢600000 (seiscientos mil colones), para ampliar su siembra y así ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del ñame. 
Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto. Con esto desea iniciar un proyecto exitoso que le permita mejorar las condiciones de su familia.


Ella es socia de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su cuarto  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel A. Araya is a 47 year old woman who lives with her husband and daughter in the small community called La Trinchera de Pital in Alajuela Province. The main activities of the region are livestock production and agriculture, with an emphasis on the cultivation of pineapples that are sold primarily to international markets. For this reason, community development has increased in recent years and has generated more demand for goods and services by providing more job opportunities.

Doña María is dedicated to agriculture. At the moment she is growing cassava, a tuber that has a pleasant flavor and is rich in nutrients. Agro-industrial processing of this crop has increased because demand is great in Costa Rica and in other countries.

Doña María is currently requesting a loan of 600,000 CRC to increase her harvest. This will help with preparing the land for planting by purchasing seeds, fertilizers, composts, and other supplies that are necessary to ensure an optimum output. With this investment, she hopes for a good harvest that produces a product with the appropriate features that will command a higher sales price. The start of a successful project will allow her to improve the conditions for her family.

Doña María is a member of Communal Enterprise of the Successful Women of La Trinchera de Pital, one of 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her fourth loan and she hopes to continue growing personally and financially. She also actively participates in her local credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of her farmland for growing cassava

loans.name: Las Poderosas (The Powerful Ones) Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Poderosas” esta representado por el señor Jorge Alberto y compuesto de 10 miembros, de las cuales 6 son mujeres y 4 son varones,  este grupo se caracteriza por su unidad y sus ganas de trabajar ya que se conocen bastante bien, la mayoría vive por la zona. El señor Jorge Alberto es soltero y actualmente vive en  anticrítico, el se dedica a la atención de su propio local de eventos, el requiere el préstamo para el arreglo y refacción de su local para poder abrirlo con servicio de comida los fines de semana e iniciar un negocio mas fructífero, su mayor deseo es poder formar una familia con su novia y poderle dar un techo propio donde vivir. El resto del grupo tiene diferentes actividades como la venta de ropa, celular, cosmética por catálogos, venta de verduras, servicio de cerrajería y transporte publico de pasajeros. A pesar del alto nivel competitivo los socios son conocidos por su trabajo y esfuerzo y la calidad del servicio que otorgan a sus clientes. Muchos de los socios desean el crédito para ampliar sus negocios, para el alquiler de locales para sus negocios, compra de mercadería e insumos para sus puestos de venta. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias se encuentran en su primer ciclo con la institución y muchas no tienen experiencia en créditos solidarios pero si tiene muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante trabajando para sustentar a sus familias y darles un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
The group "The Powerful Ones" is represented by Mr. Jorge Alberto and is composed of 10 members, 6 women and 4 men. This group is characterized by their unity and their desire to work. They already know each other well since the majority live in the same area. Jorge Alberto is single and currently lives in an rental property. He works at his own events center and needs a loan to repair and improve his center in order to open it with food service on the weekends and begin a more prosperous business. His greatest desire is to be able to form a family with his fiancée and be able to provide a place of their own to live. The other members of the group work in various activities such as the sale of clothing, the sale of cell phones, catalog cosmetics, vegetables, locksmith service, and public passenger transport. In spite of the high level of competition the members are known for their work and effort and the quality of service they provide to their clients. Many of the members want the loan to expand their businesses, to rent space for their businesses, and to purchase merchandise and supplies for their sales locations. Regarding their experience, the members are in their first loan cycle with the institution and many do not have experience in group loans but they have a strong desire to work and get ahead by working to sustain their families and provide them with a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe A., 48 years old owns a small rice farm. This helps her buy the things that her family needs, like food, clothes and other basic necessities. She said that if she will not work hard on her farm, she won’t get anything for her family. Now, she is having difficulty in maintaining her 1-hectare farm because of financial constraints in the family. She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 9,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies, fertilizer.

loans.name: Chun

texts.en: Chun L., 27, is single and resides with her family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat temples. She is a singer, earning an income of about US $7 per day. Her brother is a waiter at a hotel, earning an income of US $4 per day to help cover the family expenses.  L. is requesting a loan of US $1000 to buy a motorbike to commute to work and wood to repair the house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to open a food shop. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Binta D. est âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAYOUF-PALAL depuis le 15 aout 2000 et a bénéficié 23 fois de suite de crédit et n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. C’est un membre fidèle et très assidu et qui cultive un esprit de solidarité dans le groupe. Elle fait du petit commerce de poissons séchés, d’arachide et de haricot local. Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d’investissement afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale et contribuer à l’amélioration de conditions de vie de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
Binta D., 38, is married and the mother of five children, still in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of BAYOUF-PALAL since August 15, 2000 and has received 23 consecutive loans and has never had a problem with reimbursing them. She is a faithful and very assiduous member who helps to create a spirit of solidarity in the group. Binta D. sells dried fish, peanuts, and local beans. Her loan will permit her to expand her working capital so that she can make more profit and help her husband to support their family and contribute to improved living conditions for her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: develop and promote her income-generating business

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Mr. Prum S., age 35, and his wife, Mrs. Kimsan Pong, age 32, have been married since 1992 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Three of them attend school and other two are still young. He also has his mother living with him. They are living along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Prum is not in the photo, but his wife was available instead. 

Prum has been a fisherman since 1990. His wife sells flowers and fish that her husband caught at Prek Phnao market, about four kilometers from her house. But, now she has stopped her business for a while because she just delivered a baby. Besides the business, the couple grows rice as well. 

Prum does not have his own boat and the boat that he uses to fish every day belongs to his relative. So he is requesting his first loan of US$ 300 to purchase his own boat.

loans.use: To purchase a boat to use for his fishing business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia A. is from the village of Buracan, Bonifacio. She is 40 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Delia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as coffee, candies, Milo (a milk beverage), shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Delia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: La Sra. Salome vive en la localidad de la Guardia en el Barrio Monte Alto,  tiene domicilio propio, su actividad es el comercio productos medicinales, el destino del crédito fue para comprar mercadería como se manzanilla seca, sangre de grado, romero, etc, estas plantas son muy usadas para tratar distintos malestares ya que es parte de nuestra tradicio andina; La Sra. Salome tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, la Sra. es Madre soltera y esta actividad  es su única fuente de ingreso, para sostener a su familia, hace dos años que  vive en la comunidad,  su vivienda lo  adquirió en base a financiamiento, lo cual tiene que alternar varios negocios que le generen ingresos para poder sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Salome lives in the “La Guardia” area of the Monte Alto neighborhood. She has her own home and sells natural medicinal products. She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise, such as dried chamomile, “dragon’s blood” resin, rosemary, etc. These plants are used to treat different ailments and are a part of our Andean culture. Ms. Salome is a single mother and has three school aged children. This activity is her only source of income with which she supports her family. She’s been living in the neighborhood for two years and acquired her home through financing. She must alternate between various businesses in order to generate the income she needs to move her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian vive en la casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, zona Río Seco. El es artesano y tiene su propio taller donde realiza fajas y correctores de espalda es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El no tiene hijos. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de material de trabajo como tela, ligas y láminas de acero el cual le permitirá incrementar su mercadería.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Cristian lives with his parents and their home is located in the city of El Alto, in the Rio Seco district. He is a tailor and he has his own shop where he crafts skirts and back supports. This is his primary source of income. He does not have any children. This loan will be used to purchase material to work with, such as fabrics, elastics, and steel plates. It will permit him to increase his merchandise for sale. This is his first loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase material to work with, such as fabrics, elastics, and steel plates

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 50 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijas. Hace más de 35 años vende pescado, en donde cada madrugada desde las 3:00am espera al distribuidor de pescados, en el centro de acopio llamado “El Pesquero”, y es ahí donde se instala para vender, donde sus clientes, siendo comerciantes pequeños compran al por mayor para dirigirse a sus puntos de ventas en diversos sitios de la ciudad. Una de sus cualidades como comerciante es que siempre vende al peso exacto. Se siente satisfecha por su negocio que  desempeña; ya que con estas ganancias pudo forjar el taller de costura, donde laboran sus hijos. Sus planes en el futuro, es equiparse con otras maquinas mas sofisticadas, que realicen  buenos acabados en las costura, y con el tiempo pueda dejar la venta de pescado. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. Con el crédito que solicita, incrementará la cantidad de este producto perecible, de esa manera podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isabel is 50 years old and is a hard working mother. She lives in her own home, along with her husband and four daughters. She’s been selling fish for more than 35 years. Every morning at 3:00 AM, she waits for the distributor at the central collection point, known as “El Pesquero” (the fish place). This is also where she sets up to sell, and where her customers, small businessmen, buy in bulk to distribute to their own points of sale within the city. One of her work qualities is that she always sells by exact weight. She is satisfied with her business, and her profits allowed her to start the tailor shop where her children work. Her future plans are to get new sturdier sewing machines that produce good products and be able to leave behind her fish selling business. This will be her seventh loan through MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time. She will use the money from this loan to buy larger amounts of her perishable product, in order to meet her customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish

loans.name: Gulbar

texts.en:
Gulbar A. is the resident of Balykchi, a nice city in Isykul region. Gulbar is 44 years old and she is married. She has two daughters and two sons, the first daughter and the first son study at university, the second daughter is at school and the second son is preschool age (under seven). Ten years ago, with the initial investment of 5000 soms, Gulbar started to sell cookies at the market, and then she saved some money, rented a pavilion and began to sell toys and children’s clothes. In this way she makes 15000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to save money and purchase a vehicle. She also pays for her children’s education at university. Gulbar is applying for a loan because she needs money to purchase more toys and clothes in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she wants to expand her business and open her own store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase toys.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en: Consolacion C. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 62 years old, married and has five children. She is from the village of Disud. Consolacion has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Consolacion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Consolacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase products to sell. Consolacion is requesting a new loan of 12,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 14th loan from PMPC. She plans to use additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de 5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, sont toutes mariées, mères 9 enfants et vivent dans le village de  Guelekoro dans des grandes familles traditionnelles, dans la préfecture de SAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). 
Elles font le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et excellent dans l’achat vente du poisson sous plusieurs formes à l’image de la présidente du groupe DIKORE G.. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, le groupe  a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année  et est à son premier prêt. 
DIKORE G. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 paniers de poisons dont 8 frais et 2 fumées qu’elle revendra sur place aux revendeurs venant des grandes villes, surtout au comptant. 
Elle espère  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel  de 15.000 FCFA qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son  activité.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of 5 women who know one another through marital and neighborly ties.  They are, on average, 46 years old, all married, the mothers of 9 children and live in the village of Guelekoro in large traditional families, in the SAN prefecture (in the Ségou region of the Republic of Mali).
They have run small businesses for several years and they excel in the sale of fish, prepared in many ways, following the image of the group's president, Dikore G..  With the hope of meeting the growing needs of their customers, the group has decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program this year and on their first loan.  

Dikore G. expects to use her loan to buy 10 baskets of fish, 8 of which will be fresh and 2 smokes, that she will resell there to resellers coming from large cities, especially for cash.  She expects to make a monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA which will permit her to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh and smoked fish

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta is from Lahore which is Pakistan’s second largest city and famous for its food and culture.  She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family. She is 42 years old and is married to M. Y..  She has two sons and a daughter. 

Shagufta is a seamstress and sews clothes for orders from her neighboring clients to financially support her family.  She is very good at her art and receives orders regularly. 

Her husband is blacksmith.  He makes iron rods and sells them through his shop.  He also supplies iron rods to different building constructors. He is an expert in his work and due to his quality work, people who come to buy iron rods from him become his permanent customers.  

Shagufta’s eldest son lives in Dubai and works there as a computer operator.  Her two younger children are getting their education studying in college. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. He will utilize the loan money to purchase iron in larger quantities to make more iron rods for completing his customers' orders.  Shagufta is hopeful that this investment will be a profitable experience for her husband’s business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she had responsibly paid her installments on time and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, Shagufta is the lady who is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy iron in larger quantities for making iron rods to sell

loans.name: Cesar Armando

texts.es: El sr. Cesar Armando es una persona honrada y muy trabajadora, es muy humilde,el es una perosna luchona, es  una persona que de el dependen 3 niñas el vive solo, y tiene todas las ganas de salir adelante en su trabajo ya que de el depende sus hijas el trabaja lavando carros todo el dia necesita este dinero por que necesita comprar una bomba de agua,  para su negocio ya que su principal meta es sobresalir y luchar por el bien de toda su familia.
texts.en: Cesar Armando is an honest and very hardworking person.  He is also very humble and perseverant and has three girls who are his dependents.  He lives alone and has a lot of desire to progress with his work because his daughters depend upon him.  He works washing cars all day and needs this loan because he wants to purchase a water pump for his business because his primary goal is to excel and work hard for the good of all of his family.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump for washing cars.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el sector Punto Nueve, una zona rural que tiene como principal actividad económica a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Mochumí, a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, ella cría pavos, pollos y cerdos en la parte posterior de su domicilio alimentándoles de granos pastos naturales, quincenalmente los comercializa en el mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Con este negocio ella apoya a su esposo, que es albañil, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Santos desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más animales y alimento balanceado de ese modo planea mejorar su nivel de ventas y su calidad de vida. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Santos is a mother, is 49 years old, and lives with her husband and their three children in the town of Punto Nueve, a rural area where the main economic activity is agriculture. It is located in the district of Mochumí, more than half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells small animals, such as turkeys, chickens, and pigs in the back yard of her house. She feeds them natural grain and grasses. Every two weeks, she sells them in the Moshoqueque market in the city of Chiclayo. Through this business she helps her husband, who is a mason, to provide for their family.

Santos would like to expand her business by obtaining more animals and feed. In this way, she plans to improve her sales and quality of life. In order to achieve her goal, she is requesting a loan of PEN 1,500.00 from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy more animals and feed to expand her business of raising and selling small animals.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angélica es madre de una hija, madre soltera dedicada  a trabajar para el pan de cada día.  
Su trabajo es de docente de primaria en donde lleva años laborando. Lo que ha ido comprando materiales de construcción para hacer su casa de concreto ya que es de zinc. Con el apoyo de Afodenic es que ha logrado su comienzo. Con el crédito anterior su meta era comenzar la obra pero debido a que se enfermo y fue operada de vesícula no logro terminar. Y parte del dinero lo compro en medicamentos.
Lo que con este nuevo financiamiento comenzara su obra el poder comenzar a construir su casa. Que es su objetivo para un techo mejor. Ya tiene parte de materiales lo que comprara bloques, hierro, cemento, tablas entre otros y comenzar.
texts.en:
Angélica is a single mother with one daughter who works hard to make her daily bread.  She works as an elementary school teacher and has been in the job for years.  She has been buying building materials to rebuild her house from concrete since it is currently made from corrugated metal.  With the support of Afodenic she has managed to start this process.  Angélica's goal with her previous loan was to begin the job but she became ill, needed to have a gallbladder operation and consequently didn't manage to finish it.  Part of her loan money had to be used to buy medicine.

With this new loan, Angélica will start work on building her house.  Her goal is to have a better home.  She already has some of the materials and she will now buy blocks, iron, cement, floorboards, etc. and begin the job.

loans.use: To buy building materials so that she can start to build her house from concrete

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Nataly; ella tiene 27 años de edad es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ollas, sartenes, tazas, cubrecamas, sabanas entre otros ella viaja hasta la ciudad de lima para comprar su mercadería y luego lo distribuye a sus clientes que le solicitan la socia trabaja en forma ambulatoria.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nataly is a member of the communal bank, "Siempre Adelante" ("Always Moving Forward"). The bank is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Nataly is a 27-year-old single woman with one son. Her work varies from day to day. She buys and sells pots, skillets, cups, bedspreads, and sheets, among other items. She travels to the city of Lima to buy her products and then distributes them to the customers who requested them. Her business does not have a fixed location.

Nataly is requesting this loan in order to buy more merchandise for her business. She is glad to have the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANDENES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irene; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, venta de verduras y crianza de animales menores, la socia tiene un pequeño terreno de cultivo donde cultiva papa, maíz, zanahorias, cebollas y otras verduras, la socia vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en la provincia de Urubamba, distrito de Yucay, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de verduras y animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras y animales.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Los Andenes communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Irene is 52 years old, married, and has one child. She alternates her daily activities with her business in farming, vegetable sales and raising young animals. She has a small piece of farmland where she grows potatoes, corn, carrots, onions and other vegetables. Irene makes her sales in different markets in the province of Urubamba and in the Yucay district. She wants to improve her business selling vegetables and animals and is requesting the loan to purchase these.

Irene is happy for the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and animals

loans.name: Sarwar's Group

texts.en:
Sarwar is 39 years old, married to M. R., and has 5 children. Her eldest son is a rickshaw driver, while 3 of the remaining four are getting their education. Her husband is a fruit seller. He sells different seasonal fruits from his shop, which is located in the market. He is known for his good quality products that he sells to his customers. He has been operating this business for over 12 years. 

Sarwar is a hardworking lady, runs a paper envelope-selling business. She does this work to support her family financially. She takes orders from stationary shops and earns well by completing them. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase more seasonal fruits to offer for sale at his shop. Sarwar is hopeful that, through this investment, her husband’s business will grow further and increase his monthly income. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes that it will be a good experience for her. She in the city called Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan and famous for its food and culture. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raising hand is Sarwar”.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits for fruit-selling business.

loans.name: Muzamil's Group

texts.en:
Muzamil belongs to the small colony named Muzafarabad which is located in the city of Arifwala.  Arifwala is a small city of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry.  She has been living there in a 2 room brick house for the past 26 years. 

She is 33 years old, married to A. M. and has 4 children.  Three of them are studying in school and the youngest one stays at home. 
Muzamil is a housewife and spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities.  She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

Her husband is involved in a food sales business.  He specifically sells breakfast item like Nan Chanay (made with chick peas and served with bread and salad) from a four-wheeled cart.  Muzamil helps him by preparing the food items that he sells in public places.  He has been operating this business for the past 16 years and has developed a good reputation among his clients.  He earns a good profit from this business everyday.
  
Muzamil has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further expand her husband’s business.  With the loan, he will buy the required ingredients such as chick peas, spices, cooking oil, etc. needed to make the Nan Chanay in larger quantity which will help him sell more to his clients and earn more profits.  She is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for her husband and will help him make his business more profitable.  
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application.  In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Muzamil.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for food selling business

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S., 42, is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. sells fruits, earning an income of approximately $3.50 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about $6.60 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $120 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more construction supplies to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy supplies for her husband's construction business

loans.name: Emilia Apolonia

texts.es:
Emilia de 59 años, es una mujer trabajadora que realiza manualidades a base de fomix, papeles, y otras herramientas. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que desea seguir trabajando haciendo manualidades. Vende a un costo bajo muñecos con fomix, cartulina etc. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. En el futuro tiene muchas metas pero por ahora quiere continuar con su negocio comprando con el préstamo fomix, pinturas y materiales.
texts.en:
Emilia is a 59 year-old, hard-working woman who makes crafts using fomix, paper and other tools.

One day she hopes to  have her own business because she would like to continue in this line of work.  She sells dolls made from fomix and cardboard paper at very low prices.  She works from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. every day.  She has many goals for the future but for now wants to continue with her activity by using the loan to buy fomix, paint and materials.

loans.use: To buy Fomix and paint

loans.name: Jorgelina Soledad

texts.es:
La Sra. Jorgelina G. de 30 años de edad es costurera y trabaja con su madre hace más de 10 años, empezó trabajando en una fábrica y que con mucho esfuerzo logró comprar su primera máquina.
Actualmente posee 2 máquinas de coser con los que trabaja día a día  para sacar adelante a toda su familia.
Ha decidido confiar en la Fundación Paraguaya y en Kiva solicitando el préstamo para la compra de una nueva máquina, ya que actualmente con el inicio de clases cuenta con un gran número de pedidos.
texts.en:
Jorgelina G. is 30 years old.  She is a dressmaker and has been working with her mother for more than 10 years.  She started out working in a factory and, through a lot of hard work, managed to buy her first machine.  She currently owns two sewing machines which she uses every day to get her family ahead in life.

Jorgelina has decided to request a loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva in order to buy a new machine since the school year is beginning right now and she has a large number of orders.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a Ugandan man aged 40, who needs a loan to buy bicycle spare parts, salt, sugar and other groceries for resell in his retail shop. He hails from Kyenjojo, Uganda, and he is a father of six children. He lives in a semi-permanent house with 9 people that he takes care of and he dreams of acquiring land to set up a good livestock farm and educating his children. He acquired his initial capital from growing maize that he sold and he still faces a problem of unstable prices of products.

loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts, salt, sugar and other groceries for resale
